80/// Command-line colors: one chunk
81///
82/// Defines a region which has the same highlighting.
83typedef struct {
84 int start; ///< Colored chunk start.
85 int end; ///< Colored chunk end (exclusive, > start).
86 int attr; ///< Highlight attr.
87} CmdlineColorChunk;
88
89/// Command-line colors
90///
91/// Holds data about all colors.
92typedef kvec_t(CmdlineColorChunk)struct { size_t size; size_t capacity; CmdlineColorChunk *items
; } CmdlineColors;
93
94/// Command-line coloring
95///
96/// Holds both what are the colors and what have been colored. Latter is used to
97/// suppress unnecessary calls to coloring callbacks.
98typedef struct {
99 unsigned prompt_id; ///< ID of the prompt which was colored last.
100 char *cmdbuff; ///< What exactly was colored last time or NULL.
101 CmdlineColors colors; ///< Last colors.
102} ColoredCmdline;
103
104/// Keeps track how much state must be sent to external ui.
105typedef enum {
106 kCmdRedrawNone,
107 kCmdRedrawPos,
108 kCmdRedrawAll,
109} CmdRedraw;
110
111/*
112 * Variables shared between getcmdline(), redrawcmdline() and others.
113 * These need to be saved when using CTRL-R |, that's why they are in a
114 * structure.
115 */
116struct cmdline_info {
117 char_u *cmdbuff; // pointer to command line buffer
118 int cmdbufflen; // length of cmdbuff
119 int cmdlen; // number of chars in command line
120 int cmdpos; // current cursor position
121 int cmdspos; // cursor column on screen
122 int cmdfirstc; // ':', '/', '?', '=', '>' or NUL
123 int cmdindent; // number of spaces before cmdline
124 char_u *cmdprompt; // message in front of cmdline
125 int cmdattr; // attributes for prompt
126 int overstrike; // Typing mode on the command line. Shared by
127 // getcmdline() and put_on_cmdline().
128 expand_T *xpc; // struct being used for expansion, xp_pattern
129 // may point into cmdbuff
130 int xp_context; // type of expansion
131 char_u *xp_arg; // user-defined expansion arg
132 int input_fn; // when TRUE Invoked for input() function
133 unsigned prompt_id; ///< Prompt number, used to disable coloring on errors.
134 Callback highlight_callback; ///< Callback used for coloring user input.
135 ColoredCmdline last_colors; ///< Last cmdline colors
136 int level; // current cmdline level
137 struct cmdline_info *prev_ccline; ///< pointer to saved cmdline state
138 char special_char; ///< last putcmdline char (used for redraws)
139 bool_Bool special_shift; ///< shift of last putcmdline char
140 CmdRedraw redraw_state; ///< needed redraw for external cmdline
141};
142/// Last value of prompt_id, incremented when doing new prompt
143static unsigned last_prompt_id = 0;
144
145// Struct to store the viewstate during 'incsearch' highlighting.
146typedef struct {
147 colnr_T vs_curswant;
148 colnr_T vs_leftcol;
149 linenr_T vs_topline;
150 int vs_topfill;
151 linenr_T vs_botline;
152 int vs_empty_rows;
153} viewstate_T;
154
155// Struct to store the state of 'incsearch' highlighting.
156typedef struct {
157 pos_T search_start; // where 'incsearch' starts searching
158 pos_T save_cursor;
159 viewstate_T init_viewstate;
160 viewstate_T old_viewstate;
161 pos_T match_start;
162 pos_T match_end;
163 bool_Bool did_incsearch;
164 bool_Bool incsearch_postponed;
165 int magic_save;
166} incsearch_state_T;
167
168typedef struct command_line_state {
169 VimState state;
170 int firstc;
171 long count;
172 int indent;
173 int c;
174 int gotesc; // TRUE when <ESC> just typed
175 int do_abbr; // when TRUE check for abbr.
176 char_u *lookfor; // string to match
177 int hiscnt; // current history line in use
178 int save_hiscnt; // history line before attempting
179 // to jump to next match
180 int histype; // history type to be used
181 incsearch_state_T is_state;
182 int did_wild_list; // did wild_list() recently
183 int wim_index; // index in wim_flags[]
184 int res;
185 int save_msg_scroll;
186 int save_State; // remember State when called
187 char_u *save_p_icm;
188 int some_key_typed; // one of the keys was typed
189 // mouse drag and release events are ignored, unless they are
190 // preceded with a mouse down event
191 int ignore_drag_release;
192 int break_ctrl_c;
193 expand_T xpc;
194 long *b_im_ptr;
195} CommandLineState;
196
197typedef struct cmdline_info CmdlineInfo;
198
199/// The current cmdline_info. It is initialized in getcmdline() and after that
200/// used by other functions. When invoking getcmdline() recursively it needs
201/// to be saved with save_cmdline() and restored with restore_cmdline().
202static struct cmdline_info ccline;
203
204static int cmd_showtail; // Only show path tail in lists ?
205
206static int new_cmdpos; // position set by set_cmdline_pos()
207
208/// currently displayed block of context
209static Array cmdline_block = ARRAY_DICT_INIT{ .size = 0, .capacity = 0, .items = ((void*)0) };
210
211/*
212 * Type used by call_user_expand_func
213 */
214typedef void *(*user_expand_func_T)(const char_u *, int, typval_T *);
215
216static histentry_T *(history[HIST_COUNT(HIST_DEBUG + 1)]) = { NULL((void*)0), NULL((void*)0), NULL((void*)0), NULL((void*)0), NULL((void*)0) };
217static int hisidx[HIST_COUNT(HIST_DEBUG + 1)] = { -1, -1, -1, -1, -1 }; // lastused entry
218static int hisnum[HIST_COUNT(HIST_DEBUG + 1)] = { 0, 0, 0, 0, 0 };
219// identifying (unique) number of newest history entry
220static int hislen = 0; // actual length of history tables
221
222/// Flag for command_line_handle_key to ignore <C-c>
223///
224/// Used if it was received while processing highlight function in order for
225/// user interrupting highlight function to not interrupt command-line.
226static bool_Bool getln_interrupted_highlight = false0;
227
228// "compl_match_array" points the currently displayed list of entries in the
229// popup menu. It is NULL when there is no popup menu.
230static pumitem_T *compl_match_array = NULL((void*)0);
231static int compl_match_arraysize;
232// First column in cmdline of the matched item for completion.
233static int compl_startcol;
234static int compl_selected;

240static handle_T cmdpreview_bufnr = 0;
241static long cmdpreview_ns = 0;

243static int cmd_hkmap = 0; // Hebrew mapping during command line
244
245static void save_viewstate(viewstate_T *vs)
246 FUNC_ATTR_NONNULL_ALL
247{
248 vs->vs_curswant = curwin->w_curswant;
249 vs->vs_leftcol = curwin->w_leftcol;
250 vs->vs_topline = curwin->w_topline;
251 vs->vs_topfill = curwin->w_topfill;
252 vs->vs_botline = curwin->w_botline;
253 vs->vs_empty_rows = curwin->w_empty_rows;
254}
255
256static void restore_viewstate(viewstate_T *vs)
257 FUNC_ATTR_NONNULL_ALL
258{
259 curwin->w_curswant = vs->vs_curswant;
260 curwin->w_leftcol = vs->vs_leftcol;
261 curwin->w_topline = vs->vs_topline;
262 curwin->w_topfill = vs->vs_topfill;
263 curwin->w_botline = vs->vs_botline;
264 curwin->w_empty_rows = vs->vs_empty_rows;
265}
266
267static void init_incsearch_state(incsearch_state_T *s)
268{
269 s->match_start = curwin->w_cursor;
270 s->did_incsearch = false0;
271 s->incsearch_postponed = false0;
272 s->magic_save = p_magic;
273 clearpos(&s->match_end);
274 s->save_cursor = curwin->w_cursor; // may be restored later
275 s->search_start = curwin->w_cursor;
276 save_viewstate(&s->init_viewstate);
277 save_viewstate(&s->old_viewstate);
278}
279
280/// Completion for |:checkhealth| command.
281///
282/// Given to ExpandGeneric() to obtain all available heathcheck names.
283/// @param[in] idx Index of the healthcheck item.
284/// @param[in] xp Not used.
285static char *get_healthcheck_names(expand_T *xp, int idx)
286{
287 static Object names = OBJECT_INIT{ .type = kObjectTypeNil };
288 static unsigned last_gen = 0;
289
290 if (last_gen != last_prompt_id || last_gen == 0) {
291 Array a = ARRAY_DICT_INIT{ .size = 0, .capacity = 0, .items = ((void*)0) };
292 Error err = ERROR_INIT{ .type = kErrorTypeNone, .msg = ((void*)0) };
293 Object res = nlua_exec(STATIC_CSTR_AS_STRING("return vim.health._complete()")((String) { .data = "return vim.health._complete()", .size = sizeof
("return vim.health._complete()") - 1 }), a, &err);
294 api_clear_error(&err);
295 api_free_object(names);
296 names = res;
297 last_gen = last_prompt_id;
298 }
299
300 if (names.type == kObjectTypeArray && idx < (int)names.data.array.size) {
301 return names.data.array.items[idx].data.string.data;
302 }
303 return NULL((void*)0);
304}
305
306// Return true when 'incsearch' highlighting is to be done.
307// Sets search_first_line and search_last_line to the address range.
308static bool_Bool do_incsearch_highlighting(int firstc, int *search_delim, incsearch_state_T *s,
309 int *skiplen, int *patlen)
310 FUNC_ATTR_NONNULL_ALL
311{
312 char *cmd;
313 cmdmod_T save_cmdmod = cmdmod;
314 char *p;
315 bool_Bool delim_optional = false0;
316 int delim;
317 char *end;
318 char *dummy;
319 exarg_T ea;
320 pos_T save_cursor;
321 bool_Bool use_last_pat;
322 bool_Bool retval = false0;
323
324 *skiplen = 0;
325 *patlen = ccline.cmdlen;
326
327 if (!p_is || cmd_silent) {
328 return false0;
329 }
330
331 // by default search all lines
332 search_first_line = 0;
333 search_last_line = MAXLNUM;
334
335 if (firstc == '/' || firstc == '?') {
336 *search_delim = firstc;
337 return true1;
338 }
339 if (firstc != ':') {
340 return false0;
341 }
342
343 emsg_off++;
344 memset(&ea, 0, sizeof(ea));
345 ea.line1 = 1;
346 ea.line2 = 1;
347 ea.cmd = (char *)ccline.cmdbuff;
348 ea.addr_type = ADDR_LINES;
349
350 parse_command_modifiers(&ea, &dummy, true1);
351 cmdmod = save_cmdmod;
352
353 cmd = skip_range(ea.cmd, NULL((void*)0));
354 if (vim_strchr("sgvl", *cmd) == NULL((void*)0)) {
355 goto theend;
356 }
357
358 // Skip over "substitute" to find the pattern separator.
359 for (p = cmd; ASCII_ISALPHA(*p)(((unsigned)(*p) >= 'A' && (unsigned)(*p) <= 'Z'
) || ((unsigned)(*p) >= 'a' && (unsigned)(*p) <=
'z')); p++) {}
360 if (*skipwhite(p) == NUL'\000') {
361 goto theend;
362 }
363
364 if (STRNCMP(cmd, "substitute", p - cmd)strncmp((char *)(cmd), (char *)("substitute"), (size_t)(p - cmd
)) == 0
365 || STRNCMP(cmd, "smagic", p - cmd)strncmp((char *)(cmd), (char *)("smagic"), (size_t)(p - cmd)) == 0
366 || STRNCMP(cmd, "snomagic", MAX(p - cmd, 3))strncmp((char *)(cmd), (char *)("snomagic"), (size_t)((((p - cmd
)>(3))?(p - cmd):(3)))) == 0
367 || STRNCMP(cmd, "vglobal", p - cmd)strncmp((char *)(cmd), (char *)("vglobal"), (size_t)(p - cmd)
) == 0) {
368 if (*cmd == 's' && cmd[1] == 'm') {
369 p_magic = true1;
370 } else if (*cmd == 's' && cmd[1] == 'n') {
371 p_magic = false0;
372 }
373 } else if (STRNCMP(cmd, "sort", MAX(p - cmd, 3))strncmp((char *)(cmd), (char *)("sort"), (size_t)((((p - cmd)
>(3))?(p - cmd):(3)))) == 0) {
374 // skip over ! and flags
375 if (*p == '!') {
376 p = skipwhite(p + 1);
377 }
378 while (ASCII_ISALPHA(*(p = skipwhite((char *)p)))(((unsigned)(*(p = skipwhite((char *)p))) >= 'A' &&
(unsigned)(*(p = skipwhite((char *)p))) <= 'Z') || ((unsigned
)(*(p = skipwhite((char *)p))) >= 'a' && (unsigned
)(*(p = skipwhite((char *)p))) <= 'z'))) {
379 p++;
380 }
381 if (*p == NUL'\000') {
382 goto theend;
383 }
384 } else if (STRNCMP(cmd, "vimgrep", MAX(p - cmd, 3))strncmp((char *)(cmd), (char *)("vimgrep"), (size_t)((((p - cmd
)>(3))?(p - cmd):(3)))) == 0
385 || STRNCMP(cmd, "vimgrepadd", MAX(p - cmd, 8))strncmp((char *)(cmd), (char *)("vimgrepadd"), (size_t)((((p -
cmd)>(8))?(p - cmd):(8)))) == 0
386 || STRNCMP(cmd, "lvimgrep", MAX(p - cmd, 2))strncmp((char *)(cmd), (char *)("lvimgrep"), (size_t)((((p - cmd
)>(2))?(p - cmd):(2)))) == 0
387 || STRNCMP(cmd, "lvimgrepadd", MAX(p - cmd, 9))strncmp((char *)(cmd), (char *)("lvimgrepadd"), (size_t)((((p
- cmd)>(9))?(p - cmd):(9)))) == 0
388 || STRNCMP(cmd, "global", p - cmd)strncmp((char *)(cmd), (char *)("global"), (size_t)(p - cmd)) == 0) {
389 // skip over "!/".
390 if (*p == '!') {
391 p++;
392 if (*skipwhite(p) == NUL'\000') {
393 goto theend;
394 }
395 }
396 if (*cmd != 'g') {
397 delim_optional = true1;
398 }
399 } else {
400 goto theend;
401 }
402
403 p = skipwhite(p);
404 delim = (delim_optional && vim_isIDc(*p)) ? ' ' : *p++;
405 *search_delim = delim;
406 end = (char *)skip_regexp((char_u *)p, delim, p_magic, NULL((void*)0));
407
408 use_last_pat = end == p && *end == delim;
409 if (end == p && !use_last_pat) {
410 goto theend;
411 }
412
413 // Don't do 'hlsearch' highlighting if the pattern matches everything.
414 if (!use_last_pat) {
415 char c = *end;
416 int empty;
417
418 *end = NUL'\000';
419 empty = empty_pattern((char_u *)p);
420 *end = c;
421 if (empty) {
422 goto theend;
423 }
424 }
425
426 // found a non-empty pattern or //
427 *skiplen = (int)((char_u *)p - ccline.cmdbuff);
428 *patlen = (int)(end - p);
429
430 // parse the address range
431 save_cursor = curwin->w_cursor;
432 curwin->w_cursor = s->search_start;
433 parse_cmd_address(&ea, &dummy, true1);
434 if (ea.addr_count > 0) {
435 // Allow for reverse match.
436 if (ea.line2 < ea.line1) {
437 search_first_line = ea.line2;
438 search_last_line = ea.line1;
439 } else {
440 search_first_line = ea.line1;
441 search_last_line = ea.line2;
442 }
443 } else if (cmd[0] == 's' && cmd[1] != 'o') {
444 // :s defaults to the current line
445 search_first_line = curwin->w_cursor.lnum;
446 search_last_line = curwin->w_cursor.lnum;
447 }
448
449 curwin->w_cursor = save_cursor;
450 retval = true1;
451theend:
452 emsg_off--;
453 return retval;
454}
455
456// May do 'incsearch' highlighting if desired.
457static void may_do_incsearch_highlighting(int firstc, long count, incsearch_state_T *s)
458{
459 pos_T end_pos;
460 proftime_T tm;
461 searchit_arg_T sia;
462 int skiplen, patlen;
463 char_u next_char;
464 char_u use_last_pat;
465 int search_delim;
466
467 // Parsing range may already set the last search pattern.
468 // NOTE: must call restore_last_search_pattern() before returning!
469 save_last_search_pattern();
470
471 if (!do_incsearch_highlighting(firstc, &search_delim, s, &skiplen,
472 &patlen)) {
473 restore_last_search_pattern();
474 finish_incsearch_highlighting(false0, s, true1);
475 return;
476 }
477
478 // if there is a character waiting, search and redraw later
479 if (char_avail()) {
480 restore_last_search_pattern();
481 s->incsearch_postponed = true1;
482 return;
483 }
484 s->incsearch_postponed = false0;
485
486 if (search_first_line == 0) {
487 // start at the original cursor position
488 curwin->w_cursor = s->search_start;
489 } else if (search_first_line > curbuf->b_ml.ml_line_count) {
490 // start after the last line
491 curwin->w_cursor.lnum = curbuf->b_ml.ml_line_count;
492 curwin->w_cursor.col = MAXCOL;
493 } else {
494 // start at the first line in the range
495 curwin->w_cursor.lnum = search_first_line;
496 curwin->w_cursor.col = 0;
497 }
498 int found; // do_search() result
499
500 // Use the previous pattern for ":s//".
501 next_char = ccline.cmdbuff[skiplen + patlen];
502 use_last_pat = patlen == 0 && skiplen > 0
503 && ccline.cmdbuff[skiplen - 1] == next_char;
504
505 // If there is no pattern, don't do anything.
506 if (patlen == 0 && !use_last_pat) {
507 found = 0;
508 set_no_hlsearch(true1); // turn off previous highlight
509 redraw_all_later(SOME_VALID35);
510 } else {
511 int search_flags = SEARCH_OPT0x10 + SEARCH_NOOF0x80 + SEARCH_PEEK0x800;
512 ui_busy_start();
513 ui_flush();
514 emsg_off++; // So it doesn't beep if bad expr
515 // Set the time limit to half a second.
516 tm = profile_setlimit(500L);
517 if (!p_hls) {
518 search_flags += SEARCH_KEEP0x400;
519 }
520 if (search_first_line != 0) {
521 search_flags += SEARCH_START0x100;
522 }
523 ccline.cmdbuff[skiplen + patlen] = NUL'\000';
524 memset(&sia, 0, sizeof(sia));
525 sia.sa_tm = &tm;
526 found = do_search(NULL((void*)0), firstc == ':' ? '/' : firstc, search_delim,
527 ccline.cmdbuff + skiplen, count,
528 search_flags, &sia);
529 ccline.cmdbuff[skiplen + patlen] = next_char;
530 emsg_off--;
531 if (curwin->w_cursor.lnum < search_first_line
532 || curwin->w_cursor.lnum > search_last_line) {
533 // match outside of address range
534 found = 0;
535 curwin->w_cursor = s->search_start;
536 }
537
538 // if interrupted while searching, behave like it failed
539 if (got_int) {
540 (void)vpeekc(); // remove <C-C> from input stream
541 got_int = false0; // don't abandon the command line
542 found = 0;
543 } else if (char_avail()) {
544 // cancelled searching because a char was typed
545 s->incsearch_postponed = true1;
546 }
547 ui_busy_stop();
548 }
549
550 if (found != 0) {
551 highlight_match = true1; // highlight position
552 } else {
553 highlight_match = false0; // remove highlight
554 }
555
556 // first restore the old curwin values, so the screen is
557 // positioned in the same way as the actual search command
558 restore_viewstate(&s->old_viewstate);
559 changed_cline_bef_curs();
560 update_topline(curwin);
561
562 if (found != 0) {
563 pos_T save_pos = curwin->w_cursor;
564
565 s->match_start = curwin->w_cursor;
566 set_search_match(&curwin->w_cursor);
567 validate_cursor();
568 end_pos = curwin->w_cursor;
569 s->match_end = end_pos;
570 curwin->w_cursor = save_pos;
571 } else {
572 end_pos = curwin->w_cursor; // shutup gcc 4
573 }
574 //
575 // Disable 'hlsearch' highlighting if the pattern matches
576 // everything. Avoids a flash when typing "foo\|".
577 if (!use_last_pat) {
578 next_char = ccline.cmdbuff[skiplen + patlen];
579 ccline.cmdbuff[skiplen + patlen] = NUL'\000';
580 if (empty_pattern(ccline.cmdbuff) && !no_hlsearch) {
581 redraw_all_later(SOME_VALID35);
582 set_no_hlsearch(true1);
583 }
584 ccline.cmdbuff[skiplen + patlen] = next_char;
585 }
586
587 validate_cursor();
588 // May redraw the status line to show the cursor position.
589 if (p_ru && (curwin->w_status_height > 0 || global_stl_height() > 0)) {
590 curwin->w_redr_status = true1;
591 }
592
593 update_screen(SOME_VALID35);
594 highlight_match = false0;
595 restore_last_search_pattern();
596
597 // Leave it at the end to make CTRL-R CTRL-W work. But not when beyond the
598 // end of the pattern, e.g. for ":s/pat/".
599 if (ccline.cmdbuff[skiplen + patlen] != NUL'\000') {
600 curwin->w_cursor = s->search_start;
601 } else if (found != 0) {
602 curwin->w_cursor = end_pos;
603 }
604
605 msg_starthere();
606 redrawcmdline();
607 s->did_incsearch = true1;
608}
609
610// When CTRL-L typed: add character from the match to the pattern.
611// May set "*c" to the added character.
612// Return OK when calling command_line_not_changed.
613static int may_add_char_to_search(int firstc, int *c, incsearch_state_T *s)
614 FUNC_ATTR_NONNULL_ALL
615{
616 int skiplen, patlen;
617 int search_delim;
618
619 // Parsing range may already set the last search pattern.
620 // NOTE: must call restore_last_search_pattern() before returning!
621 save_last_search_pattern();
622
623 // Add a character from under the cursor for 'incsearch'
624 if (!do_incsearch_highlighting(firstc, &search_delim, s, &skiplen,
625 &patlen)) {
626 restore_last_search_pattern();
627 return FAIL0;
628 }
629 restore_last_search_pattern();
630
631 if (s->did_incsearch) {
632 curwin->w_cursor = s->match_end;
633 *c = gchar_cursor();
634 if (*c != NUL'\000') {
635 // If 'ignorecase' and 'smartcase' are set and the
636 // command line has no uppercase characters, convert
637 // the character to lowercase
638 if (p_ic && p_scs
639 && !pat_has_uppercase(ccline.cmdbuff + skiplen)) {
640 *c = mb_tolower(*c);
641 }
642 if (*c == search_delim
643 || vim_strchr((p_magic ? "\\~^$.*[" : "\\^$"), *c) != NULL((void*)0)) {
644 // put a backslash before special characters
645 stuffcharReadbuff(*c);
646 *c = '\\';
647 }
648 return FAIL0;
649 }
650 }
651 return OK1;
652}
653
654static void finish_incsearch_highlighting(int gotesc, incsearch_state_T *s, bool_Bool call_update_screen)
655{
656 if (s->did_incsearch) {
657 s->did_incsearch = false0;
658 if (gotesc) {
659 curwin->w_cursor = s->save_cursor;
660 } else {
661 if (!equalpos(s->save_cursor, s->search_start)) {
662 // put the '" mark at the original position
663 curwin->w_cursor = s->save_cursor;
664 setpcmark();
665 }
666 curwin->w_cursor = s->search_start; // -V519
667 }
668 restore_viewstate(&s->old_viewstate);
669 highlight_match = false0;
670
671 // by default search all lines
672 search_first_line = 0;
673 search_last_line = MAXLNUM;
674
675 p_magic = s->magic_save;
676
677 validate_cursor(); // needed for TAB
678 redraw_all_later(SOME_VALID35);
679 if (call_update_screen) {
680 update_screen(SOME_VALID35);
681 }
682 }
683}
684
685/// Internal entry point for cmdline mode.
686///
687/// @param count only used for incremental search
688/// @param indent indent for inside conditionals
689/// @param init_ccline clear ccline first
690static uint8_t *command_line_enter(int firstc, long count, int indent, bool_Bool init_ccline)
691{
692 // can be invoked recursively, identify each level
693 static int cmdline_level = 0;
694 cmdline_level++;
695
696 bool_Bool save_cmdpreview = cmdpreview;
697 cmdpreview = false0;
698 CommandLineState state = {
699 .firstc = firstc,
700 .count = count,
701 .indent = indent,
702 .save_msg_scroll = msg_scroll,
703 .save_State = State,
704 .ignore_drag_release = true1,
705 };
706 CommandLineState *s = &state;
707 s->save_p_icm = vim_strsave(p_icm);
708 init_incsearch_state(&s->is_state);
709 CmdlineInfo save_ccline;
710 bool_Bool did_save_ccline = false0;
711
712 if (ccline.cmdbuff != NULL((void*)0)) {
713 // Currently ccline can never be in use if init_ccline is false.
714 // Some changes will be needed if this is no longer the case.
715 assert(init_ccline)((void) sizeof ((init_ccline) ? 1 : 0), __extension__ ({ if (
init_ccline) ; else __assert_fail ("init_ccline", "/home/runner/work/doc/doc/neovim/src/nvim/ex_getln.c"
, 715, __extension__ __PRETTY_FUNCTION__); }));
716 // Being called recursively. Since ccline is global, we need to save
717 // the current buffer and restore it when returning.
718 save_cmdline(&save_ccline);
719 did_save_ccline = true1;
720 } else if (init_ccline) {
721 memset(&ccline, 0, sizeof(struct cmdline_info));
722 }
723
724 if (s->firstc == -1) {
725 s->firstc = NUL'\000';
726 s->break_ctrl_c = true1;
727 }
728
729 // start without Hebrew mapping for a command line
730 if (s->firstc == ':' || s->firstc == '=' || s->firstc == '>') {
731 cmd_hkmap = 0;
732 }
733
734 ccline.prompt_id = last_prompt_id++;
735 ccline.level = cmdline_level;
736 ccline.overstrike = false0; // always start in insert mode
737
738 assert(indent >= 0)((void) sizeof ((indent >= 0) ? 1 : 0), __extension__ ({ if
(indent >= 0) ; else __assert_fail ("indent >= 0", "/home/runner/work/doc/doc/neovim/src/nvim/ex_getln.c"
, 738, __extension__ __PRETTY_FUNCTION__); }));
739
740 // set some variables for redrawcmd()
741 ccline.cmdfirstc = (s->firstc == '@' ? 0 : s->firstc);
742 ccline.cmdindent = (s->firstc > 0 ? s->indent : 0);
743
744 // alloc initial ccline.cmdbuff
745 alloc_cmdbuff(indent + 50);
746 ccline.cmdlen = ccline.cmdpos = 0;
747 ccline.cmdbuff[0] = NUL'\000';
748
749 ccline.last_colors = (ColoredCmdline){ .cmdbuff = NULL((void*)0),
750 .colors = KV_INITIAL_VALUE{ .size = 0, .capacity = 0, .items = ((void*)0) } };
751 sb_text_start_cmdline();
752
753 // autoindent for :insert and :append
754 if (s->firstc <= 0) {
755 memset(ccline.cmdbuff, ' ', (size_t)s->indent);
756 ccline.cmdbuff[s->indent] = NUL'\000';
757 ccline.cmdpos = s->indent;
758 ccline.cmdspos = s->indent;
759 ccline.cmdlen = s->indent;
760 }
761
762 if (cmdline_level == 50) {
763 // Somehow got into a loop recursively calling getcmdline(), bail out.
764 emsg(_(e_command_too_recursive)gettext((char *)(e_command_too_recursive)));
765 goto theend;
766 }
767
768 ExpandInit(&s->xpc);
769 ccline.xpc = &s->xpc;
770
771 if (curwin->w_p_rlw_onebuf_opt.wo_rl && *curwin->w_p_rlcw_onebuf_opt.wo_rlc == 's'
772 && (s->firstc == '/' || s->firstc == '?')) {
773 cmdmsg_rl = true1;
774 } else {
775 cmdmsg_rl = false0;
776 }
777
778 msg_grid_validate();
779
780 redir_off = true1; // don't redirect the typed command
781 if (!cmd_silent) {
782 gotocmdline(true1);
783 redrawcmdprompt(); // draw prompt or indent
784 ccline.cmdspos = cmd_startcol();
785 if (!msg_scroll) {
786 msg_ext_clear(false0);
787 }
788 }
789 s->xpc.xp_context = EXPAND_NOTHING;
790 s->xpc.xp_backslash = XP_BS_NONE0;
791#ifndef BACKSLASH_IN_FILENAME
792 s->xpc.xp_shell = false0;
793#endif
794
795 if (ccline.input_fn) {
796 s->xpc.xp_context = ccline.xp_context;
797 s->xpc.xp_pattern = (char *)ccline.cmdbuff;
798 s->xpc.xp_arg = (char *)ccline.xp_arg;
799 }
800
801 // Avoid scrolling when called by a recursive do_cmdline(), e.g. when
802 // doing ":@0" when register 0 doesn't contain a CR.
803 msg_scroll = false0;
804
805 State = MODE_CMDLINE0x08;
806
807 if (s->firstc == '/' || s->firstc == '?' || s->firstc == '@') {
808 // Use ":lmap" mappings for search pattern and input().
809 if (curbuf->b_p_imsearch == B_IMODE_USE_INSERT(-1)) {
810 s->b_im_ptr = &curbuf->b_p_iminsert;
811 } else {
812 s->b_im_ptr = &curbuf->b_p_imsearch;
813 }
814
815 if (*s->b_im_ptr == B_IMODE_LMAP1) {
816 State |= MODE_LANGMAP0x20;
817 }
818 }
819
820 setmouse();
821 ui_cursor_shape(); // may show different cursor shape
822
823 init_history();
824 s->hiscnt = hislen; // set hiscnt to impossible history value
825 s->histype = hist_char2type(s->firstc);
826 do_digraph(-1); // init digraph typeahead
827
828 // If something above caused an error, reset the flags, we do want to type
829 // and execute commands. Display may be messed up a bit.
830 if (did_emsg) {
831 redrawcmd();
832 }
833
834 // Redraw the statusline in case it uses the current mode using the mode()
835 // function.
836 if (!cmd_silent && msg_scrolled == 0) {
837 bool_Bool found_one = false0;
838
839 FOR_ALL_WINDOWS_IN_TAB(wp, curtab)for (win_T *wp = ((curtab) == curtab) ? firstwin : (curtab)->
tp_firstwin; wp != ((void*)0); wp = wp->w_next) {
840 if (*p_stl != NUL'\000' || *wp->w_p_stlw_onebuf_opt.wo_stl != NUL'\000') {
841 wp->w_redr_status = true1;
842 found_one = true1;
843 }
844 }
845 if (found_one) {
846 redraw_statuslines();
847 }
848 }
849
850 did_emsg = false0;
851 got_int = false0;
852 s->state.check = command_line_check;
853 s->state.execute = command_line_execute;
854
855 TryState tstate;
856 Error err = ERROR_INIT{ .type = kErrorTypeNone, .msg = ((void*)0) };
857 bool_Bool tl_ret = true1;
858 save_v_event_T save_v_event;
859 dict_T *dict = get_v_event(&save_v_event);
860 char firstcbuf[2];
861 firstcbuf[0] = (char)(firstc > 0 ? firstc : '-');
862 firstcbuf[1] = 0;
863
864 if (has_event(EVENT_CMDLINEENTER)) {
865 // set v:event to a dictionary with information about the commandline
866 tv_dict_add_str(dict, S_LEN("cmdtype")("cmdtype"), (sizeof("cmdtype") - 1), firstcbuf);
867 tv_dict_add_nr(dict, S_LEN("cmdlevel")("cmdlevel"), (sizeof("cmdlevel") - 1), ccline.level);
868 tv_dict_set_keys_readonly(dict);
869 try_enter(&tstate);
870
871 apply_autocmds(EVENT_CMDLINEENTER, firstcbuf, firstcbuf, false0, curbuf);
872 restore_v_event(dict, &save_v_event);
873
874 tl_ret = try_leave(&tstate, &err);
875 if (!tl_ret && ERROR_SET(&err)((&err)->type != kErrorTypeNone)) {
876 msg_putchar('\n');
877 msg_printf_attr(HL_ATTR(HLF_E)highlight_attr[(int)(HLF_E)]|MSG_HIST0x1000, (char *)e_autocmd_err, err.msg);
878 api_clear_error(&err);
879 redrawcmd();
880 }
881 tl_ret = true1;
882 }
883 may_trigger_modechanged();
884
885 state_enter(&s->state);
886
887 if (has_event(EVENT_CMDLINELEAVE)) {
888 tv_dict_add_str(dict, S_LEN("cmdtype")("cmdtype"), (sizeof("cmdtype") - 1), firstcbuf);
889 tv_dict_add_nr(dict, S_LEN("cmdlevel")("cmdlevel"), (sizeof("cmdlevel") - 1), ccline.level);
890 tv_dict_set_keys_readonly(dict);
891 // not readonly:
892 tv_dict_add_bool(dict, S_LEN("abort")("abort"), (sizeof("abort") - 1),
893 s->gotesc ? kBoolVarTrue : kBoolVarFalse);
894 try_enter(&tstate);
895 apply_autocmds(EVENT_CMDLINELEAVE, firstcbuf, firstcbuf, false0, curbuf);
896 // error printed below, to avoid redraw issues
897 tl_ret = try_leave(&tstate, &err);
898 if (tv_dict_get_number(dict, "abort") != 0) {
899 s->gotesc = 1;
900 }
901 restore_v_event(dict, &save_v_event);
902 }
903
904 cmdmsg_rl = false0;
905
906 ExpandCleanup(&s->xpc);
907 ccline.xpc = NULL((void*)0);
908
909 finish_incsearch_highlighting(s->gotesc, &s->is_state, false0);
910
911 if (ccline.cmdbuff != NULL((void*)0)) {
912 // Put line in history buffer (":" and "=" only when it was typed).
913 if (s->histype != HIST_INVALID
914 && ccline.cmdlen
915 && s->firstc != NUL'\000'
916 && (s->some_key_typed || s->histype == HIST_SEARCH)) {
917 add_to_history(s->histype, ccline.cmdbuff, true1,
918 s->histype == HIST_SEARCH ? s->firstc : NUL'\000');
919 if (s->firstc == ':') {
920 xfree(new_last_cmdline);
921 new_last_cmdline = vim_strsave(ccline.cmdbuff);
922 }
923 }
924
925 if (s->gotesc) {
926 abandon_cmdline();
927 }
928 }
929
930 // If the screen was shifted up, redraw the whole screen (later).
931 // If the line is too long, clear it, so ruler and shown command do
932 // not get printed in the middle of it.
933 msg_check();
934 msg_scroll = s->save_msg_scroll;
935 redir_off = false0;
936
937 if (!tl_ret && ERROR_SET(&err)((&err)->type != kErrorTypeNone)) {
938 msg_putchar('\n');
939 msg_printf_attr(HL_ATTR(HLF_E)highlight_attr[(int)(HLF_E)]|MSG_HIST0x1000, (char *)e_autocmd_err, err.msg);
940 api_clear_error(&err);
941 }
942
943 // When the command line was typed, no need for a wait-return prompt.
944 if (s->some_key_typed && tl_ret) {
945 need_wait_return = false0;
946 }
947
948 set_string_option_direct("icm", -1, s->save_p_icm, OPT_FREE,
949 SID_NONE(-6));
950 State = s->save_State;
951 if (cmdpreview != save_cmdpreview) {
952 cmdpreview = save_cmdpreview; // restore preview state
953 redraw_all_later(SOME_VALID35);
954 }
955 setmouse();
956 ui_cursor_shape(); // may show different cursor shape
957 sb_text_end_cmdline();
958
959theend:
960 xfree(s->save_p_icm);
961 xfree(ccline.last_colors.cmdbuff);
962 kv_destroy(ccline.last_colors.colors)do { xfree((ccline.last_colors.colors).items); ((ccline.last_colors
.colors).size = (ccline.last_colors.colors).capacity = 0, (ccline
.last_colors.colors).items = 0); } while (0);
963
964 char_u *p = ccline.cmdbuff;
965
966 if (ui_has(kUICmdline)) {
967 ui_call_cmdline_hide(ccline.level);
968 msg_ext_clear_later();
969 }
970
971 cmdline_level--;
972
973 if (did_save_ccline) {
974 restore_cmdline(&save_ccline);
975 } else {
976 ccline.cmdbuff = NULL((void*)0);
977 }
978
979 return p;
980}
981
982static int command_line_check(VimState *state)
983{
984 redir_off = true1; // Don't redirect the typed command.
985 // Repeated, because a ":redir" inside
986 // completion may switch it on.
987 quit_more = false0; // reset after CTRL-D which had a more-prompt
988
989 did_emsg = false0; // There can't really be a reason why an error
990 // that occurs while typing a command should
991 // cause the command not to be executed.
992
993 cursorcmd(); // set the cursor on the right spot
994 ui_cursor_shape();
995 return 1;
996}
997
998static int command_line_execute(VimState *state, int key)
999{
1000 if (key == K_IGNORE(-((253) + ((int)(KE_IGNORE) << 8))) || key == K_NOP(-((253) + ((int)(KE_NOP) << 8)))) {
1001 return -1; // get another key
1002 }
1003
1004 CommandLineState *s = (CommandLineState *)state;
1005 s->c = key;
1006
1007 if (s->c == K_EVENT(-((253) + ((int)(KE_EVENT) << 8))) || s->c == K_COMMAND(-((253) + ((int)(KE_COMMAND) << 8))) || s->c == K_LUA(-((253) + ((int)(KE_LUA) << 8)))) {
1008 if (s->c == K_EVENT(-((253) + ((int)(KE_EVENT) << 8)))) {
1009 state_handle_k_event();
1010 } else if (s->c == K_COMMAND(-((253) + ((int)(KE_COMMAND) << 8)))) {
1011 do_cmdline(NULL((void*)0), getcmdkeycmd, NULL((void*)0), DOCMD_NOWAIT0x02);
1012 } else {
1013 map_execute_lua();
1014 }
1015
1016 if (!cmdline_was_last_drawn) {
1017 redrawcmdline();
1018 }
1019 return 1;
1020 }
1021
1022 if (KeyTyped) {
1023 s->some_key_typed = true1;
1024 if (cmd_hkmap) {
1025 s->c = hkmap(s->c);
1026 }
1027
1028 if (cmdmsg_rl && !KeyStuffed) {
1029 // Invert horizontal movements and operations. Only when
1030 // typed by the user directly, not when the result of a
1031 // mapping.
1032 switch (s->c) {
1033 case K_RIGHT(-(('k') + ((int)('r') << 8))):
1034 s->c = K_LEFT(-(('k') + ((int)('l') << 8))); break;
1035 case K_S_RIGHT(-(('%') + ((int)('i') << 8))):
1036 s->c = K_S_LEFT(-(('#') + ((int)('4') << 8))); break;
1037 case K_C_RIGHT(-((253) + ((int)(KE_C_RIGHT) << 8))):
1038 s->c = K_C_LEFT(-((253) + ((int)(KE_C_LEFT) << 8))); break;
1039 case K_LEFT(-(('k') + ((int)('l') << 8))):
1040 s->c = K_RIGHT(-(('k') + ((int)('r') << 8))); break;
1041 case K_S_LEFT(-(('#') + ((int)('4') << 8))):
1042 s->c = K_S_RIGHT(-(('%') + ((int)('i') << 8))); break;
1043 case K_C_LEFT(-((253) + ((int)(KE_C_LEFT) << 8))):
1044 s->c = K_C_RIGHT(-((253) + ((int)(KE_C_RIGHT) << 8))); break;
1045 }
1046 }
1047 }
1048
1049 // Ignore got_int when CTRL-C was typed here.
1050 // Don't ignore it in :global, we really need to break then, e.g., for
1051 // ":g/pat/normal /pat" (without the <CR>).
1052 // Don't ignore it for the input() function.
1053 if ((s->c == Ctrl_C3)
1054 && s->firstc != '@'
1055 && !s->break_ctrl_c
1056 && !global_busy) {
1057 got_int = false0;
1058 }
1059
1060 // free old command line when finished moving around in the history
1061 // list
1062 if (s->lookfor != NULL((void*)0)
1063 && s->c != K_S_DOWN(-((253) + ((int)(KE_S_DOWN) << 8))) && s->c != K_S_UP(-((253) + ((int)(KE_S_UP) << 8)))
1064 && s->c != K_DOWN(-(('k') + ((int)('d') << 8))) && s->c != K_UP(-(('k') + ((int)('u') << 8)))
1065 && s->c != K_PAGEDOWN(-(('k') + ((int)('N') << 8))) && s->c != K_PAGEUP(-(('k') + ((int)('P') << 8)))
1066 && s->c != K_KPAGEDOWN(-(('K') + ((int)('5') << 8))) && s->c != K_KPAGEUP(-(('K') + ((int)('3') << 8)))
1067 && s->c != K_LEFT(-(('k') + ((int)('l') << 8))) && s->c != K_RIGHT(-(('k') + ((int)('r') << 8)))
1068 && (s->xpc.xp_numfiles > 0 || (s->c != Ctrl_P16 && s->c != Ctrl_N14))) {
1069 XFREE_CLEAR(s->lookfor)do { void **ptr_ = (void **)&(s->lookfor); xfree(*ptr_
); *ptr_ = ((void*)0); (void)(*ptr_); } while (0);
1070 }
1071
1072 // When there are matching completions to select <S-Tab> works like
1073 // CTRL-P (unless 'wc' is <S-Tab>).
1074 if (s->c != p_wc && s->c == K_S_TAB(-(('k') + ((int)('B') << 8))) && s->xpc.xp_numfiles > 0) {
1075 s->c = Ctrl_P16;
1076 }
1077
1078 // Special translations for 'wildmenu'
1079 if (s->did_wild_list && p_wmnu) {
1080 if (s->c == K_LEFT(-(('k') + ((int)('l') << 8)))) {
1081 s->c = Ctrl_P16;
1082 } else if (s->c == K_RIGHT(-(('k') + ((int)('r') << 8)))) {
1083 s->c = Ctrl_N14;
1084 }
1085 }
1086 if (compl_match_array || s->did_wild_list) {
1087 if (s->c == Ctrl_E5) {
1088 s->res = nextwild(&s->xpc, WILD_CANCEL9, WILD_NO_BEEP0x08,
1089 s->firstc != '@');
1090 } else if (s->c == Ctrl_Y25) {
1091 s->res = nextwild(&s->xpc, WILD_APPLY10, WILD_NO_BEEP0x08,
1092 s->firstc != '@');
1093 s->c = Ctrl_E5;
1094 }
1095 }
1096
1097 // Hitting CR after "emenu Name.": complete submenu
1098 if (s->xpc.xp_context == EXPAND_MENUNAMES && p_wmnu
1099 && ccline.cmdpos > 1
1100 && ccline.cmdbuff[ccline.cmdpos - 1] == '.'
1101 && ccline.cmdbuff[ccline.cmdpos - 2] != '\\'
1102 && (s->c == '\n' || s->c == '\r' || s->c == K_KENTER(-(('K') + ((int)('A') << 8))))) {
1103 s->c = K_DOWN(-(('k') + ((int)('d') << 8)));
1104 }
1105
1106 // free expanded names when finished walking through matches
1107 if (!(s->c == p_wc && KeyTyped) && s->c != p_wcm && s->c != Ctrl_Z26
1108 && s->c != Ctrl_N14 && s->c != Ctrl_P16 && s->c != Ctrl_A1
1109 && s->c != Ctrl_L12) {
1110 if (compl_match_array) {
1111 pum_undisplay(true1);
1112 XFREE_CLEAR(compl_match_array)do { void **ptr_ = (void **)&(compl_match_array); xfree(*
ptr_); *ptr_ = ((void*)0); (void)(*ptr_); } while (0);
1113 }
1114 if (s->xpc.xp_numfiles != -1) {
1115 (void)ExpandOne(&s->xpc, NULL((void*)0), NULL((void*)0), 0, WILD_FREE1);
1116 }
1117 s->did_wild_list = false0;
1118 if (!p_wmnu || (s->c != K_UP(-(('k') + ((int)('u') << 8))) && s->c != K_DOWN(-(('k') + ((int)('d') << 8))))) {
1119 s->xpc.xp_context = EXPAND_NOTHING;
1120 }
1121 s->wim_index = 0;
1122 if (p_wmnu && wild_menu_showing != 0) {
1123 const bool_Bool skt = KeyTyped;
1124 int old_RedrawingDisabled = RedrawingDisabled;
1125
1126 if (ccline.input_fn) {
1127 RedrawingDisabled = 0;
1128 }
1129
1130 if (wild_menu_showing == WM_SCROLLED) {
1131 // Entered command line, move it up
1132 cmdline_row--;
1133 redrawcmd();
1134 wild_menu_showing = 0;
1135 } else if (save_p_ls != -1) {
1136 // restore 'laststatus' and 'winminheight'
1137 p_ls = save_p_ls;
1138 p_wmh = save_p_wmh;
1139 last_status(false0);
1140 update_screen(VALID10); // redraw the screen NOW
1141 redrawcmd();
1142 save_p_ls = -1;
1143 wild_menu_showing = 0;
1144 // don't redraw statusline if WM_LIST is showing
1145 } else if (wild_menu_showing != WM_LIST) {
1146 win_redraw_last_status(topframe);
1147 wild_menu_showing = 0; // must be before redraw_statuslines #8385
1148 redraw_statuslines();
1149 } else {
1150 wild_menu_showing = 0;
1151 }
1152 KeyTyped = skt;
1153 if (ccline.input_fn) {
1154 RedrawingDisabled = old_RedrawingDisabled;
1155 }
1156 }
1157 }
1158
1159 // Special translations for 'wildmenu'
1160 if (s->xpc.xp_context == EXPAND_MENUNAMES && p_wmnu) {
1161 // Hitting <Down> after "emenu Name.": complete submenu
1162 if (s->c == K_DOWN(-(('k') + ((int)('d') << 8))) && ccline.cmdpos > 0
1163 && ccline.cmdbuff[ccline.cmdpos - 1] == '.') {
1164 s->c = (int)p_wc;
1165 KeyTyped = true1; // in case the key was mapped
1166 } else if (s->c == K_UP(-(('k') + ((int)('u') << 8)))) {
1167 // Hitting <Up>: Remove one submenu name in front of the
1168 // cursor
1169 int found = false0;
1170
1171 int j = (int)((char_u *)s->xpc.xp_pattern - ccline.cmdbuff);
1172 int i = 0;
1173 while (--j > 0) {
1174 // check for start of menu name
1175 if (ccline.cmdbuff[j] == ' '
1176 && ccline.cmdbuff[j - 1] != '\\') {
1177 i = j + 1;
1178 break;
1179 }
1180
1181 // check for start of submenu name
1182 if (ccline.cmdbuff[j] == '.'
1183 && ccline.cmdbuff[j - 1] != '\\') {
1184 if (found) {
1185 i = j + 1;
1186 break;
1187 } else {
1188 found = true1;
1189 }
1190 }
1191 }
1192 if (i > 0) {
1193 cmdline_del(i);
1194 }
1195 s->c = (int)p_wc;
1196 KeyTyped = true1; // in case the key was mapped
1197 s->xpc.xp_context = EXPAND_NOTHING;
1198 }
1199 }
1200 if ((s->xpc.xp_context == EXPAND_FILES
1201 || s->xpc.xp_context == EXPAND_DIRECTORIES
1202 || s->xpc.xp_context == EXPAND_SHELLCMD) && p_wmnu) {
1203 char_u upseg[5];
1204
1205 upseg[0] = PATHSEP'/';
1206 upseg[1] = '.';
1207 upseg[2] = '.';
1208 upseg[3] = PATHSEP'/';
1209 upseg[4] = NUL'\000';
1210
1211 if (s->c == K_DOWN(-(('k') + ((int)('d') << 8)))
1212 && ccline.cmdpos > 0
1213 && ccline.cmdbuff[ccline.cmdpos - 1] == PATHSEP'/'
1214 && (ccline.cmdpos < 3
1215 || ccline.cmdbuff[ccline.cmdpos - 2] != '.'
1216 || ccline.cmdbuff[ccline.cmdpos - 3] != '.')) {
1217 // go down a directory
1218 s->c = (int)p_wc;
1219 KeyTyped = true1; // in case the key was mapped
1220 } else if (STRNCMP(s->xpc.xp_pattern, upseg + 1, 3)strncmp((char *)(s->xpc.xp_pattern), (char *)(upseg + 1), (
size_t)(3)) == 0
1221 && s->c == K_DOWN(-(('k') + ((int)('d') << 8)))) {
1222 // If in a direct ancestor, strip off one ../ to go down
1223 int found = false0;
1224
1225 int j = ccline.cmdpos;
1226 int i = (int)((char_u *)s->xpc.xp_pattern - ccline.cmdbuff);
1227 while (--j > i) {
1228 j -= utf_head_off(ccline.cmdbuff, ccline.cmdbuff + j);
1229 if (vim_ispathsep(ccline.cmdbuff[j])) {
1230 found = true1;
1231 break;
1232 }
1233 }
1234 if (found
1235 && ccline.cmdbuff[j - 1] == '.'
1236 && ccline.cmdbuff[j - 2] == '.'
1237 && (vim_ispathsep(ccline.cmdbuff[j - 3]) || j == i + 2)) {
1238 cmdline_del(j - 2);
1239 s->c = (int)p_wc;
1240 KeyTyped = true1; // in case the key was mapped
1241 }
1242 } else if (s->c == K_UP(-(('k') + ((int)('u') << 8)))) {
1243 // go up a directory
1244 int found = false0;
1245
1246 int j = ccline.cmdpos - 1;
1247 int i = (int)((char_u *)s->xpc.xp_pattern - ccline.cmdbuff);
1248 while (--j > i) {
1249 j -= utf_head_off(ccline.cmdbuff, ccline.cmdbuff + j);
1250 if (vim_ispathsep(ccline.cmdbuff[j])
1251#ifdef BACKSLASH_IN_FILENAME
1252 && vim_strchr((const char_u *)" *?[{`$%#", ccline.cmdbuff[j + 1])
1253 == NULL((void*)0)
1254#endif
1255 ) {
1256 if (found) {
1257 i = j + 1;
1258 break;
1259 } else {
1260 found = true1;
1261 }
1262 }
1263 }
1264
1265 if (!found) {
1266 j = i;
1267 } else if (STRNCMP(ccline.cmdbuff + j, upseg, 4)strncmp((char *)(ccline.cmdbuff + j), (char *)(upseg), (size_t
)(4)) == 0) {
1268 j += 4;
1269 } else if (STRNCMP(ccline.cmdbuff + j, upseg + 1, 3)strncmp((char *)(ccline.cmdbuff + j), (char *)(upseg + 1), (size_t
)(3)) == 0
1270 && j == i) {
1271 j += 3;
1272 } else {
1273 j = 0;
1274 }
1275
1276 if (j > 0) {
1277 // TODO(tarruda): this is only for DOS/Unix systems - need to put in
1278 // machine-specific stuff here and in upseg init
1279 cmdline_del(j);
1280 put_on_cmdline(upseg + 1, 3, false0);
1281 } else if (ccline.cmdpos > i) {
1282 cmdline_del(i);
1283 }
1284
1285 // Now complete in the new directory. Set KeyTyped in case the
1286 // Up key came from a mapping.
1287 s->c = (int)p_wc;
1288 KeyTyped = true1;
1289 }
1290 }
1291
1292 // CTRL-\ CTRL-N goes to Normal mode, CTRL-\ e prompts for an expression.
1293 if (s->c == Ctrl_BSL28) {
1294 no_mapping++;
1295 allow_keys++;
1296 s->c = plain_vgetc();
1297 no_mapping--;
1298 allow_keys--;
1299 // CTRL-\ e doesn't work when obtaining an expression, unless it
1300 // is in a mapping.
1301 if (s->c != Ctrl_N14
1302 && s->c != Ctrl_G7
1303 && (s->c != 'e'
1304 || (ccline.cmdfirstc == '=' && KeyTyped)
1305 || cmdline_star > 0)) {
1306 vungetc(s->c);
1307 s->c = Ctrl_BSL28;
1308 } else if (s->c == 'e') {
1309 char_u *p = NULL((void*)0);
1310 int len;
1311
1312 // Replace the command line with the result of an expression.
1313 // Need to save and restore the current command line, to be
1314 // able to enter a new one...
1315 if (ccline.cmdpos == ccline.cmdlen) {
1316 new_cmdpos = 99999; // keep it at the end
1317 } else {
1318 new_cmdpos = ccline.cmdpos;
1319 }
1320
1321 s->c = get_expr_register();
1322 if (s->c == '=') {
1323 textlock++;
1324 p = get_expr_line();
1325 textlock--;
1326
1327 if (p != NULL((void*)0)) {
1328 len = (int)STRLEN(p)strlen((char *)(p));
1329 realloc_cmdbuff(len + 1);
1330 ccline.cmdlen = len;
1331 STRCPY(ccline.cmdbuff, p)strcpy((char *)(ccline.cmdbuff), (char *)(p));
1332 xfree(p);
1333
1334 // Restore the cursor or use the position set with
1335 // set_cmdline_pos().
1336 if (new_cmdpos > ccline.cmdlen) {
1337 ccline.cmdpos = ccline.cmdlen;
1338 } else {
1339 ccline.cmdpos = new_cmdpos;
1340 }
1341
1342 KeyTyped = false0; // Don't do p_wc completion.
1343 redrawcmd();
1344 return command_line_changed(s);
1345 }
1346 }
1347 beep_flush();
1348 got_int = false0; // don't abandon the command line
1349 did_emsg = false0;
1350 emsg_on_display = false0;
1351 redrawcmd();
1352 return command_line_not_changed(s);
1353 } else {
1354 s->gotesc = true1; // will free ccline.cmdbuff after putting it
1355 // in history
1356 return 0; // back to Normal mode
1357 }
1358 }
1359
1360 if (s->c == cedit_key || s->c == K_CMDWIN(-((253) + ((int)(KE_CMDWIN) << 8)))) {
1361 // TODO(vim): why is ex_normal_busy checked here?
1362 if ((s->c == K_CMDWIN(-((253) + ((int)(KE_CMDWIN) << 8))) || ex_normal_busy == 0)
1363 && got_int == false0) {
1364 // Open a window to edit the command line (and history).
1365 s->c = open_cmdwin();
1366 s->some_key_typed = true1;
1367 }
1368 } else {
1369 s->c = do_digraph(s->c);
1370 }
1371
1372 if (s->c == '\n'
1373 || s->c == '\r'
1374 || s->c == K_KENTER(-(('K') + ((int)('A') << 8)))
1375 || (s->c == ESC'\033'
1376 && (!KeyTyped || vim_strchr(p_cpo, CPO_ESC'x') != NULL((void*)0)))) {
1377 // In Ex mode a backslash escapes a newline.
1378 if (exmode_active
1379 && s->c != ESC'\033'
1380 && ccline.cmdpos == ccline.cmdlen
1381 && ccline.cmdpos > 0
1382 && ccline.cmdbuff[ccline.cmdpos - 1] == '\\') {
1383 if (s->c == K_KENTER(-(('K') + ((int)('A') << 8)))) {
1384 s->c = '\n';
1385 }
1386 } else {
1387 s->gotesc = false0; // Might have typed ESC previously, don't
1388 // truncate the cmdline now.
1389 if (ccheck_abbr(s->c + ABBR_OFF0x100)) {
1390 return command_line_changed(s);
1391 }
1392
1393 if (!cmd_silent) {
1394 if (!ui_has(kUICmdline)) {
1395 cmd_cursor_goto(msg_row, 0);
1396 }
1397 ui_flush();
1398 }
1399 return 0;
1400 }
1401 }
1402
1403 // Completion for 'wildchar' or 'wildcharm' key.
1404 // - hitting <ESC> twice means: abandon command line.
1405 // - wildcard expansion is only done when the 'wildchar' key is really
1406 // typed, not when it comes from a macro
1407 if ((s->c == p_wc && !s->gotesc && KeyTyped) || s->c == p_wcm
1408 || s->c == Ctrl_Z26) {
1409 int options = WILD_NO_BEEP0x08;
1410 if (wim_flags[s->wim_index] & WIM_BUFLASTUSED0x08) {
1411 options |= WILD_BUFLASTUSED0x1000;
1412 }
1413 if (s->xpc.xp_numfiles > 0) { // typed p_wc at least twice
1414 // if 'wildmode' contains "list" may still need to list
1415 if (s->xpc.xp_numfiles > 1
1416 && !s->did_wild_list
1417 && ((wim_flags[s->wim_index] & WIM_LIST0x04)
1418 || (p_wmnu && (wim_flags[s->wim_index] & WIM_FULL0x01) != 0))) {
1419 (void)showmatches(&s->xpc, p_wmnu
1420 && ((wim_flags[s->wim_index] & WIM_LIST0x04) == 0));
1421 redrawcmd();
1422 s->did_wild_list = true1;
1423 }
1424
1425 if (wim_flags[s->wim_index] & WIM_LONGEST0x02) {
1426 s->res = nextwild(&s->xpc, WILD_LONGEST7, options,
1427 s->firstc != '@');
1428 } else if (wim_flags[s->wim_index] & WIM_FULL0x01) {
1429 s->res = nextwild(&s->xpc, WILD_NEXT4, options,
1430 s->firstc != '@');
1431 } else {
1432 s->res = OK1; // don't insert 'wildchar' now
1433 }
1434 } else { // typed p_wc first time
1435 s->wim_index = 0;
1436 int j = ccline.cmdpos;
1437
1438 // if 'wildmode' first contains "longest", get longest
1439 // common part
1440 if (wim_flags[0] & WIM_LONGEST0x02) {
1441 s->res = nextwild(&s->xpc, WILD_LONGEST7, options,
1442 s->firstc != '@');
1443 } else {
1444 s->res = nextwild(&s->xpc, WILD_EXPAND_KEEP3, options,
1445 s->firstc != '@');
1446 }
1447
1448 // if interrupted while completing, behave like it failed
1449 if (got_int) {
1450 (void)vpeekc(); // remove <C-C> from input stream
1451 got_int = false0; // don't abandon the command line
1452 (void)ExpandOne(&s->xpc, NULL((void*)0), NULL((void*)0), 0, WILD_FREE1);
1453 s->xpc.xp_context = EXPAND_NOTHING;
1454 return command_line_changed(s);
1455 }
1456
1457 // when more than one match, and 'wildmode' first contains
1458 // "list", or no change and 'wildmode' contains "longest,list",
1459 // list all matches
1460 if (s->res == OK1 && s->xpc.xp_numfiles > 1) {
1461 // a "longest" that didn't do anything is skipped (but not
1462 // "list:longest")
1463 if (wim_flags[0] == WIM_LONGEST0x02 && ccline.cmdpos == j) {
1464 s->wim_index = 1;
1465 }
1466 if ((wim_flags[s->wim_index] & WIM_LIST0x04)
1467 || (p_wmnu && (wim_flags[s->wim_index] & WIM_FULL0x01) != 0)) {
1468 if (!(wim_flags[0] & WIM_LONGEST0x02)) {
1469 int p_wmnu_save = p_wmnu;
1470 p_wmnu = 0;
1471 // remove match
1472 nextwild(&s->xpc, WILD_PREV5, 0, s->firstc != '@');
1473 p_wmnu = p_wmnu_save;
1474 }
1475
1476 (void)showmatches(&s->xpc, p_wmnu
1477 && ((wim_flags[s->wim_index] & WIM_LIST0x04) == 0));
1478 redrawcmd();
1479 s->did_wild_list = true1;
1480
1481 if (wim_flags[s->wim_index] & WIM_LONGEST0x02) {
1482 nextwild(&s->xpc, WILD_LONGEST7, options,
1483 s->firstc != '@');
1484 } else if (wim_flags[s->wim_index] & WIM_FULL0x01) {
1485 nextwild(&s->xpc, WILD_NEXT4, options,
1486 s->firstc != '@');
1487 }
1488 } else {
1489 vim_beep(BO_WILD0x40000);
1490 }
1491 } else if (s->xpc.xp_numfiles == -1) {
1492 s->xpc.xp_context = EXPAND_NOTHING;
1493 }
1494 }
1495
1496 if (s->wim_index < 3) {
1497 ++s->wim_index;
1498 }
1499
1500 if (s->c == ESC'\033') {
1501 s->gotesc = true1;
1502 }
1503
1504 if (s->res == OK1) {
1505 return command_line_changed(s);
1506 }
1507 }
1508
1509 s->gotesc = false0;
1510
1511 // <S-Tab> goes to last match, in a clumsy way
1512 if (s->c == K_S_TAB(-(('k') + ((int)('B') << 8))) && KeyTyped) {
1513 if (nextwild(&s->xpc, WILD_EXPAND_KEEP3, 0, s->firstc != '@') == OK1) {
1514 showmatches(&s->xpc, p_wmnu
1515 && ((wim_flags[s->wim_index] & WIM_LIST0x04) == 0));
1516 nextwild(&s->xpc, WILD_PREV5, 0, s->firstc != '@');
1517 nextwild(&s->xpc, WILD_PREV5, 0, s->firstc != '@');
1518 return command_line_changed(s);
1519 }
1520 }
1521
1522 if (s->c == NUL'\000' || s->c == K_ZERO(-((255) + ((int)(('X')) << 8)))) {
1523 // NUL is stored as NL
1524 s->c = NL'\012';
1525 }
1526
1527 s->do_abbr = true1; // default: check for abbreviation
1528 return command_line_handle_key(s);
1529}
1530
1531// May adjust 'incsearch' highlighting for typing CTRL-G and CTRL-T, go to next
1532// or previous match.
1533// Returns FAIL when calling command_line_not_changed.
1534static int may_do_command_line_next_incsearch(int firstc, long count, incsearch_state_T *s,
1535 bool_Bool next_match)
1536 FUNC_ATTR_NONNULL_ALL
1537{
1538 int skiplen, patlen, search_delim;
1539
1540 // Parsing range may already set the last search pattern.
1541 // NOTE: must call restore_last_search_pattern() before returning!
1542 save_last_search_pattern();
1543
1544 if (!do_incsearch_highlighting(firstc, &search_delim, s, &skiplen,
1545 &patlen)) {
1546 restore_last_search_pattern();
1547 return OK1;
1548 }
1549 if (patlen == 0 && ccline.cmdbuff[skiplen] == NUL'\000') {
1550 restore_last_search_pattern();
1551 return FAIL0;
1552 }
1553
1554 ui_busy_start();
1555 ui_flush();
1556
1557 pos_T t;
1558 char_u *pat;
1559 int search_flags = SEARCH_NOOF0x80;
1560 char_u save;
1561
1562 if (search_delim == ccline.cmdbuff[skiplen]) {
1563 pat = last_search_pattern();
1564 if (pat == NULL((void*)0)) {
1565 restore_last_search_pattern();
1566 return FAIL0;
1567 }
1568 skiplen = 0;
1569 patlen = (int)STRLEN(pat)strlen((char *)(pat));
1570 } else {
1571 pat = ccline.cmdbuff + skiplen;
1572 }
1573
1574 if (next_match) {
1575 t = s->match_end;
1576 if (lt(s->match_start, s->match_end)) {
1577 // start searching at the end of the match
1578 // not at the beginning of the next column
1579 (void)decl(&t);
1580 }
1581 search_flags += SEARCH_COL0x1000;
1582 } else {
1583 t = s->match_start;
1584 }
1585 if (!p_hls) {
1586 search_flags += SEARCH_KEEP0x400;
1587 }
1588 emsg_off++;
1589 save = pat[patlen];
1590 pat[patlen] = NUL'\000';
1591 int found = searchit(curwin, curbuf, &t, NULL((void*)0),
1592 next_match ? FORWARD : BACKWARD,
1593 pat, count, search_flags,
1594 RE_SEARCH0, NULL((void*)0));
1595 emsg_off--;
1596 pat[patlen] = save;
1597 ui_busy_stop();
1598 if (found) {
1599 s->search_start = s->match_start;
1600 s->match_end = t;
1601 s->match_start = t;
1602 if (!next_match && firstc != '?') {
1603 // move just before the current match, so that
1604 // when nv_search finishes the cursor will be
1605 // put back on the match
1606 s->search_start = t;
1607 (void)decl(&s->search_start);
1608 } else if (next_match && firstc == '?') {
1609 // move just after the current match, so that
1610 // when nv_search finishes the cursor will be
1611 // put back on the match
1612 s->search_start = t;
1613 (void)incl(&s->search_start);
1614 }
1615 if (lt(t, s->search_start) && next_match) {
1616 // wrap around
1617 s->search_start = t;
1618 if (firstc == '?') {
1619 (void)incl(&s->search_start);
1620 } else {
1621 (void)decl(&s->search_start);
1622 }
1623 }
1624
1625 set_search_match(&s->match_end);
1626 curwin->w_cursor = s->match_start;
1627 changed_cline_bef_curs();
1628 update_topline(curwin);
1629 validate_cursor();
1630 highlight_match = true1;
1631 save_viewstate(&s->old_viewstate);
1632 update_screen(NOT_VALID40);
1633 highlight_match = false0;
1634 redrawcmdline();
1635 curwin->w_cursor = s->match_end;
1636 } else {
1637 vim_beep(BO_ERROR0x0040);
1638 }
1639 restore_last_search_pattern();
1640 return FAIL0;
1641}
1642
1643static void command_line_next_histidx(CommandLineState *s, bool_Bool next_match)
1644{
1645 int j = (int)STRLEN(s->lookfor)strlen((char *)(s->lookfor));
1646 for (;;) {
1647 // one step backwards
1648 if (!next_match) {
1649 if (s->hiscnt == hislen) {
1650 // first time
1651 s->hiscnt = hisidx[s->histype];
1652 } else if (s->hiscnt == 0 && hisidx[s->histype] != hislen - 1) {
1653 s->hiscnt = hislen - 1;
1654 } else if (s->hiscnt != hisidx[s->histype] + 1) {
1655 s->hiscnt--;
1656 } else {
1657 // at top of list
1658 s->hiscnt = s->save_hiscnt;
1659 break;
1660 }
1661 } else { // one step forwards
1662 // on last entry, clear the line
1663 if (s->hiscnt == hisidx[s->histype]) {
1664 s->hiscnt = hislen;
1665 break;
1666 }
1667
1668 // not on a history line, nothing to do
1669 if (s->hiscnt == hislen) {
1670 break;
1671 }
1672
1673 if (s->hiscnt == hislen - 1) {
1674 // wrap around
1675 s->hiscnt = 0;
1676 } else {
1677 s->hiscnt++;
1678 }
1679 }
1680
1681 if (s->hiscnt < 0 || history[s->histype][s->hiscnt].hisstr == NULL((void*)0)) {
1682 s->hiscnt = s->save_hiscnt;
1683 break;
1684 }
1685
1686 if ((s->c != K_UP(-(('k') + ((int)('u') << 8))) && s->c != K_DOWN(-(('k') + ((int)('d') << 8))))
1687 || s->hiscnt == s->save_hiscnt
1688 || STRNCMP(history[s->histype][s->hiscnt].hisstr,strncmp((char *)(history[s->histype][s->hiscnt].hisstr)
, (char *)(s->lookfor), (size_t)((size_t)j))
1689 s->lookfor, (size_t)j)strncmp((char *)(history[s->histype][s->hiscnt].hisstr)
, (char *)(s->lookfor), (size_t)((size_t)j)) == 0) {
1690 break;
1691 }
1692 }
1693}
1694
1695static int command_line_handle_key(CommandLineState *s)
1696{
1697 // Big switch for a typed command line character.
1698 switch (s->c) {
1
Control jumps to the 'default' case at line 2205
→
1699 case K_BS(-(('k') + ((int)('b') << 8))):
1700 case Ctrl_H8:
1701 case K_DEL(-(('k') + ((int)('D') << 8))):
1702 case K_KDEL(-((253) + ((int)(KE_KDEL) << 8))):
1703 case Ctrl_W23:
1704 if (s->c == K_KDEL(-((253) + ((int)(KE_KDEL) << 8)))) {
1705 s->c = K_DEL(-(('k') + ((int)('D') << 8)));
1706 }
1707
1708 // delete current character is the same as backspace on next
1709 // character, except at end of line
1710 if (s->c == K_DEL(-(('k') + ((int)('D') << 8))) && ccline.cmdpos != ccline.cmdlen) {
1711 ++ccline.cmdpos;
1712 }
1713
1714 if (s->c == K_DEL(-(('k') + ((int)('D') << 8)))) {
1715 ccline.cmdpos += mb_off_next(ccline.cmdbuff,
1716 ccline.cmdbuff + ccline.cmdpos);
1717 }
1718
1719 if (ccline.cmdpos > 0) {
1720 char_u *p;
1721
1722 int j = ccline.cmdpos;
1723 p = mb_prevptr(ccline.cmdbuff, ccline.cmdbuff + j);
1724
1725 if (s->c == Ctrl_W23) {
1726 while (p > ccline.cmdbuff && ascii_isspace(*p)) {
1727 p = mb_prevptr(ccline.cmdbuff, p);
1728 }
1729
1730 int i = mb_get_class(p);
1731 while (p > ccline.cmdbuff && mb_get_class(p) == i) {
1732 p = mb_prevptr(ccline.cmdbuff, p);
1733 }
1734
1735 if (mb_get_class(p) != i) {
1736 p += utfc_ptr2len((char *)p);
1737 }
1738 }
1739
1740 ccline.cmdpos = (int)(p - ccline.cmdbuff);
1741 ccline.cmdlen -= j - ccline.cmdpos;
1742 int i = ccline.cmdpos;
1743
1744 while (i < ccline.cmdlen) {
1745 ccline.cmdbuff[i++] = ccline.cmdbuff[j++];
1746 }
1747
1748 // Truncate at the end, required for multi-byte chars.
1749 ccline.cmdbuff[ccline.cmdlen] = NUL'\000';
1750 if (ccline.cmdlen == 0) {
1751 s->is_state.search_start = s->is_state.save_cursor;
1752 // save view settings, so that the screen won't be restored at the
1753 // wrong position
1754 s->is_state.old_viewstate = s->is_state.init_viewstate;
1755 }
1756 redrawcmd();
1757 } else if (ccline.cmdlen == 0 && s->c != Ctrl_W23
1758 && ccline.cmdprompt == NULL((void*)0) && s->indent == 0) {
1759 // In ex and debug mode it doesn't make sense to return.
1760 if (exmode_active || ccline.cmdfirstc == '>') {
1761 return command_line_not_changed(s);
1762 }
1763
1764 XFREE_CLEAR(ccline.cmdbuff)do { void **ptr_ = (void **)&(ccline.cmdbuff); xfree(*ptr_
); *ptr_ = ((void*)0); (void)(*ptr_); } while (0); // no commandline to return
1765 if (!cmd_silent && !ui_has(kUICmdline)) {
1766 if (cmdmsg_rl) {
1767 msg_col = Columns;
1768 } else {
1769 msg_col = 0;
1770 }
1771 msg_putchar(' '); // delete ':'
1772 }
1773 s->is_state.search_start = s->is_state.save_cursor;
1774 redraw_cmdline = true1;
1775 return 0; // back to cmd mode
1776 }
1777 return command_line_changed(s);
1778
1779 case K_INS(-(('k') + ((int)('I') << 8))):
1780 case K_KINS(-((253) + ((int)(KE_KINS) << 8))):
1781 ccline.overstrike = !ccline.overstrike;
1782
1783 ui_cursor_shape(); // may show different cursor shape
1784 return command_line_not_changed(s);
1785
1786 case Ctrl_HAT30:
1787 if (map_to_exists_mode("", MODE_LANGMAP0x20, false0)) {
1788 // ":lmap" mappings exists, toggle use of mappings.
1789 State ^= MODE_LANGMAP0x20;
1790 if (s->b_im_ptr != NULL((void*)0)) {
1791 if (State & MODE_LANGMAP0x20) {
1792 *s->b_im_ptr = B_IMODE_LMAP1;
1793 } else {
1794 *s->b_im_ptr = B_IMODE_NONE0;
1795 }
1796 }
1797 }
1798
1799 if (s->b_im_ptr != NULL((void*)0)) {
1800 if (s->b_im_ptr == &curbuf->b_p_iminsert) {
1801 set_iminsert_global();
1802 } else {
1803 set_imsearch_global();
1804 }
1805 }
1806 ui_cursor_shape(); // may show different cursor shape
1807 // Show/unshow value of 'keymap' in status lines later.
1808 status_redraw_curbuf();
1809 return command_line_not_changed(s);
1810
1811 case Ctrl_U21: {
1812 // delete all characters left of the cursor
1813 int j = ccline.cmdpos;
1814 ccline.cmdlen -= j;
1815 int i = ccline.cmdpos = 0;
1816 while (i < ccline.cmdlen) {
1817 ccline.cmdbuff[i++] = ccline.cmdbuff[j++];
1818 }
1819
1820 // Truncate at the end, required for multi-byte chars.
1821 ccline.cmdbuff[ccline.cmdlen] = NUL'\000';
1822 if (ccline.cmdlen == 0) {
1823 s->is_state.search_start = s->is_state.save_cursor;
1824 }
1825 redrawcmd();
1826 return command_line_changed(s);
1827 }
1828
1829 case ESC'\033': // get here if p_wc != ESC or when ESC typed twice
1830 case Ctrl_C3:
1831 // In exmode it doesn't make sense to return. Except when
1832 // ":normal" runs out of characters. Also when highlight callback is active
1833 // <C-c> should interrupt only it.
1834 if ((exmode_active && (ex_normal_busy == 0 || typebuf.tb_len > 0))
1835 || (getln_interrupted_highlight && s->c == Ctrl_C3)) {
1836 getln_interrupted_highlight = false0;
1837 return command_line_not_changed(s);
1838 }
1839
1840 s->gotesc = true1; // will free ccline.cmdbuff after
1841 // putting it in history
1842 return 0; // back to cmd mode
1843
1844 case Ctrl_R18: { // insert register
1845 putcmdline('"', true1);
1846 no_mapping++;
1847 allow_keys++;
1848 int i = s->c = plain_vgetc(); // CTRL-R <char>
1849 if (i == Ctrl_O15) {
1850 i = Ctrl_R18; // CTRL-R CTRL-O == CTRL-R CTRL-R
1851 }
1852
1853 if (i == Ctrl_R18) {
1854 s->c = plain_vgetc(); // CTRL-R CTRL-R <char>
1855 }
1856 no_mapping--;
1857 allow_keys--;
1858 // Insert the result of an expression.
1859 // Need to save the current command line, to be able to enter
1860 // a new one...
1861 new_cmdpos = -1;
1862 if (s->c == '=') {
1863 if (ccline.cmdfirstc == '=' // can't do this recursively
1864 || cmdline_star > 0) { // or when typing a password
1865 beep_flush();
1866 s->c = ESC'\033';
1867 } else {
1868 s->c = get_expr_register();
1869 }
1870 }
1871
1872 if (s->c != ESC'\033') { // use ESC to cancel inserting register
1873 cmdline_paste(s->c, i == Ctrl_R18, false0);
1874
1875 // When there was a serious error abort getting the
1876 // command line.
1877 if (aborting()) {
1878 s->gotesc = true1; // will free ccline.cmdbuff after
1879 // putting it in history
1880 return 0; // back to cmd mode
1881 }
1882 KeyTyped = false0; // Don't do p_wc completion.
1883 if (new_cmdpos >= 0) {
1884 // set_cmdline_pos() was used
1885 if (new_cmdpos > ccline.cmdlen) {
1886 ccline.cmdpos = ccline.cmdlen;
1887 } else {
1888 ccline.cmdpos = new_cmdpos;
1889 }
1890 }
1891 }
1892 ccline.special_char = NUL'\000';
1893 redrawcmd();
1894 return command_line_changed(s);
1895 }
1896
1897 case Ctrl_D4:
1898 if (showmatches(&s->xpc, false0) == EXPAND_NOTHING) {
1899 break; // Use ^D as normal char instead
1900 }
1901
1902 wild_menu_showing = WM_LIST;
1903 redrawcmd();
1904 return 1; // don't do incremental search now
1905
1906 case K_RIGHT(-(('k') + ((int)('r') << 8))):
1907 case K_S_RIGHT(-(('%') + ((int)('i') << 8))):
1908 case K_C_RIGHT(-((253) + ((int)(KE_C_RIGHT) << 8))):
1909 do {
1910 if (ccline.cmdpos >= ccline.cmdlen) {
1911 break;
1912 }
1913
1914 int cells = cmdline_charsize(ccline.cmdpos);
1915 if (KeyTyped && ccline.cmdspos + cells >= Columns * Rows) {
1916 break;
1917 }
1918
1919 ccline.cmdspos += cells;
1920 ccline.cmdpos += utfc_ptr2len((char *)ccline.cmdbuff + ccline.cmdpos);
1921 } while ((s->c == K_S_RIGHT(-(('%') + ((int)('i') << 8))) || s->c == K_C_RIGHT(-((253) + ((int)(KE_C_RIGHT) << 8)))
1922 || (mod_mask & (MOD_MASK_SHIFT0x02|MOD_MASK_CTRL0x04)))
1923 && ccline.cmdbuff[ccline.cmdpos] != ' ');
1924 ccline.cmdspos = cmd_screencol(ccline.cmdpos);
1925 return command_line_not_changed(s);
1926
1927 case K_LEFT(-(('k') + ((int)('l') << 8))):
1928 case K_S_LEFT(-(('#') + ((int)('4') << 8))):
1929 case K_C_LEFT(-((253) + ((int)(KE_C_LEFT) << 8))):
1930 if (ccline.cmdpos == 0) {
1931 return command_line_not_changed(s);
1932 }
1933 do {
1934 ccline.cmdpos--;
1935 // Move to first byte of possibly multibyte char.
1936 ccline.cmdpos -= utf_head_off(ccline.cmdbuff,
1937 ccline.cmdbuff + ccline.cmdpos);
1938 ccline.cmdspos -= cmdline_charsize(ccline.cmdpos);
1939 } while (ccline.cmdpos > 0
1940 && (s->c == K_S_LEFT(-(('#') + ((int)('4') << 8))) || s->c == K_C_LEFT(-((253) + ((int)(KE_C_LEFT) << 8)))
1941 || (mod_mask & (MOD_MASK_SHIFT0x02|MOD_MASK_CTRL0x04)))
1942 && ccline.cmdbuff[ccline.cmdpos - 1] != ' ');
1943
1944 ccline.cmdspos = cmd_screencol(ccline.cmdpos);
1945 if (ccline.special_char != NUL'\000') {
1946 putcmdline(ccline.special_char, ccline.special_shift);
1947 }
1948
1949 return command_line_not_changed(s);
1950
1951 case K_IGNORE(-((253) + ((int)(KE_IGNORE) << 8))):
1952 // Ignore mouse event or open_cmdwin() result.
1953 return command_line_not_changed(s);
1954
1955 case K_MIDDLEDRAG(-((253) + ((int)(KE_MIDDLEDRAG) << 8))):
1956 case K_MIDDLERELEASE(-((253) + ((int)(KE_MIDDLERELEASE) << 8))):
1957 return command_line_not_changed(s); // Ignore mouse
1958
1959 case K_MIDDLEMOUSE(-((253) + ((int)(KE_MIDDLEMOUSE) << 8))):
1960 cmdline_paste(eval_has_provider("clipboard") ? '*' : 0, true1, true1);
1961 redrawcmd();
1962 return command_line_changed(s);
1963
1964 case K_LEFTDRAG(-((253) + ((int)(KE_LEFTDRAG) << 8))):
1965 case K_LEFTRELEASE(-((253) + ((int)(KE_LEFTRELEASE) << 8))):
1966 case K_RIGHTDRAG(-((253) + ((int)(KE_RIGHTDRAG) << 8))):
1967 case K_RIGHTRELEASE(-((253) + ((int)(KE_RIGHTRELEASE) << 8))):
1968 // Ignore drag and release events when the button-down wasn't
1969 // seen before.
1970 if (s->ignore_drag_release) {
1971 return command_line_not_changed(s);
1972 }
1973 FALLTHROUGH{} __attribute__((fallthrough));
1974 case K_LEFTMOUSE(-((253) + ((int)(KE_LEFTMOUSE) << 8))):
1975 case K_RIGHTMOUSE(-((253) + ((int)(KE_RIGHTMOUSE) << 8))):
1976 if (s->c == K_LEFTRELEASE(-((253) + ((int)(KE_LEFTRELEASE) << 8))) || s->c == K_RIGHTRELEASE(-((253) + ((int)(KE_RIGHTRELEASE) << 8)))) {
1977 s->ignore_drag_release = true1;
1978 } else {
1979 s->ignore_drag_release = false0;
1980 }
1981
1982 ccline.cmdspos = cmd_startcol();
1983 for (ccline.cmdpos = 0; ccline.cmdpos < ccline.cmdlen;
1984 ccline.cmdpos++) {
1985 int cells = cmdline_charsize(ccline.cmdpos);
1986 if (mouse_row <= cmdline_row + ccline.cmdspos / Columns
1987 && mouse_col < ccline.cmdspos % Columns + cells) {
1988 break;
1989 }
1990
1991 // Count ">" for double-wide char that doesn't fit.
1992 correct_screencol(ccline.cmdpos, cells, &ccline.cmdspos);
1993 ccline.cmdpos += utfc_ptr2len((char *)ccline.cmdbuff + ccline.cmdpos) - 1;
1994 ccline.cmdspos += cells;
1995 }
1996 return command_line_not_changed(s);
1997
1998 // Mouse scroll wheel: ignored here
1999 case K_MOUSEDOWN(-((253) + ((int)(KE_MOUSEDOWN) << 8))):
2000 case K_MOUSEUP(-((253) + ((int)(KE_MOUSEUP) << 8))):
2001 case K_MOUSELEFT(-((253) + ((int)(KE_MOUSELEFT) << 8))):
2002 case K_MOUSERIGHT(-((253) + ((int)(KE_MOUSERIGHT) << 8))):
2003 // Alternate buttons ignored here
2004 case K_X1MOUSE(-((253) + ((int)(KE_X1MOUSE) << 8))):
2005 case K_X1DRAG(-((253) + ((int)(KE_X1DRAG) << 8))):
2006 case K_X1RELEASE(-((253) + ((int)(KE_X1RELEASE) << 8))):
2007 case K_X2MOUSE(-((253) + ((int)(KE_X2MOUSE) << 8))):
2008 case K_X2DRAG(-((253) + ((int)(KE_X2DRAG) << 8))):
2009 case K_X2RELEASE(-((253) + ((int)(KE_X2RELEASE) << 8))):
2010 case K_MOUSEMOVE(-((253) + ((int)(KE_MOUSEMOVE) << 8))):
2011 return command_line_not_changed(s);
2012
2013 case K_SELECT(-((245) + ((int)(('X')) << 8))): // end of Select mode mapping - ignore
2014 return command_line_not_changed(s);
2015
2016 case Ctrl_B2: // begin of command line
2017 case K_HOME(-(('k') + ((int)('h') << 8))):
2018 case K_KHOME(-(('K') + ((int)('1') << 8))):
2019 case K_S_HOME(-(('#') + ((int)('2') << 8))):
2020 case K_C_HOME(-((253) + ((int)(KE_C_HOME) << 8))):
2021 ccline.cmdpos = 0;
2022 ccline.cmdspos = cmd_startcol();

2024
2025 case Ctrl_E5: // end of command line
2026 case K_END(-(('@') + ((int)('7') << 8))):
2027 case K_KEND(-(('K') + ((int)('4') << 8))):
2028 case K_S_END(-(('*') + ((int)('7') << 8))):
2029 case K_C_END(-((253) + ((int)(KE_C_END) << 8))):
2030 ccline.cmdpos = ccline.cmdlen;
2031 ccline.cmdspos = cmd_screencol(ccline.cmdpos);
2032 return command_line_not_changed(s);
2033
2034 case Ctrl_A1: // all matches
2035 if (nextwild(&s->xpc, WILD_ALL6, 0, s->firstc != '@') == FAIL0) {
2036 break;
2037 }
2038 return command_line_changed(s);
2039
2040 case Ctrl_L12:
2041 if (may_add_char_to_search(s->firstc, &s->c, &s->is_state) == OK1) {
2042 return command_line_not_changed(s);
2043 }
2044
2045 // completion: longest common part
2046 if (nextwild(&s->xpc, WILD_LONGEST7, 0, s->firstc != '@') == FAIL0) {
2047 break;
2048 }
2049 return command_line_changed(s);
2050
2051 case Ctrl_N14: // next match
2052 case Ctrl_P16: // previous match
2053 if (s->xpc.xp_numfiles > 0) {
2054 if (nextwild(&s->xpc, (s->c == Ctrl_P16) ? WILD_PREV5 : WILD_NEXT4,
2055 0, s->firstc != '@') == FAIL0) {
2056 break;
2057 }
2058 return command_line_not_changed(s);
2059 }
2060 FALLTHROUGH{} __attribute__((fallthrough));
2061
2062 case K_UP(-(('k') + ((int)('u') << 8))):
2063 case K_DOWN(-(('k') + ((int)('d') << 8))):
2064 case K_S_UP(-((253) + ((int)(KE_S_UP) << 8))):
2065 case K_S_DOWN(-((253) + ((int)(KE_S_DOWN) << 8))):
2066 case K_PAGEUP(-(('k') + ((int)('P') << 8))):
2067 case K_KPAGEUP(-(('K') + ((int)('3') << 8))):
2068 case K_PAGEDOWN(-(('k') + ((int)('N') << 8))):
2069 case K_KPAGEDOWN(-(('K') + ((int)('5') << 8))):
2070 if (s->histype == HIST_INVALID || hislen == 0 || s->firstc == NUL'\000') {
2071 // no history
2072 return command_line_not_changed(s);
2073 }
2074
2075 s->save_hiscnt = s->hiscnt;
2076
2077 // save current command string so it can be restored later
2078 if (s->lookfor == NULL((void*)0)) {
2079 s->lookfor = vim_strsave(ccline.cmdbuff);
2080 s->lookfor[ccline.cmdpos] = NUL'\000';
2081 }
2082
2083 bool_Bool next_match = (s->c == K_DOWN(-(('k') + ((int)('d') << 8))) || s->c == K_S_DOWN(-((253) + ((int)(KE_S_DOWN) << 8))) || s->c == Ctrl_N14
2084 || s->c == K_PAGEDOWN(-(('k') + ((int)('N') << 8))) || s->c == K_KPAGEDOWN(-(('K') + ((int)('5') << 8))));
2085 command_line_next_histidx(s, next_match);
2086
2087 if (s->hiscnt != s->save_hiscnt) {
2088 // jumped to other entry
2089 char_u *p;
2090 int len = 0;
2091 int old_firstc;
2092
2093 XFREE_CLEAR(ccline.cmdbuff)do { void **ptr_ = (void **)&(ccline.cmdbuff); xfree(*ptr_
); *ptr_ = ((void*)0); (void)(*ptr_); } while (0);
2094 s->xpc.xp_context = EXPAND_NOTHING;
2095 if (s->hiscnt == hislen) {
2096 p = s->lookfor; // back to the old one
2097 } else {
2098 p = history[s->histype][s->hiscnt].hisstr;
2099 }
2100
2101 if (s->histype == HIST_SEARCH
2102 && p != s->lookfor
2103 && (old_firstc = p[STRLEN(p)strlen((char *)(p)) + 1]) != s->firstc) {
2104 // Correct for the separator character used when
2105 // adding the history entry vs the one used now.
2106 // First loop: count length.
2107 // Second loop: copy the characters.
2108 for (int i = 0; i <= 1; i++) {
2109 len = 0;
2110 for (int j = 0; p[j] != NUL'\000'; j++) {
2111 // Replace old sep with new sep, unless it is
2112 // escaped.
2113 if (p[j] == old_firstc
2114 && (j == 0 || p[j - 1] != '\\')) {
2115 if (i > 0) {
2116 ccline.cmdbuff[len] = (char_u)s->firstc;
2117 }
2118 } else {
2119 // Escape new sep, unless it is already
2120 // escaped.
2121 if (p[j] == s->firstc
2122 && (j == 0 || p[j - 1] != '\\')) {
2123 if (i > 0) {
2124 ccline.cmdbuff[len] = '\\';
2125 }
2126 ++len;
2127 }
2128
2129 if (i > 0) {
2130 ccline.cmdbuff[len] = p[j];
2131 }
2132 }
2133 ++len;
2134 }
2135
2136 if (i == 0) {
2137 alloc_cmdbuff(len);
2138 }
2139 }
2140 ccline.cmdbuff[len] = NUL'\000';
2141 } else {
2142 alloc_cmdbuff((int)STRLEN(p)strlen((char *)(p)));
2143 STRCPY(ccline.cmdbuff, p)strcpy((char *)(ccline.cmdbuff), (char *)(p));
2144 }
2145
2146 ccline.cmdpos = ccline.cmdlen = (int)STRLEN(ccline.cmdbuff)strlen((char *)(ccline.cmdbuff));
2147 redrawcmd();
2148 return command_line_changed(s);
2149 }
2150 beep_flush();
2151 return command_line_not_changed(s);
2152
2153 case Ctrl_G7: // next match
2154 case Ctrl_T20: // previous match
2155 if (may_do_command_line_next_incsearch(s->firstc, s->count, &s->is_state,
2156 s->c == Ctrl_G7) == FAIL0) {
2157 return command_line_not_changed(s);
2158 }
2159 break;
2160
2161 case Ctrl_V22:
2162 case Ctrl_Q17:
2163 s->ignore_drag_release = true1;
2164 putcmdline('^', true1);
2165
2166 // Get next (two) characters.
2167 // Do not include modifiers into the key for CTRL-SHIFT-V.
2168 s->c = get_literal(mod_mask & MOD_MASK_SHIFT0x02);
2169
2170 s->do_abbr = false0; // don't do abbreviation now
2171 ccline.special_char = NUL'\000';
2172 // may need to remove ^ when composing char was typed
2173 if (utf_iscomposing(s->c) && !cmd_silent) {
2174 if (ui_has(kUICmdline)) {
2175 // TODO(bfredl): why not make unputcmdline also work with true?
2176 unputcmdline();
2177 } else {
2178 draw_cmdline(ccline.cmdpos, ccline.cmdlen - ccline.cmdpos);
2179 msg_putchar(' ');
2180 cursorcmd();
2181 }
2182 }
2183 break;
2184
2185 case Ctrl_K11:
2186 s->ignore_drag_release = true1;
2187 putcmdline('?', true1);
2188 s->c = get_digraph(true1);
2189 ccline.special_char = NUL'\000';
2190
2191 if (s->c != NUL'\000') {
2192 break;
2193 }
2194
2195 redrawcmd();
2196 return command_line_not_changed(s);
2197
2198 case Ctrl__31: // CTRL-_: switch language mode
2199 if (!p_ari) {
2200 break;
2201 }
2202 cmd_hkmap = !cmd_hkmap;
2203 return command_line_not_changed(s);
2204
2205 default:
2206 // Normal character with no special meaning. Just set mod_mask
2207 // to 0x0 so that typing Shift-Space in the GUI doesn't enter
2208 // the string <S-Space>. This should only happen after ^V.
2209 if (!IS_SPECIAL(s->c)((s->c) < 0)) {
2
←
Assuming field 'c' is >= 0
→
3
←
Taking true branch
→
2210 mod_mask = 0x0;
2211 }
2212 break;
4
←
 Execution continues on line 2217
→
2213 }
2214
2215 // End of switch on command line character.
2216 // We come here if we have a normal character.
2217 if (s->do_abbr && (IS_SPECIAL(s->c)((s->c) < 0) || !vim_iswordc(s->c))
5
←
Assuming field 'do_abbr' is 0
→
2218 // Add ABBR_OFF for characters above 0x100, this is
2219 // what check_abbr() expects.
2220 && (ccheck_abbr((s->c >= 0x100) ? (s->c + ABBR_OFF0x100) : s->c)
2221 || s->c == Ctrl_RSB29)) {
2222 return command_line_changed(s);
2223 }
2224
2225 // put the character in the command line
2226 if (IS_SPECIAL(s->c)((s->c) < 0) || mod_mask
5.2
'mod_mask' is equal to 0

6
←
Taking false branch
→
2227 put_on_cmdline(get_special_key_name(s->c, mod_mask), -1, true1);
2228 } else {
2229 int j = utf_char2bytes(s->c, (char *)IObuff);
2230 IObuff[j] = NUL'\000'; // exclude composing chars
2231 put_on_cmdline(IObuff, j, true1);
2232 }
2233 return command_line_changed(s);

←
Calling 'command_line_changed'
→
2234}
2235
2236static int command_line_not_changed(CommandLineState *s)
2237{
2238 // Incremental searches for "/" and "?":
2239 // Enter command_line_not_changed() when a character has been read but the
2240 // command line did not change. Then we only search and redraw if something
2241 // changed in the past.
2242 // Enter command_line_changed() when the command line did change.
2243 if (!s->is_state.incsearch_postponed) {
2244 return 1;
2245 }
2246 return command_line_changed(s);
2247}
2248
2249/// Guess that the pattern matches everything. Only finds specific cases, such
2250/// as a trailing \|, which can happen while typing a pattern.
2251static int empty_pattern(char_u *p)
2252{
2253 size_t n = STRLEN(p)strlen((char *)(p));
2254
2255 // remove trailing \v and the like
2256 while (n >= 2 && p[n - 2] == '\\'
2257 && vim_strchr("mMvVcCZ", p[n - 1]) != NULL((void*)0)) {
2258 n -= 2;
2259 }
2260 return n == 0 || (n >= 2 && p[n - 2] == '\\' && p[n - 1] == '|');
2261}
2262
2263handle_T cmdpreview_get_bufnr(void)
2264{
2265 return cmdpreview_bufnr;
2266}
2267
2268long cmdpreview_get_ns(void)
2269{
2270 return cmdpreview_ns;
2271}
2272
2273/// Sets up command preview buffer.
2274///
2275/// @return Pointer to command preview buffer if succeeded, NULL if failed.
2276static buf_T *cmdpreview_open_buf(void)
2277{
2278 buf_T *cmdpreview_buf = cmdpreview_bufnr ? buflist_findnr(cmdpreview_bufnr) : NULL((void*)0);
2279
2280 // If preview buffer doesn't exist, open one.
2281 if (cmdpreview_buf == NULL((void*)0)) {
2282 Error err = ERROR_INIT{ .type = kErrorTypeNone, .msg = ((void*)0) };
2283 handle_T bufnr = nvim_create_buf(false0, true1, &err);
2284
2285 if (ERROR_SET(&err)((&err)->type != kErrorTypeNone)) {
2286 return NULL((void*)0);
2287 }
2288
2289 cmdpreview_buf = buflist_findnr(bufnr);
2290 }
2291
2292 // Preview buffer cannot preview itself!
2293 if (cmdpreview_buf == curbuf) {
2294 return NULL((void*)0);
2295 }
2296
2297 // Rename preview buffer.
2298 aco_save_T aco;
2299 aucmd_prepbuf(&aco, cmdpreview_buf);
2300 int retv = rename_buffer("[Preview]");
2301 aucmd_restbuf(&aco);
2302
2303 if (retv == FAIL0) {
2304 return NULL((void*)0);
2305 }
2306
2307 // Temporarily switch to preview buffer to set it up for previewing.
2308 aucmd_prepbuf(&aco, cmdpreview_buf);
2309 buf_clear();
2310 curbuf->b_p_ma = true1;
2311 curbuf->b_p_ul = -1;
2312 curbuf->b_p_tw = 0; // Reset 'textwidth' (was set by ftplugin)
2313 aucmd_restbuf(&aco);
2314 cmdpreview_bufnr = cmdpreview_buf->handle;
2315
2316 return cmdpreview_buf;
2317}
2318
2319/// Open command preview window if it's not already open.
2320/// Returns to original window after opening command preview window.
2321///
2322/// @param cmdpreview_buf Pointer to command preview buffer
2323///
2324/// @return Pointer to command preview window if succeeded, NULL if failed.
2325static win_T *cmdpreview_open_win(buf_T *cmdpreview_buf)
2326{
2327 win_T *save_curwin = curwin;
2328 bool_Bool win_found = false0;
2329
2330 // Try to find an existing preview window.
2331 FOR_ALL_WINDOWS_IN_TAB(wp, curtab)for (win_T *wp = ((curtab) == curtab) ? firstwin : (curtab)->
tp_firstwin; wp != ((void*)0); wp = wp->w_next) {
2332 if (wp->w_buffer == cmdpreview_buf) {
2333 win_enter(wp, false0);
2334 win_found = true1;
2335 break;
2336 }
2337 }
2338
2339 // If an existing window is not found, create one.
2340 if (!win_found && win_split((int)p_cwh, WSP_BOT8) == FAIL0) {
2341 return NULL((void*)0);
2342 }
2343
2344 win_T *preview_win = curwin;
2345 Error err = ERROR_INIT{ .type = kErrorTypeNone, .msg = ((void*)0) };
2346
2347 // Switch to preview buffer
2348 try_start();
2349 int result = do_buffer(DOBUF_GOTO, DOBUF_FIRST, FORWARD, cmdpreview_buf->handle, 0);
2350 if (try_end(&err) || result == FAIL0) {
2351 api_clear_error(&err);
2352 return NULL((void*)0);
2353 }
2354
2355 curwin->w_p_culw_onebuf_opt.wo_cul = false0;
2356 curwin->w_p_cucw_onebuf_opt.wo_cuc = false0;
2357 curwin->w_p_spellw_onebuf_opt.wo_spell = false0;
2358 curwin->w_p_fenw_onebuf_opt.wo_fen = false0;
2359
2360 win_enter(save_curwin, false0);
2361 return preview_win;
2362}
2363
2364/// Closes any open command preview windows.
2365static void cmdpreview_close_win(void)
2366{
2367 buf_T *buf = cmdpreview_bufnr ? buflist_findnr(cmdpreview_bufnr) : NULL((void*)0);
2368 if (buf != NULL((void*)0)) {
2369 close_windows(buf, false0);
2370 }
2371}
2372
2373/// Show 'inccommand' preview. It works like this:
2374/// 1. Store current undo information so we can revert to current state later.
2375/// 2. Execute the preview callback with the parsed command, preview buffer number and preview
2376/// namespace number as arguments. The preview callback sets the highlight and does the
2377/// changes required for the preview if needed.
2378/// 3. Preview callback returns 0, 1 or 2. 0 means no preview is shown. 1 means preview is shown
2379/// but preview window doesn't need to be opened. 2 means preview is shown and preview window
2380/// needs to be opened if inccommand=split.
2381/// 4. Use the return value of the preview callback to determine whether to
2382/// open the preview window or not and open preview window if needed.
2383/// 5. If the return value of the preview callback is not 0, update the screen while the effects
2384/// of the preview are still in place.
2385/// 6. Revert all changes made by the preview callback.
2386static void cmdpreview_show(CommandLineState *s)
2387{
2388 // Parse the command line and return if it fails.
2389 exarg_T ea;
2390 CmdParseInfo cmdinfo;
2391 // Copy the command line so we can modify it.
2392 char *cmdline = xstrdup((char *)ccline.cmdbuff);
2393 char *errormsg = NULL((void*)0);
2394
2395 parse_cmdline(cmdline, &ea, &cmdinfo, &errormsg);
2396 if (errormsg != NULL((void*)0)) {
19
←
Assuming 'errormsg' is equal to NULL
→
20
←
Taking false branch
→
2397 goto end;
2398 }
2399
2400 // Swap invalid command range if needed
2401 if ((ea.argt & EX_RANGE0x001) && ea.line1 > ea.line2) {
21
←
Assuming the condition is false
→
2402 linenr_T lnum = ea.line1;
2403 ea.line1 = ea.line2;
2404 ea.line2 = lnum;
2405 }
2406
2407 time_t save_b_u_time_cur = curbuf->b_u_time_cur;
2408 long save_b_u_seq_cur = curbuf->b_u_seq_cur;
2409 u_header_T *save_b_u_newhead = curbuf->b_u_newhead;
2410 long save_b_p_ul = curbuf->b_p_ul;
2411 int save_b_changed = curbuf->b_changed;
2412 int save_w_p_cul = curwin->w_p_culw_onebuf_opt.wo_cul;
2413 int save_w_p_cuc = curwin->w_p_cucw_onebuf_opt.wo_cuc;
2414 bool_Bool save_hls = p_hls;
2415 varnumber_T save_changedtick = buf_get_changedtick(curbuf);
2416 buf_T *cmdpreview_buf;
