←
'cmdpreview_buf' declared without an initial value
→
2417 win_T *cmdpreview_win;
2418 cmdmod_T save_cmdmod = cmdmod;
2419
2420 cmdpreview = true1;
2421 emsg_silent++; // Block error reporting as the command may be incomplete
2422 msg_silent++; // Block messages, namely ones that prompt
2423 block_autocmds(); // Block events
2424 garray_T save_view;
2425 win_size_save(&save_view); // Save current window sizes
2426 save_search_patterns(); // Save search patterns
2427 curbuf->b_p_ul = LONG_MAX9223372036854775807L; // Make sure we can undo all changes
2428 curwin->w_p_culw_onebuf_opt.wo_cul = false0; // Disable 'cursorline' so it doesn't mess up the highlights
2429 curwin->w_p_cucw_onebuf_opt.wo_cuc = false0; // Disable 'cursorcolumn' so it doesn't mess up the highlights
2430 p_hls = false0; // Don't show search highlighting during live substitution
2431 cmdmod.split = 0; // Disable :leftabove/botright modifiers
2432 cmdmod.tab = 0; // Disable :tab modifier
2433 cmdmod.noswapfile = true1; // Disable swap for preview buffer
2434
2435 // Open preview buffer if inccommand=split.
2436 if (*p_icm == 'n') {
23
←
Assuming the condition is true
→
24
←
Taking true branch
→
2437 cmdpreview_bufnr = 0;
2438 } else if ((cmdpreview_buf = cmdpreview_open_buf()) == NULL((void*)0)) {
2439 abort();
2440 }
2441
2442 // Setup preview namespace if it's not already set.
2443 if (!cmdpreview_ns) {
25
←
Assuming 'cmdpreview_ns' is not equal to 0
→
26
←
Taking false branch
→
2444 cmdpreview_ns = (int)nvim_create_namespace((String)STRING_INIT{ .data = ((void*)0), .size = 0 });
2445 }
2446
2447 // Execute the preview callback and use its return value to determine whether to show preview or
2448 // open the preview window. The preview callback also handles doing the changes and highlights for
2449 // the preview.
2450 Error err = ERROR_INIT{ .type = kErrorTypeNone, .msg = ((void*)0) };
2451 try_start();
2452 int cmdpreview_type = execute_cmd(&ea, &cmdinfo, true1);
2453 if (try_end(&err)) {
27
←
Assuming the condition is false
→
28
←
Taking false branch
→
2454 api_clear_error(&err);
2455 cmdpreview_type = 0;
2456 }
2457
2458 // If inccommand=split and preview callback returns 2, open preview window.
2459 if (*p_icm != 'n' && cmdpreview_type == 2
29
←
Assuming the condition is true
→
30
←
Assuming 'cmdpreview_type' is equal to 2
→
2460 && (cmdpreview_win = cmdpreview_open_win(cmdpreview_buf)) == NULL((void*)0)) {
31
←
1st function call argument is an uninitialized value
2461 abort();
2462 }
2463
2464 // If preview callback is nonzero, update screen now.
2465 if (cmdpreview_type != 0) {
2466 int save_rd = RedrawingDisabled;
2467 RedrawingDisabled = 0;
2468 update_screen(SOME_VALID35);
2469 RedrawingDisabled = save_rd;
2470 }
2471
2472 // Close preview window if it's open.
2473 if (*p_icm != 'n' && cmdpreview_type == 2 && cmdpreview_win != NULL((void*)0)) {
2474 cmdpreview_close_win();
2475 }
2476 // Clear preview highlights.
2477 extmark_clear(curbuf, (uint32_t)cmdpreview_ns, 0, 0, MAXLNUM, MAXCOL);
2478
2479 curbuf->b_changed = save_b_changed; // Preserve 'modified' during preview
2480
2481 if (curbuf->b_u_seq_cur != save_b_u_seq_cur) {
2482 // Undo invisibly. This also moves the cursor!
2483 while (curbuf->b_u_seq_cur != save_b_u_seq_cur) {
2484 if (!u_undo_and_forget(1)) {
2485 abort();
2486 }
2487 }
2488 // Restore newhead. It is meaningless when curhead is valid, but we must
2489 // restore it so that undotree() is identical before/after the preview.
2490 curbuf->b_u_newhead = save_b_u_newhead;
2491 curbuf->b_u_time_cur = save_b_u_time_cur;
2492 }
2493 if (save_changedtick != buf_get_changedtick(curbuf)) {
2494 buf_set_changedtick(curbuf, save_changedtick);
2495 }
2496
2497 cmdmod = save_cmdmod; // Restore cmdmod
2498 p_hls = save_hls; // Restore 'hlsearch'
2499 curwin->w_p_culw_onebuf_opt.wo_cul = save_w_p_cul; // Restore 'cursorline'
2500 curwin->w_p_cucw_onebuf_opt.wo_cuc = save_w_p_cuc; // Restore 'cursorcolumn'
2501 curbuf->b_p_ul = save_b_p_ul; // Restore 'undolevels'
2502 restore_search_patterns(); // Restore search patterns
2503 win_size_restore(&save_view); // Restore window sizes
2504 ga_clear(&save_view);
2505 unblock_autocmds(); // Unblock events
2506 msg_silent--; // Unblock messages
2507 emsg_silent--; // Unblock error reporting
2508
2509 // Restore the window "view".
2510 curwin->w_cursor = s->is_state.save_cursor;
2511 restore_viewstate(&s->is_state.old_viewstate);
2512 update_topline(curwin);
2513
2514 redrawcmdline();
2515
2516 // If preview callback returned 0, update screen to clear remnants of an earlier preview.
2517 if (cmdpreview_type == 0) {
2518 update_screen(SOME_VALID35);
2519 }
2520end:
2521 xfree(cmdline);
2522}
2523
2524static int command_line_changed(CommandLineState *s)
2525{
2526 // Trigger CmdlineChanged autocommands.
2527 if (has_event(EVENT_CMDLINECHANGED)) {
8
←
Assuming the condition is false
→
9
←
Taking false branch
→
2528 TryState tstate;
2529 Error err = ERROR_INIT{ .type = kErrorTypeNone, .msg = ((void*)0) };
2530 save_v_event_T save_v_event;
2531 dict_T *dict = get_v_event(&save_v_event);
2532
2533 char firstcbuf[2];
2534 firstcbuf[0] = (char)(s->firstc > 0 ? s->firstc : '-');
2535 firstcbuf[1] = 0;
2536
2537 // set v:event to a dictionary with information about the commandline
2538 tv_dict_add_str(dict, S_LEN("cmdtype")("cmdtype"), (sizeof("cmdtype") - 1), firstcbuf);
2539 tv_dict_add_nr(dict, S_LEN("cmdlevel")("cmdlevel"), (sizeof("cmdlevel") - 1), ccline.level);
2540 tv_dict_set_keys_readonly(dict);
2541 try_enter(&tstate);
2542
2543 apply_autocmds(EVENT_CMDLINECHANGED, firstcbuf, firstcbuf, false0, curbuf);
2544 restore_v_event(dict, &save_v_event);
2545
2546 bool_Bool tl_ret = try_leave(&tstate, &err);
2547 if (!tl_ret && ERROR_SET(&err)((&err)->type != kErrorTypeNone)) {
2548 msg_putchar('\n');
2549 msg_printf_attr(HL_ATTR(HLF_E)highlight_attr[(int)(HLF_E)]|MSG_HIST0x1000, (char *)e_autocmd_err, err.msg);
2550 api_clear_error(&err);
2551 redrawcmd();
2552 }
2553 }
2554
2555 // 'incsearch' highlighting.
2556 if (s->firstc == ':'
10
←
Assuming the condition is true
→
17
←
Taking true branch
→
2557 && current_sctx.sc_sid == 0 // only if interactive
11
←
Assuming field 'sc_sid' is equal to 0
→
2558 && *p_icm != NUL'\000' // 'inccommand' is set
12
←
Assuming the condition is true
→
2559 && curbuf->b_p_ma // buffer is modifiable
13
←
Assuming field 'b_p_ma' is not equal to 0
→
2560 && cmdline_star == 0 // not typing a password
14
←
Assuming 'cmdline_star' is equal to 0
→
2561 && cmd_can_preview((char *)ccline.cmdbuff)
15
←
Assuming the condition is true
→
2562 && !vpeekc_any()) {
16
←
Assuming the condition is true
→
2563 cmdpreview_show(s);
18
←
Calling 'cmdpreview_show'
→
2564 } else if (cmdpreview) {
2565 cmdpreview = false0;
2566 update_screen(SOME_VALID35); // Clear 'inccommand' preview.
2567 } else {
2568 if (s->xpc.xp_context == EXPAND_NOTHING && (KeyTyped || vpeekc() == NUL'\000')) {
2569 may_do_incsearch_highlighting(s->firstc, s->count, &s->is_state);
2570 }
2571 }
2572
2573 if (cmdmsg_rl || (p_arshape && !p_tbidi)) {
2574 // Always redraw the whole command line to fix shaping and
2575 // right-left typing. Not efficient, but it works.
2576 // Do it only when there are no characters left to read
2577 // to avoid useless intermediate redraws.
2578 // if cmdline is external the ui handles shaping, no redraw needed.
2579 if (!ui_has(kUICmdline) && vpeekc() == NUL'\000') {
2580 redrawcmd();
2581 }
2582 }
2583
2584 return 1;
2585}
2586
2587/// Abandon the command line.
2588static void abandon_cmdline(void)
2589{
2590 XFREE_CLEAR(ccline.cmdbuff)do { void **ptr_ = (void **)&(ccline.cmdbuff); xfree(*ptr_
); *ptr_ = ((void*)0); (void)(*ptr_); } while (0);
2591 ccline.redraw_state = kCmdRedrawNone;
2592 if (msg_scrolled == 0) {
2593 compute_cmdrow();
2594 }
2595 msg("");
2596 redraw_cmdline = true1;
2597}
2598
2599/// getcmdline() - accept a command line starting with firstc.
2600///
2601/// firstc == ':' get ":" command line.
2602/// firstc == '/' or '?' get search pattern
2603/// firstc == '=' get expression
2604/// firstc == '@' get text for input() function
2605/// firstc == '>' get text for debug mode
2606/// firstc == NUL get text for :insert command
2607/// firstc == -1 like NUL, and break on CTRL-C
2608///
2609/// The line is collected in ccline.cmdbuff, which is reallocated to fit the
2610/// command line.
2611///
2612/// Careful: getcmdline() can be called recursively!
2613///
2614/// Return pointer to allocated string if there is a commandline, NULL
2615/// otherwise.
2616///
2617/// @param count only used for incremental search
2618/// @param indent indent for inside conditionals
2619char_u *getcmdline(int firstc, long count, int indent, bool_Bool do_concat FUNC_ATTR_UNUSED)
2620{
2621 return command_line_enter(firstc, count, indent, true1);
2622}
2623
2624/// Get a command line with a prompt
2625///
2626/// This is prepared to be called recursively from getcmdline() (e.g. by
2627/// f_input() when evaluating an expression from `<C-r>=`).
2628///
2629/// @param[in] firstc Prompt type: e.g. '@' for input(), '>' for debug.
2630/// @param[in] prompt Prompt string: what is displayed before the user text.
2631/// @param[in] attr Prompt highlighting.
2632/// @param[in] xp_context Type of expansion.
2633/// @param[in] xp_arg User-defined expansion argument.
2634/// @param[in] highlight_callback Callback used for highlighting user input.
2635///
2636/// @return [allocated] Command line or NULL.
2637char *getcmdline_prompt(const char firstc, const char *const prompt, const int attr,
2638 const int xp_context, const char *const xp_arg,
2639 const Callback highlight_callback)
2640 FUNC_ATTR_WARN_UNUSED_RESULT FUNC_ATTR_MALLOC
2641{
2642 const int msg_col_save = msg_col;
2643
2644 CmdlineInfo save_ccline;
2645 bool_Bool did_save_ccline = false0;
2646 if (ccline.cmdbuff != NULL((void*)0)) {
2647 // Save the values of the current cmdline and restore them below.
2648 save_cmdline(&save_ccline);
2649 did_save_ccline = true1;
2650 } else {
2651 memset(&ccline, 0, sizeof(struct cmdline_info));
2652 }
2653 ccline.prompt_id = last_prompt_id++;
2654 ccline.cmdprompt = (char_u *)prompt;
2655 ccline.cmdattr = attr;
2656 ccline.xp_context = xp_context;
2657 ccline.xp_arg = (char_u *)xp_arg;
2658 ccline.input_fn = (firstc == '@');
2659 ccline.highlight_callback = highlight_callback;
2660
2661 int msg_silent_saved = msg_silent;
2662 msg_silent = 0;
2663
2664 char *const ret = (char *)command_line_enter(firstc, 1L, 0, false0);
2665
2666 if (did_save_ccline) {
2667 restore_cmdline(&save_ccline);
2668 }
2669 msg_silent = msg_silent_saved;
2670 // Restore msg_col, the prompt from input() may have changed it.
2671 // But only if called recursively and the commandline is therefore being
2672 // restored to an old one; if not, the input() prompt stays on the screen,
2673 // so we need its modified msg_col left intact.
2674 if (ccline.cmdbuff != NULL((void*)0)) {
2675 msg_col = msg_col_save;
2676 }
2677
2678 return ret;
2679}
2680
2681/*
2682 * Return TRUE when the text must not be changed and we can't switch to
2683 * another window or buffer. Used when editing the command line etc.
2684 */
2685int text_locked(void)
2686{
2687 if (cmdwin_type != 0) {
2688 return TRUE1;
2689 }
2690 return textlock != 0;
2691}
2692
2693/*
2694 * Give an error message for a command that isn't allowed while the cmdline
2695 * window is open or editing the cmdline in another way.
2696 */
2697void text_locked_msg(void)
2698{
2699 emsg(_(get_text_locked_msg())gettext((char *)(get_text_locked_msg())));
2700}
2701
2702char *get_text_locked_msg(void)
2703{
2704 if (cmdwin_type != 0) {
2705 return e_cmdwin;
2706 } else {
2707 return e_secure;
2708 }
2709}
2710
2711/// Check if "curbuf->b_ro_locked" or "allbuf_lock" is set and
2712/// return true when it is and give an error message.
2713bool_Bool curbuf_locked(void)
2714{
2715 if (curbuf->b_ro_locked > 0) {
2716 emsg(_(e_cannot_edit_other_buf)gettext((char *)(e_cannot_edit_other_buf)));
2717 return true1;
2718 }
2719 return allbuf_locked();
2720}
2721
2722// Check if "allbuf_lock" is set and return true when it is and give an error
2723// message.
2724bool_Bool allbuf_locked(void)
2725{
2726 if (allbuf_lock > 0) {
2727 emsg(_("E811: Not allowed to change buffer information now")gettext((char *)("E811: Not allowed to change buffer information now"
)));
2728 return true1;
2729 }
2730 return false0;
2731}
2732
2733static int cmdline_charsize(int idx)
2734{
2735 if (cmdline_star > 0) { // showing '*', always 1 position
2736 return 1;
2737 }
2738 return ptr2cells(ccline.cmdbuff + idx);
2739}
2740
2741/// Compute the offset of the cursor on the command line for the prompt and
2742/// indent.
2743static int cmd_startcol(void)
2744{
2745 return ccline.cmdindent + ((ccline.cmdfirstc != NUL'\000') ? 1 : 0);
2746}
2747
2748/// Compute the column position for a byte position on the command line.
2749static int cmd_screencol(int bytepos)
2750{
2751 int m; // maximum column
2752
2753 int col = cmd_startcol();
2754 if (KeyTyped) {
2755 m = Columns * Rows;
2756 if (m < 0) { // overflow, Columns or Rows at weird value
2757 m = MAXCOL;
2758 }
2759 } else {
2760 m = MAXCOL;
2761 }
2762
2763 for (int i = 0; i < ccline.cmdlen && i < bytepos;
2764 i += utfc_ptr2len((char *)ccline.cmdbuff + i)) {
2765 int c = cmdline_charsize(i);
2766 // Count ">" for double-wide multi-byte char that doesn't fit.
2767 correct_screencol(i, c, &col);
2768
2769 // If the cmdline doesn't fit, show cursor on last visible char.
2770 // Don't move the cursor itself, so we can still append.
2771 if ((col += c) >= m) {
2772 col -= c;
2773 break;
2774 }
2775 }
2776 return col;
2777}
2778
2779/// Check if the character at "idx", which is "cells" wide, is a multi-byte
2780/// character that doesn't fit, so that a ">" must be displayed.
2781static void correct_screencol(int idx, int cells, int *col)
2782{
2783 if (utfc_ptr2len((char *)ccline.cmdbuff + idx) > 1
2784 && utf_ptr2cells((char *)ccline.cmdbuff + idx) > 1
2785 && (*col) % Columns + cells > Columns) {
2786 (*col)++;
2787 }
2788}
2789
2790/// Get an Ex command line for the ":" command.
2791///
2792/// @param c normally ':', NUL for ":append"
2793/// @param indent indent for inside conditionals
2794char *getexline(int c, void *cookie, int indent, bool_Bool do_concat)
2795{
2796 // When executing a register, remove ':' that's in front of each line.
2797 if (exec_from_reg && vpeekc() == ':') {
2798 (void)vgetc();
2799 }
2800
2801 return (char *)getcmdline(c, 1L, indent, do_concat);
2802}
2803
2804bool_Bool cmdline_overstrike(void)
2805 FUNC_ATTR_PURE
2806{
2807 return ccline.overstrike;
2808}
2809
2810/// Return true if the cursor is at the end of the cmdline.
2811bool_Bool cmdline_at_end(void)
2812 FUNC_ATTR_PURE
2813{
2814 return (ccline.cmdpos >= ccline.cmdlen);
2815}
2816
2817/*
2818 * Allocate a new command line buffer.
2819 * Assigns the new buffer to ccline.cmdbuff and ccline.cmdbufflen.
2820 */
2821static void alloc_cmdbuff(int len)
2822{
2823 /*
2824 * give some extra space to avoid having to allocate all the time
2825 */
2826 if (len < 80) {
2827 len = 100;
2828 } else {
2829 len += 20;
2830 }
2831
2832 ccline.cmdbuff = xmalloc((size_t)len);
2833 ccline.cmdbufflen = len;
2834}
2835
2836/*
2837 * Re-allocate the command line to length len + something extra.
2838 */
2839static void realloc_cmdbuff(int len)
2840{
2841 if (len < ccline.cmdbufflen) {
2842 return; // no need to resize
2843 }
2844
2845 char_u *p = ccline.cmdbuff;
2846 alloc_cmdbuff(len); // will get some more
2847 // There isn't always a NUL after the command, but it may need to be
2848 // there, thus copy up to the NUL and add a NUL.
2849 memmove(ccline.cmdbuff, p, (size_t)ccline.cmdlen);
2850 ccline.cmdbuff[ccline.cmdlen] = NUL'\000';
2851 xfree(p);
2852
2853 if (ccline.xpc != NULL((void*)0)
2854 && ccline.xpc->xp_pattern != NULL((void*)0)
2855 && ccline.xpc->xp_context != EXPAND_NOTHING
2856 && ccline.xpc->xp_context != EXPAND_UNSUCCESSFUL) {
2857 int i = (int)((char_u *)ccline.xpc->xp_pattern - p);
2858
2859 // If xp_pattern points inside the old cmdbuff it needs to be adjusted
2860 // to point into the newly allocated memory.
2861 if (i >= 0 && i <= ccline.cmdlen) {
2862 ccline.xpc->xp_pattern = (char *)ccline.cmdbuff + i;
2863 }
2864 }
2865}
2866
2867static char *arshape_buf = NULL((void*)0);
2868
2869#if defined(EXITFREE1)
2870void free_arshape_buf(void)
2871{
2872 xfree(arshape_buf);
2873}
2874
2875#endif
2876
2877enum { MAX_CB_ERRORS = 1, };
2878
2879/// Color expression cmdline using built-in expressions parser
2880///
2881/// @param[in] colored_ccline Command-line to color.
2882/// @param[out] ret_ccline_colors What should be colored.
2883///
2884/// Always colors the whole cmdline.
2885static void color_expr_cmdline(const CmdlineInfo *const colored_ccline,
2886 ColoredCmdline *const ret_ccline_colors)
2887 FUNC_ATTR_NONNULL_ALL
2888{
2889 ParserLine parser_lines[] = {
2890 {
2891 .data = (const char *)colored_ccline->cmdbuff,
2892 .size = STRLEN(colored_ccline->cmdbuff)strlen((char *)(colored_ccline->cmdbuff)),
2893 .allocated = false0,
2894 },
2895 { NULL((void*)0), 0, false0 },
2896 };
2897 ParserLine *plines_p = parser_lines;
2898 ParserHighlight colors;
2899 kvi_init(colors)((colors).capacity = ((sizeof((colors).init_array)/sizeof(((colors
).init_array)[0])) / ((size_t)(!(sizeof((colors).init_array) %
sizeof(((colors).init_array)[0]))))), (colors).size = 0, (colors
).items = (colors).init_array);
2900 ParserState pstate;
2901 viml_parser_init(&pstate, parser_simple_get_line, &plines_p, &colors);
2902 ExprAST east = viml_pexpr_parse(&pstate, kExprFlagsDisallowEOC);
2903 viml_pexpr_free_ast(east);
2904 viml_parser_destroy(&pstate);
2905 kv_resize(ret_ccline_colors->colors, kv_size(colors))((ret_ccline_colors->colors).capacity = (((colors).size)),
(ret_ccline_colors->colors).items = xrealloc((ret_ccline_colors
->colors).items, sizeof((ret_ccline_colors->colors).items
[0]) * (ret_ccline_colors->colors).capacity));
2906 size_t prev_end = 0;
2907 for (size_t i = 0; i < kv_size(colors)((colors).size); i++) {
2908 const ParserHighlightChunk chunk = kv_A(colors, i)((colors).items[(i)]);
2909 assert(chunk.start.col < INT_MAX)((void) sizeof ((chunk.start.col < 2147483647) ? 1 : 0), __extension__
({ if (chunk.start.col < 2147483647) ; else __assert_fail
("chunk.start.col < INT_MAX", "/home/runner/work/doc/doc/neovim/src/nvim/ex_getln.c"
, 2909, __extension__ __PRETTY_FUNCTION__); }));
2910 assert(chunk.end_col < INT_MAX)((void) sizeof ((chunk.end_col < 2147483647) ? 1 : 0), __extension__
({ if (chunk.end_col < 2147483647) ; else __assert_fail (
"chunk.end_col < INT_MAX", "/home/runner/work/doc/doc/neovim/src/nvim/ex_getln.c"
, 2910, __extension__ __PRETTY_FUNCTION__); }));
2911 if (chunk.start.col != prev_end) {
2912 kv_push(ret_ccline_colors->colors, ((CmdlineColorChunk) {(*((((ret_ccline_colors->colors).size == (ret_ccline_colors
->colors).capacity) ? (((ret_ccline_colors->colors).capacity

->colors).capacity << 1 : 8), (ret_ccline_colors->
colors).items = xrealloc((ret_ccline_colors->colors).items
, sizeof((ret_ccline_colors->colors).items[0]) * (ret_ccline_colors
->colors).capacity)), 0) : 0), ((ret_ccline_colors->colors
).items + ((ret_ccline_colors->colors).size++))) = (((CmdlineColorChunk
) { .start = (int)prev_end, .end = (int)chunk.start.col, .attr
= 0, })))
2913 .start = (int)prev_end,(*((((ret_ccline_colors->colors).size == (ret_ccline_colors
->colors).capacity) ? (((ret_ccline_colors->colors).capacity

= 0, })))

->colors).capacity)), 0) : 0), ((ret_ccline_colors->colors
).items + ((ret_ccline_colors->colors).size++))) = (((CmdlineColorChunk
) { .start = (int)prev_end, .end = (int)chunk.start.col, .attr
= 0, })))
2916 }))(*((((ret_ccline_colors->colors).size == (ret_ccline_colors
->colors).capacity) ? (((ret_ccline_colors->colors).capacity
= ((ret_ccline_colors->colors).capacity ? (ret_ccline_colors
->colors).capacity << 1 : 8), (ret_ccline_colors->
colors).items = xrealloc((ret_ccline_colors->colors).items
, sizeof((ret_ccline_colors->colors).items[0]) * (ret_ccline_colors
->colors).capacity)), 0) : 0), ((ret_ccline_colors->colors
).items + ((ret_ccline_colors->colors).size++))) = (((CmdlineColorChunk
) { .start = (int)prev_end, .end = (int)chunk.start.col, .attr
= 0, })));
2917 }
2918 const int id = syn_name2id(chunk.group);
2919 const int attr = (id == 0 ? 0 : syn_id2attr(id));
2920 kv_push(ret_ccline_colors->colors, ((CmdlineColorChunk) {(*((((ret_ccline_colors->colors).size == (ret_ccline_colors
->colors).capacity) ? (((ret_ccline_colors->colors).capacity
= ((ret_ccline_colors->colors).capacity ? (ret_ccline_colors
->colors).capacity << 1 : 8), (ret_ccline_colors->

).items + ((ret_ccline_colors->colors).size++))) = (((CmdlineColorChunk
) { .start = (int)chunk.start.col, .end = (int)chunk.end_col,
.attr = attr, })))
2921 .start = (int)chunk.start.col,(*((((ret_ccline_colors->colors).size == (ret_ccline_colors
->colors).capacity) ? (((ret_ccline_colors->colors).capacity

->colors).capacity << 1 : 8), (ret_ccline_colors->

, sizeof((ret_ccline_colors->colors).items[0]) * (ret_ccline_colors
->colors).capacity)), 0) : 0), ((ret_ccline_colors->colors
).items + ((ret_ccline_colors->colors).size++))) = (((CmdlineColorChunk
) { .start = (int)chunk.start.col, .end = (int)chunk.end_col,
.attr = attr, })))
2922 .end = (int)chunk.end_col,(*((((ret_ccline_colors->colors).size == (ret_ccline_colors
->colors).capacity) ? (((ret_ccline_colors->colors).capacity
= ((ret_ccline_colors->colors).capacity ? (ret_ccline_colors
->colors).capacity << 1 : 8), (ret_ccline_colors->
colors).items = xrealloc((ret_ccline_colors->colors).items
, sizeof((ret_ccline_colors->colors).items[0]) * (ret_ccline_colors
->colors).capacity)), 0) : 0), ((ret_ccline_colors->colors
).items + ((ret_ccline_colors->colors).size++))) = (((CmdlineColorChunk
) { .start = (int)chunk.start.col, .end = (int)chunk.end_col,
.attr = attr, })))
2923 .attr = attr,(*((((ret_ccline_colors->colors).size == (ret_ccline_colors
->colors).capacity) ? (((ret_ccline_colors->colors).capacity
= ((ret_ccline_colors->colors).capacity ? (ret_ccline_colors
->colors).capacity << 1 : 8), (ret_ccline_colors->
colors).items = xrealloc((ret_ccline_colors->colors).items
, sizeof((ret_ccline_colors->colors).items[0]) * (ret_ccline_colors
->colors).capacity)), 0) : 0), ((ret_ccline_colors->colors
).items + ((ret_ccline_colors->colors).size++))) = (((CmdlineColorChunk
) { .start = (int)chunk.start.col, .end = (int)chunk.end_col,
.attr = attr, })))
2924 }))(*((((ret_ccline_colors->colors).size == (ret_ccline_colors
->colors).capacity) ? (((ret_ccline_colors->colors).capacity
= ((ret_ccline_colors->colors).capacity ? (ret_ccline_colors
->colors).capacity << 1 : 8), (ret_ccline_colors->
colors).items = xrealloc((ret_ccline_colors->colors).items
, sizeof((ret_ccline_colors->colors).items[0]) * (ret_ccline_colors
->colors).capacity)), 0) : 0), ((ret_ccline_colors->colors
).items + ((ret_ccline_colors->colors).size++))) = (((CmdlineColorChunk
) { .start = (int)chunk.start.col, .end = (int)chunk.end_col,
.attr = attr, })));
2925 prev_end = chunk.end_col;
2926 }
2927 if (prev_end < (size_t)colored_ccline->cmdlen) {
2928 kv_push(ret_ccline_colors->colors, ((CmdlineColorChunk) {(*((((ret_ccline_colors->colors).size == (ret_ccline_colors
->colors).capacity) ? (((ret_ccline_colors->colors).capacity
= ((ret_ccline_colors->colors).capacity ? (ret_ccline_colors
->colors).capacity << 1 : 8), (ret_ccline_colors->
colors).items = xrealloc((ret_ccline_colors->colors).items
, sizeof((ret_ccline_colors->colors).items[0]) * (ret_ccline_colors
->colors).capacity)), 0) : 0), ((ret_ccline_colors->colors
).items + ((ret_ccline_colors->colors).size++))) = (((CmdlineColorChunk
) { .start = (int)prev_end, .end = colored_ccline->cmdlen,
.attr = 0, })))
2929 .start = (int)prev_end,(*((((ret_ccline_colors->colors).size == (ret_ccline_colors
->colors).capacity) ? (((ret_ccline_colors->colors).capacity
= ((ret_ccline_colors->colors).capacity ? (ret_ccline_colors
->colors).capacity << 1 : 8), (ret_ccline_colors->
colors).items = xrealloc((ret_ccline_colors->colors).items
, sizeof((ret_ccline_colors->colors).items[0]) * (ret_ccline_colors
->colors).capacity)), 0) : 0), ((ret_ccline_colors->colors
).items + ((ret_ccline_colors->colors).size++))) = (((CmdlineColorChunk
) { .start = (int)prev_end, .end = colored_ccline->cmdlen,
.attr = 0, })))
2930 .end = colored_ccline->cmdlen,(*((((ret_ccline_colors->colors).size == (ret_ccline_colors
->colors).capacity) ? (((ret_ccline_colors->colors).capacity
= ((ret_ccline_colors->colors).capacity ? (ret_ccline_colors
->colors).capacity << 1 : 8), (ret_ccline_colors->
colors).items = xrealloc((ret_ccline_colors->colors).items
, sizeof((ret_ccline_colors->colors).items[0]) * (ret_ccline_colors
->colors).capacity)), 0) : 0), ((ret_ccline_colors->colors
).items + ((ret_ccline_colors->colors).size++))) = (((CmdlineColorChunk
) { .start = (int)prev_end, .end = colored_ccline->cmdlen,
.attr = 0, })))
2931 .attr = 0,(*((((ret_ccline_colors->colors).size == (ret_ccline_colors
->colors).capacity) ? (((ret_ccline_colors->colors).capacity
= ((ret_ccline_colors->colors).capacity ? (ret_ccline_colors
->colors).capacity << 1 : 8), (ret_ccline_colors->
colors).items = xrealloc((ret_ccline_colors->colors).items
, sizeof((ret_ccline_colors->colors).items[0]) * (ret_ccline_colors
->colors).capacity)), 0) : 0), ((ret_ccline_colors->colors
).items + ((ret_ccline_colors->colors).size++))) = (((CmdlineColorChunk
) { .start = (int)prev_end, .end = colored_ccline->cmdlen,
.attr = 0, })))
2932 }))(*((((ret_ccline_colors->colors).size == (ret_ccline_colors
->colors).capacity) ? (((ret_ccline_colors->colors).capacity
= ((ret_ccline_colors->colors).capacity ? (ret_ccline_colors
->colors).capacity << 1 : 8), (ret_ccline_colors->
colors).items = xrealloc((ret_ccline_colors->colors).items
, sizeof((ret_ccline_colors->colors).items[0]) * (ret_ccline_colors
->colors).capacity)), 0) : 0), ((ret_ccline_colors->colors
).items + ((ret_ccline_colors->colors).size++))) = (((CmdlineColorChunk
) { .start = (int)prev_end, .end = colored_ccline->cmdlen,
.attr = 0, })));
2933 }
2934 kvi_destroy(colors)do { if ((colors).items != (colors).init_array) { do { void *
*ptr_ = (void **)&((colors).items); xfree(*ptr_); *ptr_ =
((void*)0); (void)(*ptr_); } while (0); } } while (0);
2935}
2936
2937/// Color command-line
2938///
2939/// Should use built-in command parser or user-specified one. Currently only the
2940/// latter is supported.
2941///
2942/// @param[in,out] colored_ccline Command-line to color. Also holds a cache:
2943/// if ->prompt_id and ->cmdbuff values happen
2944/// to be equal to those from colored_cmdline it
2945/// will just do nothing, assuming that ->colors
2946/// already contains needed data.
2947///
2948/// Always colors the whole cmdline.
2949///
2950/// @return true if draw_cmdline may proceed, false if it does not need anything
2951/// to do.
2952static bool_Bool color_cmdline(CmdlineInfo *colored_ccline)
2953 FUNC_ATTR_NONNULL_ALL FUNC_ATTR_WARN_UNUSED_RESULT
2954{
2955 bool_Bool printed_errmsg = false0;
2956
2957#define PRINT_ERRMSG(...) \
2958 do { \
2959 msg_putchar('\n'); \
2960 msg_printf_attr(HL_ATTR(HLF_E)highlight_attr[(int)(HLF_E)]|MSG_HIST0x1000, __VA_ARGS__); \
2961 printed_errmsg = true1; \
2962 } while (0)
2963 bool_Bool ret = true1;
2964
2965 ColoredCmdline *ccline_colors = &colored_ccline->last_colors;
2966
2967 // Check whether result of the previous call is still valid.
2968 if (ccline_colors->prompt_id == colored_ccline->prompt_id
2969 && ccline_colors->cmdbuff != NULL((void*)0)
2970 && STRCMP(ccline_colors->cmdbuff, colored_ccline->cmdbuff)strcmp((char *)(ccline_colors->cmdbuff), (char *)(colored_ccline
->cmdbuff)) == 0) {
2971 return ret;
2972 }
2973
2974 kv_size(ccline_colors->colors)((ccline_colors->colors).size) = 0;
2975
2976 if (colored_ccline->cmdbuff == NULL((void*)0) || *colored_ccline->cmdbuff == NUL'\000') {
2977 // Nothing to do, exiting.
2978 XFREE_CLEAR(ccline_colors->cmdbuff)do { void **ptr_ = (void **)&(ccline_colors->cmdbuff);
xfree(*ptr_); *ptr_ = ((void*)0); (void)(*ptr_); } while (0);
2979 return ret;
2980 }
2981
2982 bool_Bool arg_allocated = false0;
2983 typval_T arg = {
2984 .v_type = VAR_STRING,
2985 .vval.v_string = (char *)colored_ccline->cmdbuff,
2986 };
2987 typval_T tv = { .v_type = VAR_UNKNOWN };
2988
2989 static unsigned prev_prompt_id = UINT_MAX(2147483647 *2U +1U);
2990 static int prev_prompt_errors = 0;
2991 Callback color_cb = CALLBACK_NONE((Callback){ .type = kCallbackNone });
2992 bool_Bool can_free_cb = false0;
2993 TryState tstate;
2994 Error err = ERROR_INIT{ .type = kErrorTypeNone, .msg = ((void*)0) };
2995 const char *err_errmsg = (const char *)e_intern2;
2996 bool_Bool dgc_ret = true1;
2997 bool_Bool tl_ret = true1;
2998
2999 if (colored_ccline->prompt_id != prev_prompt_id) {
3000 prev_prompt_errors = 0;
3001 prev_prompt_id = colored_ccline->prompt_id;
3002 } else if (prev_prompt_errors >= MAX_CB_ERRORS) {
3003 goto color_cmdline_end;
3004 }
3005 if (colored_ccline->highlight_callback.type != kCallbackNone) {
3006 // Currently this should only happen while processing input() prompts.
3007 assert(colored_ccline->input_fn)((void) sizeof ((colored_ccline->input_fn) ? 1 : 0), __extension__
({ if (colored_ccline->input_fn) ; else __assert_fail ("colored_ccline->input_fn"
, "/home/runner/work/doc/doc/neovim/src/nvim/ex_getln.c", 3007
, __extension__ __PRETTY_FUNCTION__); }));
3008 color_cb = colored_ccline->highlight_callback;
3009 } else if (colored_ccline->cmdfirstc == ':') {
3010 try_enter(&tstate);
3011 err_errmsg = N_("E5408: Unable to get g:Nvim_color_cmdline callback: %s")"E5408: Unable to get g:Nvim_color_cmdline callback: %s";
3012 dgc_ret = tv_dict_get_callback(&globvardict, S_LEN("Nvim_color_cmdline")("Nvim_color_cmdline"), (sizeof("Nvim_color_cmdline") - 1),
3013 &color_cb);
3014 tl_ret = try_leave(&tstate, &err);
3015 can_free_cb = true1;
3016 } else if (colored_ccline->cmdfirstc == '=') {
3017 color_expr_cmdline(colored_ccline, ccline_colors);
3018 }
3019 if (!tl_ret || !dgc_ret) {
3020 goto color_cmdline_error;
3021 }
3022
3023 if (color_cb.type == kCallbackNone) {
3024 goto color_cmdline_end;
3025 }
3026 if (colored_ccline->cmdbuff[colored_ccline->cmdlen] != NUL'\000') {
3027 arg_allocated = true1;
3028 arg.vval.v_string = xmemdupz((const char *)colored_ccline->cmdbuff,
3029 (size_t)colored_ccline->cmdlen);
3030 }
3031 // msg_start() called by e.g. :echo may shift command-line to the first column
3032 // even though msg_silent is here. Two ways to workaround this problem without
3033 // altering message.c: use full_screen or save and restore msg_col.
3034 //
3035 // Saving and restoring full_screen does not work well with :redraw!. Saving
3036 // and restoring msg_col is neither ideal, but while with full_screen it
3037 // appears shifted one character to the right and cursor position is no longer
3038 // correct, with msg_col it just misses leading `:`. Since `redraw!` in
3039 // callback lags this is least of the user problems.
3040 //
3041 // Also using try_enter() because error messages may overwrite typed
3042 // command-line which is not expected.
3043 getln_interrupted_highlight = false0;
3044 try_enter(&tstate);
3045 err_errmsg = N_("E5407: Callback has thrown an exception: %s")"E5407: Callback has thrown an exception: %s";
3046 const int saved_msg_col = msg_col;
3047 msg_silent++;
3048 const bool_Bool cbcall_ret = callback_call(&color_cb, 1, &arg, &tv);
3049 msg_silent--;
3050 msg_col = saved_msg_col;
3051 if (got_int) {
3052 getln_interrupted_highlight = true1;
3053 }
3054 if (!try_leave(&tstate, &err) || !cbcall_ret) {
3055 goto color_cmdline_error;
3056 }
3057 if (tv.v_type != VAR_LIST) {
3058 PRINT_ERRMSG("%s", _("E5400: Callback should return list")gettext((char *)("E5400: Callback should return list")));
3059 goto color_cmdline_error;
3060 }
3061 if (tv.vval.v_list == NULL((void*)0)) {
3062 goto color_cmdline_end;
3063 }
3064 varnumber_T prev_end = 0;
3065 int i = 0;
3066 TV_LIST_ITER_CONST(tv.vval.v_list, li, {do { const list_T *const l_ = (tv.vval.v_list); ; if (l_ != (
(void*)0)) { for (const listitem_T *li = l_->lv_first; li !=
((void*)0); li = li->li_next) { { if ((&(li)->li_tv
)->v_type != VAR_LIST) { PRINT_ERRMSG(gettext((char *)("E5401: List item %i is not a List"
)), i); goto color_cmdline_error; } const list_T *const l = (
&(li)->li_tv)->vval.v_list; if (tv_list_len(l) != 3
) { PRINT_ERRMSG(gettext((char *)("E5402: List item %i has incorrect length: %d /= 3"
)), i, tv_list_len(l)); goto color_cmdline_error; } _Bool error
= 0; const varnumber_T start = ( tv_get_number_chk((&(tv_list_first
(l))->li_tv), &error)); if (error) { goto color_cmdline_error

3126 }));do { const list_T *const l_ = (tv.vval.v_list); ; if (l_ != (
(void*)0)) { for (const listitem_T *li = l_->lv_first; li !=

)->v_type != VAR_LIST) { PRINT_ERRMSG(gettext((char *)("E5401: List item %i is not a List"

3138 assert(!ERROR_SET(&err))((void) sizeof ((!((&err)->type != kErrorTypeNone)) ? 1
: 0), __extension__ ({ if (!((&err)->type != kErrorTypeNone
)) ; else __assert_fail ("!ERROR_SET(&err)", "/home/runner/work/doc/doc/neovim/src/nvim/ex_getln.c"
, 3138, __extension__ __PRETTY_FUNCTION__); }));
3139 if (can_free_cb) {
3140 callback_free(&color_cb);
3141 }
3142 xfree(ccline_colors->cmdbuff);
3143 // Note: errors output is cached just as well as regular results.
3144 ccline_colors->prompt_id = colored_ccline->prompt_id;
3145 if (arg_allocated) {
3146 ccline_colors->cmdbuff = arg.vval.v_string;
3147 } else {
3148 ccline_colors->cmdbuff = xmemdupz((const char *)colored_ccline->cmdbuff,
3149 (size_t)colored_ccline->cmdlen);
3150 }
3151 tv_clear(&tv);
3152 return ret;
3153color_cmdline_error:
3154 if (ERROR_SET(&err)((&err)->type != kErrorTypeNone)) {
3155 PRINT_ERRMSG(_(err_errmsg)gettext((char *)(err_errmsg)), err.msg);
3156 api_clear_error(&err);
3157 }
3158 assert(printed_errmsg)((void) sizeof ((printed_errmsg) ? 1 : 0), __extension__ ({ if
(printed_errmsg) ; else __assert_fail ("printed_errmsg", "/home/runner/work/doc/doc/neovim/src/nvim/ex_getln.c"
, 3158, __extension__ __PRETTY_FUNCTION__); }));
3159 (void)printed_errmsg;
3160
3161 prev_prompt_errors++;
3162 kv_size(ccline_colors->colors)((ccline_colors->colors).size) = 0;
3163 redrawcmdline();
3164 ret = false0;
3165 goto color_cmdline_end;
3166#undef PRINT_ERRMSG
3167}
3168
3169/*
3170 * Draw part of the cmdline at the current cursor position. But draw stars
3171 * when cmdline_star is TRUE.
3172 */
3173static void draw_cmdline(int start, int len)
3174{
3175 if (!color_cmdline(&ccline)) {
3176 return;
3177 }
3178
3179 if (ui_has(kUICmdline)) {
3180 ccline.special_char = NUL'\000';
3181 ccline.redraw_state = kCmdRedrawAll;
3182 return;
3183 }
3184
3185 if (cmdline_star > 0) {
3186 for (int i = 0; i < len; i++) {
3187 msg_putchar('*');
3188 i += utfc_ptr2len((char *)ccline.cmdbuff + start + i) - 1;
3189 }
3190 } else if (p_arshape && !p_tbidi && len > 0) {
3191 bool_Bool do_arabicshape = false0;
3192 int mb_l;
3193 for (int i = start; i < start + len; i += mb_l) {
3194 char_u *p = ccline.cmdbuff + i;
3195 int u8cc[MAX_MCO6];
3196 int u8c = utfc_ptr2char_len(p, u8cc, start + len - i);
3197 mb_l = utfc_ptr2len_len(p, start + len - i);
3198 if (arabic_char(u8c)) {
3199 do_arabicshape = true1;
3200 break;
3201 }
3202 }
3203 if (!do_arabicshape) {
3204 goto draw_cmdline_no_arabicshape;
3205 }
3206
3207 static size_t buflen = 0;
3208 assert(len >= 0)((void) sizeof ((len >= 0) ? 1 : 0), __extension__ ({ if (
len >= 0) ; else __assert_fail ("len >= 0", "/home/runner/work/doc/doc/neovim/src/nvim/ex_getln.c"
, 3208, __extension__ __PRETTY_FUNCTION__); }));
3209
3210 // Do arabic shaping into a temporary buffer. This is very
3211 // inefficient!
3212 if ((size_t)len * 2 + 2 > buflen) {
3213 // Re-allocate the buffer. We keep it around to avoid a lot of
3214 // alloc()/free() calls.
3215 xfree(arshape_buf);
3216 buflen = (size_t)len * 2 + 2;
3217 arshape_buf = xmalloc(buflen);
3218 }
3219
3220 int newlen = 0;
3221 if (utf_iscomposing(utf_ptr2char((char *)ccline.cmdbuff + start))) {
3222 // Prepend a space to draw the leading composing char on.
3223 arshape_buf[0] = ' ';
3224 newlen = 1;
3225 }
3226
3227 int prev_c = 0;
3228 int prev_c1 = 0;
3229 for (int i = start; i < start + len; i += mb_l) {
3230 char_u *p = ccline.cmdbuff + i;
3231 int u8cc[MAX_MCO6];
3232 int u8c = utfc_ptr2char_len(p, u8cc, start + len - i);
3233 mb_l = utfc_ptr2len_len(p, start + len - i);
3234 if (arabic_char(u8c)) {
3235 int pc;
3236 int pc1 = 0;
3237 int nc = 0;
3238 // Do Arabic shaping.
3239 if (cmdmsg_rl) {
3240 // Displaying from right to left.
3241 pc = prev_c;
3242 pc1 = prev_c1;
3243 prev_c1 = u8cc[0];
3244 if (i + mb_l >= start + len) {
3245 nc = NUL'\000';
3246 } else {
3247 nc = utf_ptr2char((char *)p + mb_l);
3248 }
3249 } else {
3250 // Displaying from left to right.
3251 if (i + mb_l >= start + len) {
3252 pc = NUL'\000';
3253 } else {
3254 int pcc[MAX_MCO6];
3255
3256 pc = utfc_ptr2char_len(p + mb_l, pcc, start + len - i - mb_l);
3257 pc1 = pcc[0];
3258 }
3259 nc = prev_c;
3260 }
3261 prev_c = u8c;
3262
3263 u8c = arabic_shape(u8c, NULL((void*)0), &u8cc[0], pc, pc1, nc);
3264
3265 newlen += utf_char2bytes(u8c, arshape_buf + newlen);
3266 if (u8cc[0] != 0) {
3267 newlen += utf_char2bytes(u8cc[0], arshape_buf + newlen);
3268 if (u8cc[1] != 0) {
3269 newlen += utf_char2bytes(u8cc[1], arshape_buf + newlen);
3270 }
3271 }
3272 } else {
3273 prev_c = u8c;
3274 memmove(arshape_buf + newlen, p, (size_t)mb_l);
3275 newlen += mb_l;
3276 }
3277 }
3278
3279 msg_outtrans_len((char_u *)arshape_buf, newlen);
3280 } else {
3281draw_cmdline_no_arabicshape:
3282 if (kv_size(ccline.last_colors.colors)((ccline.last_colors.colors).size)) {
3283 for (size_t i = 0; i < kv_size(ccline.last_colors.colors)((ccline.last_colors.colors).size); i++) {
3284 CmdlineColorChunk chunk = kv_A(ccline.last_colors.colors, i)((ccline.last_colors.colors).items[(i)]);
3285 if (chunk.end <= start) {
3286 continue;
3287 }
3288 const int chunk_start = MAX(chunk.start, start)(((chunk.start)>(start))?(chunk.start):(start));
3289 msg_outtrans_len_attr(ccline.cmdbuff + chunk_start,
3290 chunk.end - chunk_start,
3291 chunk.attr);
3292 }
3293 } else {
3294 msg_outtrans_len(ccline.cmdbuff + start, len);
3295 }
3296 }
3297}
3298
3299static void ui_ext_cmdline_show(CmdlineInfo *line)
3300{
3301 Array content = ARRAY_DICT_INIT{ .size = 0, .capacity = 0, .items = ((void*)0) };
3302 if (cmdline_star) {
3303 size_t len = 0;
3304 for (char_u *p = ccline.cmdbuff; *p; MB_PTR_ADV(p)(p += utfc_ptr2len((char *)p))) {
3305 len++;
3306 }
3307 char *buf = xmallocz(len);
3308 memset(buf, '*', len);
3309 Array item = ARRAY_DICT_INIT{ .size = 0, .capacity = 0, .items = ((void*)0) };
3310 ADD(item, INTEGER_OBJ(0))(*((((item).size == (item).capacity) ? (((item).capacity = ((
item).capacity ? (item).capacity << 1 : 8), (item).items
= xrealloc((item).items, sizeof((item).items[0]) * (item).capacity
)), 0) : 0), ((item).items + ((item).size++))) = (((Object) {
.type = kObjectTypeInteger, .data.integer = 0 })));
3311 ADD(item, STRING_OBJ(((String) { .data = buf, .size = len })))(*((((item).size == (item).capacity) ? (((item).capacity = ((
item).capacity ? (item).capacity << 1 : 8), (item).items
= xrealloc((item).items, sizeof((item).items[0]) * (item).capacity
)), 0) : 0), ((item).items + ((item).size++))) = (((Object) {
.type = kObjectTypeString, .data.string = ((String) { .data =
buf, .size = len }) })));
3312 ADD(content, ARRAY_OBJ(item))(*((((content).size == (content).capacity) ? (((content).capacity
= ((content).capacity ? (content).capacity << 1 : 8), (
content).items = xrealloc((content).items, sizeof((content).items
[0]) * (content).capacity)), 0) : 0), ((content).items + ((content
).size++))) = (((Object) { .type = kObjectTypeArray, .data.array
= item })));
3313 } else if (kv_size(line->last_colors.colors)((line->last_colors.colors).size)) {
3314 for (size_t i = 0; i < kv_size(line->last_colors.colors)((line->last_colors.colors).size); i++) {
3315 CmdlineColorChunk chunk = kv_A(line->last_colors.colors, i)((line->last_colors.colors).items[(i)]);
3316 Array item = ARRAY_DICT_INIT{ .size = 0, .capacity = 0, .items = ((void*)0) };
3317 ADD(item, INTEGER_OBJ(chunk.attr))(*((((item).size == (item).capacity) ? (((item).capacity = ((
item).capacity ? (item).capacity << 1 : 8), (item).items
= xrealloc((item).items, sizeof((item).items[0]) * (item).capacity
)), 0) : 0), ((item).items + ((item).size++))) = (((Object) {
.type = kObjectTypeInteger, .data.integer = chunk.attr })));
3318
3319 assert(chunk.end >= chunk.start)((void) sizeof ((chunk.end >= chunk.start) ? 1 : 0), __extension__
({ if (chunk.end >= chunk.start) ; else __assert_fail ("chunk.end >= chunk.start"
, "/home/runner/work/doc/doc/neovim/src/nvim/ex_getln.c", 3319
, __extension__ __PRETTY_FUNCTION__); }));
3320 ADD(item, STRING_OBJ(cbuf_to_string((char *)line->cmdbuff + chunk.start,(*((((item).size == (item).capacity) ? (((item).capacity = ((
item).capacity ? (item).capacity << 1 : 8), (item).items
= xrealloc((item).items, sizeof((item).items[0]) * (item).capacity
)), 0) : 0), ((item).items + ((item).size++))) = (((Object) {
.type = kObjectTypeString, .data.string = cbuf_to_string((char
*)line->cmdbuff + chunk.start, (size_t)(chunk.end - chunk
.start)) })))
3321 (size_t)(chunk.end - chunk.start))))(*((((item).size == (item).capacity) ? (((item).capacity = ((
item).capacity ? (item).capacity << 1 : 8), (item).items
= xrealloc((item).items, sizeof((item).items[0]) * (item).capacity
)), 0) : 0), ((item).items + ((item).size++))) = (((Object) {
.type = kObjectTypeString, .data.string = cbuf_to_string((char
*)line->cmdbuff + chunk.start, (size_t)(chunk.end - chunk
.start)) })));
3322 ADD(content, ARRAY_OBJ(item))(*((((content).size == (content).capacity) ? (((content).capacity
= ((content).capacity ? (content).capacity << 1 : 8), (
content).items = xrealloc((content).items, sizeof((content).items
[0]) * (content).capacity)), 0) : 0), ((content).items + ((content
).size++))) = (((Object) { .type = kObjectTypeArray, .data.array
= item })));
3323 }
3324 } else {
3325 Array item = ARRAY_DICT_INIT{ .size = 0, .capacity = 0, .items = ((void*)0) };
3326 ADD(item, INTEGER_OBJ(0))(*((((item).size == (item).capacity) ? (((item).capacity = ((
item).capacity ? (item).capacity << 1 : 8), (item).items
= xrealloc((item).items, sizeof((item).items[0]) * (item).capacity
)), 0) : 0), ((item).items + ((item).size++))) = (((Object) {
.type = kObjectTypeInteger, .data.integer = 0 })));
3327 ADD(item, STRING_OBJ(cstr_to_string((char *)(line->cmdbuff))))(*((((item).size == (item).capacity) ? (((item).capacity = ((
item).capacity ? (item).capacity << 1 : 8), (item).items
= xrealloc((item).items, sizeof((item).items[0]) * (item).capacity
)), 0) : 0), ((item).items + ((item).size++))) = (((Object) {
.type = kObjectTypeString, .data.string = cstr_to_string((char
*)(line->cmdbuff)) })));
3328 ADD(content, ARRAY_OBJ(item))(*((((content).size == (content).capacity) ? (((content).capacity
= ((content).capacity ? (content).capacity << 1 : 8), (
content).items = xrealloc((content).items, sizeof((content).items
[0]) * (content).capacity)), 0) : 0), ((content).items + ((content
).size++))) = (((Object) { .type = kObjectTypeArray, .data.array
= item })));
3329 }
3330 ui_call_cmdline_show(content, line->cmdpos,
3331 cchar_to_string((char)line->cmdfirstc),
3332 cstr_to_string((char *)(line->cmdprompt)),
3333 line->cmdindent,
3334 line->level);
3335 if (line->special_char) {
3336 ui_call_cmdline_special_char(cchar_to_string(line->special_char),
3337 line->special_shift,
3338 line->level);
3339 }
3340}
3341
3342void ui_ext_cmdline_block_append(size_t indent, const char *line)
3343{
3344 char *buf = xmallocz(indent + strlen(line));
3345 memset(buf, ' ', indent);
3346 memcpy(buf + indent, line, strlen(line)); // -V575
3347
3348 Array item = ARRAY_DICT_INIT{ .size = 0, .capacity = 0, .items = ((void*)0) };
3349 ADD(item, INTEGER_OBJ(0))(*((((item).size == (item).capacity) ? (((item).capacity = ((
item).capacity ? (item).capacity << 1 : 8), (item).items
= xrealloc((item).items, sizeof((item).items[0]) * (item).capacity
)), 0) : 0), ((item).items + ((item).size++))) = (((Object) {
.type = kObjectTypeInteger, .data.integer = 0 })));
3350 ADD(item, STRING_OBJ(cstr_as_string(buf)))(*((((item).size == (item).capacity) ? (((item).capacity = ((
item).capacity ? (item).capacity << 1 : 8), (item).items
= xrealloc((item).items, sizeof((item).items[0]) * (item).capacity
)), 0) : 0), ((item).items + ((item).size++))) = (((Object) {
.type = kObjectTypeString, .data.string = cstr_as_string(buf
) })));
3351 Array content = ARRAY_DICT_INIT{ .size = 0, .capacity = 0, .items = ((void*)0) };
3352 ADD(content, ARRAY_OBJ(item))(*((((content).size == (content).capacity) ? (((content).capacity
= ((content).capacity ? (content).capacity << 1 : 8), (
content).items = xrealloc((content).items, sizeof((content).items
[0]) * (content).capacity)), 0) : 0), ((content).items + ((content
).size++))) = (((Object) { .type = kObjectTypeArray, .data.array
= item })));
3353 ADD(cmdline_block, ARRAY_OBJ(content))(*((((cmdline_block).size == (cmdline_block).capacity) ? (((cmdline_block
).capacity = ((cmdline_block).capacity ? (cmdline_block).capacity
<< 1 : 8), (cmdline_block).items = xrealloc((cmdline_block
).items, sizeof((cmdline_block).items[0]) * (cmdline_block).capacity
)), 0) : 0), ((cmdline_block).items + ((cmdline_block).size++
))) = (((Object) { .type = kObjectTypeArray, .data.array = content
})));
3354 if (cmdline_block.size > 1) {
3355 ui_call_cmdline_block_append(copy_array(content));
3356 } else {
3357 ui_call_cmdline_block_show(copy_array(cmdline_block));
3358 }
3359}
3360
3361void ui_ext_cmdline_block_leave(void)
3362{
3363 api_free_array(cmdline_block);
3364 cmdline_block = (Array)ARRAY_DICT_INIT{ .size = 0, .capacity = 0, .items = ((void*)0) };
3365 ui_call_cmdline_block_hide();
3366}
3367
3368/// Extra redrawing needed for redraw! and on ui_attach
3369/// assumes "redrawcmdline()" will already be invoked
3370void cmdline_screen_cleared(void)
3371{
3372 if (!ui_has(kUICmdline)) {
3373 return;
3374 }
3375
3376 if (cmdline_block.size) {
3377 ui_call_cmdline_block_show(copy_array(cmdline_block));
3378 }
3379
3380 int prev_level = ccline.level - 1;
3381 CmdlineInfo *line = ccline.prev_ccline;
3382 while (prev_level > 0 && line) {
3383 if (line->level == prev_level) {
3384 // don't redraw a cmdline already shown in the cmdline window
3385 if (prev_level != cmdwin_level) {
3386 line->redraw_state = kCmdRedrawAll;
3387 }
3388 prev_level--;
3389 }
3390 line = line->prev_ccline;
3391 }
3392}
3393
3394/// called by ui_flush, do what redraws necessary to keep cmdline updated.
3395void cmdline_ui_flush(void)
3396{
3397 if (!ui_has(kUICmdline)) {
3398 return;
3399 }
3400 int level = ccline.level;
3401 CmdlineInfo *line = &ccline;
3402 while (level > 0 && line) {
3403 if (line->level == level) {
3404 if (line->redraw_state == kCmdRedrawAll) {
3405 ui_ext_cmdline_show(line);
3406 } else if (line->redraw_state == kCmdRedrawPos) {
3407 ui_call_cmdline_pos(line->cmdpos, line->level);
3408 }
3409 line->redraw_state = kCmdRedrawNone;
3410 level--;
3411 }
3412 line = line->prev_ccline;
3413 }
3414}
3415
3416/*
3417 * Put a character on the command line. Shifts the following text to the
3418 * right when "shift" is TRUE. Used for CTRL-V, CTRL-K, etc.
3419 * "c" must be printable (fit in one display cell)!
3420 */
3421void putcmdline(char c, int shift)
3422{
3423 if (cmd_silent) {
3424 return;
3425 }
3426 if (!ui_has(kUICmdline)) {
3427 msg_no_more = true1;
3428 msg_putchar(c);
3429 if (shift) {
3430 draw_cmdline(ccline.cmdpos, ccline.cmdlen - ccline.cmdpos);
3431 }
3432 msg_no_more = false0;
3433 } else if (ccline.redraw_state != kCmdRedrawAll) {
3434 ui_call_cmdline_special_char(cchar_to_string(c), shift,
3435 ccline.level);
3436 }
3437 cursorcmd();
3438 ccline.special_char = c;
3439 ccline.special_shift = shift;
3440 ui_cursor_shape();
3441}
3442
3443/// Undo a putcmdline(c, FALSE).
3444void unputcmdline(void)
3445{
3446 if (cmd_silent) {
3447 return;
3448 }
3449 msg_no_more = true1;
3450 if (ccline.cmdlen == ccline.cmdpos && !ui_has(kUICmdline)) {
3451 msg_putchar(' ');
3452 } else {
3453 draw_cmdline(ccline.cmdpos, utfc_ptr2len((char *)ccline.cmdbuff + ccline.cmdpos));
3454 }
3455 msg_no_more = false0;
3456 cursorcmd();
3457 ccline.special_char = NUL'\000';
3458 ui_cursor_shape();
3459}
3460
3461/*
3462 * Put the given string, of the given length, onto the command line.
3463 * If len is -1, then STRLEN() is used to calculate the length.
3464 * If 'redraw' is TRUE then the new part of the command line, and the remaining
3465 * part will be redrawn, otherwise it will not. If this function is called
3466 * twice in a row, then 'redraw' should be FALSE and redrawcmd() should be
3467 * called afterwards.
3468 */
3469void put_on_cmdline(char_u *str, int len, int redraw)
3470{
3471 int i;
3472 int m;
3473 int c;
3474
3475 if (len < 0) {
3476 len = (int)STRLEN(str)strlen((char *)(str));
3477 }
3478
3479 realloc_cmdbuff(ccline.cmdlen + len + 1);
3480
3481 if (!ccline.overstrike) {
3482 memmove(ccline.cmdbuff + ccline.cmdpos + len,
3483 ccline.cmdbuff + ccline.cmdpos,
3484 (size_t)(ccline.cmdlen - ccline.cmdpos));
3485 ccline.cmdlen += len;
3486 } else {
3487 // Count nr of characters in the new string.
3488 m = 0;
3489 for (i = 0; i < len; i += utfc_ptr2len((char *)str + i)) {
3490 m++;
3491 }
3492 // Count nr of bytes in cmdline that are overwritten by these
3493 // characters.
3494 for (i = ccline.cmdpos; i < ccline.cmdlen && m > 0;
3495 i += utfc_ptr2len((char *)ccline.cmdbuff + i)) {
3496 m--;
3497 }
3498 if (i < ccline.cmdlen) {
3499 memmove(ccline.cmdbuff + ccline.cmdpos + len,
3500 ccline.cmdbuff + i, (size_t)(ccline.cmdlen - i));
3501 ccline.cmdlen += ccline.cmdpos + len - i;
3502 } else {
3503 ccline.cmdlen = ccline.cmdpos + len;
3504 }
3505 }
3506 memmove(ccline.cmdbuff + ccline.cmdpos, str, (size_t)len);
3507 ccline.cmdbuff[ccline.cmdlen] = NUL'\000';
3508
3509 {
3510 // When the inserted text starts with a composing character,
3511 // backup to the character before it. There could be two of them.
3512 i = 0;
3513 c = utf_ptr2char((char *)ccline.cmdbuff + ccline.cmdpos);
3514 while (ccline.cmdpos > 0 && utf_iscomposing(c)) {
3515 i = utf_head_off(ccline.cmdbuff, ccline.cmdbuff + ccline.cmdpos - 1) + 1;
3516 ccline.cmdpos -= i;
3517 len += i;
3518 c = utf_ptr2char((char *)ccline.cmdbuff + ccline.cmdpos);
3519 }
3520 if (i == 0 && ccline.cmdpos > 0 && arabic_maycombine(c)) {
3521 // Check the previous character for Arabic combining pair.
3522 i = utf_head_off(ccline.cmdbuff, ccline.cmdbuff + ccline.cmdpos - 1) + 1;
3523 if (arabic_combine(utf_ptr2char((char *)ccline.cmdbuff + ccline.cmdpos - i), c)) {
3524 ccline.cmdpos -= i;
3525 len += i;
3526 } else {
3527 i = 0;
3528 }
3529 }
3530 if (i != 0) {
3531 // Also backup the cursor position.
3532 i = ptr2cells(ccline.cmdbuff + ccline.cmdpos);
3533 ccline.cmdspos -= i;
3534 msg_col -= i;
3535 if (msg_col < 0) {
3536 msg_col += Columns;
3537 --msg_row;
3538 }
3539 }
3540 }
3541
3542 if (redraw && !cmd_silent) {
3543 msg_no_more = TRUE1;
3544 i = cmdline_row;
3545 cursorcmd();
3546 draw_cmdline(ccline.cmdpos, ccline.cmdlen - ccline.cmdpos);
3547 // Avoid clearing the rest of the line too often.
3548 if (cmdline_row != i || ccline.overstrike) {
3549 msg_clr_eos();
3550 }
3551 msg_no_more = FALSE0;
3552 }
3553 if (KeyTyped) {
3554 m = Columns * Rows;
3555 if (m < 0) { // overflow, Columns or Rows at weird value
3556 m = MAXCOL;
3557 }
3558 } else {
3559 m = MAXCOL;
3560 }
3561 for (i = 0; i < len; i++) {
3562 c = cmdline_charsize(ccline.cmdpos);
3563 // count ">" for a double-wide char that doesn't fit.
3564 correct_screencol(ccline.cmdpos, c, &ccline.cmdspos);
3565 // Stop cursor at the end of the screen, but do increment the
3566 // insert position, so that entering a very long command
3567 // works, even though you can't see it.
3568 if (ccline.cmdspos + c < m) {
3569 ccline.cmdspos += c;
3570 }
3571 c = utfc_ptr2len((char *)ccline.cmdbuff + ccline.cmdpos) - 1;
3572 if (c > len - i - 1) {
3573 c = len - i - 1;
3574 }
3575 ccline.cmdpos += c;
3576 i += c;
3577 ccline.cmdpos++;
3578 }
3579
3580 if (redraw) {
3581 msg_check();
3582 }
3583}
3584
3585/// Save ccline, because obtaining the "=" register may execute "normal :cmd"
3586/// and overwrite it.
3587static void save_cmdline(struct cmdline_info *ccp)
3588{
3589 *ccp = ccline;
3590 memset(&ccline, 0, sizeof(struct cmdline_info));
3591 ccline.prev_ccline = ccp;
3592 ccline.cmdbuff = NULL((void*)0); // signal that ccline is not in use
3593}
3594
3595/// Restore ccline after it has been saved with save_cmdline().
3596static void restore_cmdline(struct cmdline_info *ccp)
3597 FUNC_ATTR_NONNULL_ALL
3598{
3599 ccline = *ccp;
3600}
3601
3602/// Paste a yank register into the command line.
3603/// Used by CTRL-R command in command-line mode.
3604/// insert_reg() can't be used here, because special characters from the
3605/// register contents will be interpreted as commands.
3606///
3607/// @param regname Register name.
3608/// @param literally Insert text literally instead of "as typed".
3609/// @param remcr When true, remove trailing CR.
3610///
3611/// @returns FAIL for failure, OK otherwise
3612static bool_Bool cmdline_paste(int regname, bool_Bool literally, bool_Bool remcr)
3613{
3614 char_u *arg;
3615 char_u *p;
3616 bool_Bool allocated;
3617
3618 // check for valid regname; also accept special characters for CTRL-R in
3619 // the command line
3620 if (regname != Ctrl_F6 && regname != Ctrl_P16 && regname != Ctrl_W23
3621 && regname != Ctrl_A1 && regname != Ctrl_L12
3622 && !valid_yank_reg(regname, false0)) {
3623 return FAIL0;
3624 }
3625
3626 // A register containing CTRL-R can cause an endless loop. Allow using
3627 // CTRL-C to break the loop.
3628 line_breakcheck();
3629 if (got_int) {
3630 return FAIL0;
3631 }
3632
3633 // Need to set "textlock" to avoid nasty things like going to another
3634 // buffer when evaluating an expression.
3635 textlock++;
3636 const bool_Bool i = get_spec_reg(regname, &arg, &allocated, true1);
3637 textlock--;
3638
3639 if (i) {
3640 // Got the value of a special register in "arg".
3641 if (arg == NULL((void*)0)) {
3642 return FAIL0;
3643 }
3644
3645 // When 'incsearch' is set and CTRL-R CTRL-W used: skip the duplicate
3646 // part of the word.
3647 p = arg;
3648 if (p_is && regname == Ctrl_W23) {
3649 char_u *w;
3650 int len;
3651
3652 // Locate start of last word in the cmd buffer.
3653 for (w = ccline.cmdbuff + ccline.cmdpos; w > ccline.cmdbuff;) {
3654 len = utf_head_off(ccline.cmdbuff, w - 1) + 1;
3655 if (!vim_iswordc(utf_ptr2char((char *)w - len))) {
3656 break;
3657 }
3658 w -= len;
3659 }
3660 len = (int)((ccline.cmdbuff + ccline.cmdpos) - w);
3661 if (p_ic ? STRNICMP(w, arg, len)strncasecmp((char *)(w), (char *)(arg), (size_t)(len)) == 0 : STRNCMP(w, arg, len)strncmp((char *)(w), (char *)(arg), (size_t)(len)) == 0) {
3662 p += len;
3663 }
3664 }
3665
3666 cmdline_paste_str(p, literally);
3667 if (allocated) {
3668 xfree(arg);
3669 }
3670 return OK1;
3671 }
3672
3673 return cmdline_paste_reg(regname, literally, remcr);
3674}
3675
3676/*
3677 * Put a string on the command line.
3678 * When "literally" is TRUE, insert literally.
3679 * When "literally" is FALSE, insert as typed, but don't leave the command
3680 * line.
3681 */
3682void cmdline_paste_str(char_u *s, int literally)
3683{
3684 int c, cv;
3685
3686 if (literally) {
3687 put_on_cmdline(s, -1, TRUE1);
3688 } else {
3689 while (*s != NUL'\000') {
3690 cv = *s;
3691 if (cv == Ctrl_V22 && s[1]) {
3692 s++;
3693 }
3694 c = mb_cptr2char_adv((const char_u **)&s);
3695 if (cv == Ctrl_V22 || c == ESC'\033' || c == Ctrl_C3
3696 || c == CAR'\015' || c == NL'\012' || c == Ctrl_L12
3697 || (c == Ctrl_BSL28 && *s == Ctrl_N14)) {
3698 stuffcharReadbuff(Ctrl_V22);
3699 }
3700 stuffcharReadbuff(c);
3701 }
3702 }
3703}
3704
3705/// Delete characters on the command line, from "from" to the current position.
3706static void cmdline_del(int from)
3707{
3708 assert(ccline.cmdpos <= ccline.cmdlen)((void) sizeof ((ccline.cmdpos <= ccline.cmdlen) ? 1 : 0),
__extension__ ({ if (ccline.cmdpos <= ccline.cmdlen) ; else
__assert_fail ("ccline.cmdpos <= ccline.cmdlen", "/home/runner/work/doc/doc/neovim/src/nvim/ex_getln.c"
, 3708, __extension__ __PRETTY_FUNCTION__); }));
3709 memmove(ccline.cmdbuff + from, ccline.cmdbuff + ccline.cmdpos,
3710 (size_t)ccline.cmdlen - (size_t)ccline.cmdpos + 1);
3711 ccline.cmdlen -= ccline.cmdpos - from;
3712 ccline.cmdpos = from;
3713}
3714
3715// This function is called when the screen size changes and with incremental
3716// search and in other situations where the command line may have been
3717// overwritten.
3718void redrawcmdline(void)
3719{
3720 if (cmd_silent) {
3721 return;
3722 }
3723 need_wait_return = false0;
3724 compute_cmdrow();
3725 redrawcmd();
3726 cursorcmd();
3727 ui_cursor_shape();
3728}
3729
3730static void redrawcmdprompt(void)
3731{
3732 int i;
3733
3734 if (cmd_silent) {
3735 return;
3736 }
3737 if (ui_has(kUICmdline)) {
3738 ccline.redraw_state = kCmdRedrawAll;
3739 return;
3740 }
3741 if (ccline.cmdfirstc != NUL'\000') {
3742 msg_putchar(ccline.cmdfirstc);
3743 }
3744 if (ccline.cmdprompt != NULL((void*)0)) {
3745 msg_puts_attr((const char *)ccline.cmdprompt, ccline.cmdattr);
3746 ccline.cmdindent = msg_col + (msg_row - cmdline_row) * Columns;
3747 // do the reverse of cmd_startcol()
3748 if (ccline.cmdfirstc != NUL'\000') {
3749 ccline.cmdindent--;
3750 }
3751 } else {
3752 for (i = ccline.cmdindent; i > 0; i--) {
3753 msg_putchar(' ');
3754 }
3755 }
3756}
3757
3758/*
3759 * Redraw what is currently on the command line.
3760 */
3761void redrawcmd(void)
3762{
3763 if (cmd_silent) {
3764 return;
3765 }
3766
3767 if (ui_has(kUICmdline)) {
3768 draw_cmdline(0, ccline.cmdlen);
3769 return;
3770 }
3771
3772 // when 'incsearch' is set there may be no command line while redrawing
3773 if (ccline.cmdbuff == NULL((void*)0)) {
3774 cmd_cursor_goto(cmdline_row, 0);
3775 msg_clr_eos();
3776 return;
3777 }
3778
3779 redrawing_cmdline = true1;
3780
3781 msg_start();
3782 redrawcmdprompt();
3783
3784 // Don't use more prompt, truncate the cmdline if it doesn't fit.
3785 msg_no_more = TRUE1;
3786 draw_cmdline(0, ccline.cmdlen);
3787 msg_clr_eos();
3788 msg_no_more = FALSE0;
3789
3790 ccline.cmdspos = cmd_screencol(ccline.cmdpos);
3791
3792 if (ccline.special_char != NUL'\000') {
3793 putcmdline(ccline.special_char, ccline.special_shift);
3794 }
3795
3796 /*
3797 * An emsg() before may have set msg_scroll. This is used in normal mode,
3798 * in cmdline mode we can reset them now.
3799 */
3800 msg_scroll = FALSE0; // next message overwrites cmdline
3801
3802 // Typing ':' at the more prompt may set skip_redraw. We don't want this
3803 // in cmdline mode.
3804 skip_redraw = false0;
3805
3806 redrawing_cmdline = false0;
3807}
3808
3809void compute_cmdrow(void)
3810{
3811 if (exmode_active || msg_scrolled != 0) {
3812 cmdline_row = Rows - 1;
3813 } else {
3814 win_T *wp = lastwin_nofloating();
3815 cmdline_row = wp->w_winrow + wp->w_height
3816 + wp->w_hsep_height + wp->w_status_height + global_stl_height();
3817 }
3818 lines_left = cmdline_row;
3819}
3820
3821static void cursorcmd(void)
3822{
3823 if (cmd_silent) {
3824 return;
3825 }
3826
3827 if (ui_has(kUICmdline)) {
3828 if (ccline.redraw_state < kCmdRedrawPos) {
3829 ccline.redraw_state = kCmdRedrawPos;
3830 }
3831 setcursor();
3832 return;
3833 }
3834
3835 if (cmdmsg_rl) {
3836 msg_row = cmdline_row + (ccline.cmdspos / (Columns - 1));
3837 msg_col = Columns - (ccline.cmdspos % (Columns - 1)) - 1;
3838 if (msg_row <= 0) {
3839 msg_row = Rows - 1;
3840 }
3841 } else {
3842 msg_row = cmdline_row + (ccline.cmdspos / Columns);
3843 msg_col = ccline.cmdspos % Columns;
3844 if (msg_row >= Rows) {
3845 msg_row = Rows - 1;
3846 }
3847 }
3848
3849 cmd_cursor_goto(msg_row, msg_col);
3850}
3851
3852static void cmd_cursor_goto(int row, int col)
3853{
3854 ScreenGrid *grid = &msg_grid_adj;
3855 grid_adjust(&grid, &row, &col);
3856 ui_grid_cursor_goto(grid->handle, row, col);
3857}
3858
3859void gotocmdline(bool_Bool clr)
3860{
3861 if (ui_has(kUICmdline)) {
3862 return;
3863 }
3864 msg_start();
3865 if (cmdmsg_rl) {
3866 msg_col = Columns - 1;
3867 } else {
3868 msg_col = 0; // always start in column 0
3869 }
3870 if (clr) { // clear the bottom line(s)
3871 msg_clr_eos(); // will reset clear_cmdline
3872 }
3873 cmd_cursor_goto(cmdline_row, 0);
3874}
3875
3876/*
3877 * Check the word in front of the cursor for an abbreviation.
3878 * Called when the non-id character "c" has been entered.
3879 * When an abbreviation is recognized it is removed from the text with
3880 * backspaces and the replacement string is inserted, followed by "c".
3881 */
3882static int ccheck_abbr(int c)
3883{
3884 int spos = 0;
3885
3886 if (p_paste || no_abbr) { // no abbreviations or in paste mode
3887 return false0;
3888 }
3889
3890 // Do not consider '<,'> be part of the mapping, skip leading whitespace.
3891 // Actually accepts any mark.
3892 while (spos < ccline.cmdlen && ascii_iswhite(ccline.cmdbuff[spos])) {
3893 spos++;
3894 }
3895 if (ccline.cmdlen - spos > 5
3896 && ccline.cmdbuff[spos] == '\''
3897 && ccline.cmdbuff[spos + 2] == ','
3898 && ccline.cmdbuff[spos + 3] == '\'') {
3899 spos += 5;
3900 } else {
3901 // check abbreviation from the beginning of the commandline
3902 spos = 0;
3903 }
3904
3905 return check_abbr(c, ccline.cmdbuff, ccline.cmdpos, spos);
3906}
3907
3908static int sort_func_compare(const void *s1, const void *s2)
3909{
3910 char_u *p1 = *(char_u **)s1;
3911 char_u *p2 = *(char_u **)s2;
3912
3913 if (*p1 != '<' && *p2 == '<') {
3914 return -1;
3915 }
3916 if (*p1 == '<' && *p2 != '<') {
3917 return 1;
3918 }
3919 return STRCMP(p1, p2)strcmp((char *)(p1), (char *)(p2));
3920}
3921
3922/// Return FAIL if this is not an appropriate context in which to do
3923/// completion of anything, return OK if it is (even if there are no matches).
3924/// For the caller, this means that the character is just passed through like a
3925/// normal character (instead of being expanded). This allows :s/^I^D etc.
3926///
3927/// @param options extra options for ExpandOne()
3928/// @param escape if TRUE, escape the returned matches
3929static int nextwild(expand_T *xp, int type, int options, int escape)
3930{
3931 int i, j;
3932 char_u *p1;
3933 char_u *p2;
3934 int difflen;
3935
3936 if (xp->xp_numfiles == -1) {
3937 set_expand_context(xp);
3938 cmd_showtail = expand_showtail(xp);
3939 }
3940
3941 if (xp->xp_context == EXPAND_UNSUCCESSFUL) {
3942 beep_flush();
3943 return OK1; // Something illegal on command line
3944 }
3945 if (xp->xp_context == EXPAND_NOTHING) {
3946 // Caller can use the character as a normal char instead
3947 return FAIL0;
3948 }
3949
3950 if (!(ui_has(kUICmdline) || ui_has(kUIWildmenu))) {
3951 msg_puts("..."); // show that we are busy
3952 ui_flush();
3953 }
3954
3955 i = (int)((char_u *)xp->xp_pattern - ccline.cmdbuff);
3956 assert(ccline.cmdpos >= i)((void) sizeof ((ccline.cmdpos >= i) ? 1 : 0), __extension__
({ if (ccline.cmdpos >= i) ; else __assert_fail ("ccline.cmdpos >= i"
, "/home/runner/work/doc/doc/neovim/src/nvim/ex_getln.c", 3956
, __extension__ __PRETTY_FUNCTION__); }));
3957 xp->xp_pattern_len = (size_t)ccline.cmdpos - (size_t)i;
3958
3959 if (type == WILD_NEXT4 || type == WILD_PREV5) {
3960 // Get next/previous match for a previous expanded pattern.
3961 p2 = ExpandOne(xp, NULL((void*)0), NULL((void*)0), 0, type);
3962 } else {
3963 // Translate string into pattern and expand it.
3964 p1 = addstar((char_u *)xp->xp_pattern, xp->xp_pattern_len, xp->xp_context);
3965 const int use_options = (
3966 options
3967 | WILD_HOME_REPLACE0x02
3968 | WILD_ADD_SLASH0x10
3969 | WILD_SILENT0x40
3970 | (escape ? WILD_ESCAPE0x80 : 0)
3971 | (p_wic ? WILD_ICASE0x100 : 0));
3972 p2 = ExpandOne(xp, p1, vim_strnsave(&ccline.cmdbuff[i], xp->xp_pattern_len),
3973 use_options, type);
3974 xfree(p1);
3975
3976 // xp->xp_pattern might have been modified by ExpandOne (for example,
3977 // in lua completion), so recompute the pattern index and length
3978 i = (int)((char_u *)xp->xp_pattern - ccline.cmdbuff);
3979 xp->xp_pattern_len = (size_t)ccline.cmdpos - (size_t)i;
3980
3981 // Longest match: make sure it is not shorter, happens with :help.
3982 if (p2 != NULL((void*)0) && type == WILD_LONGEST7) {
3983 for (j = 0; (size_t)j < xp->xp_pattern_len; j++) {
3984 if (ccline.cmdbuff[i + j] == '*'
3985 || ccline.cmdbuff[i + j] == '?') {
3986 break;
3987 }
3988 }
3989 if ((int)STRLEN(p2)strlen((char *)(p2)) < j) {
3990 XFREE_CLEAR(p2)do { void **ptr_ = (void **)&(p2); xfree(*ptr_); *ptr_ = (
(void*)0); (void)(*ptr_); } while (0);
3991 }
3992 }
3993 }
3994
3995 if (p2 != NULL((void*)0) && !got_int) {
3996 difflen = (int)STRLEN(p2)strlen((char *)(p2)) - (int)(xp->xp_pattern_len);
3997 if (ccline.cmdlen + difflen + 4 > ccline.cmdbufflen) {
3998 realloc_cmdbuff(ccline.cmdlen + difflen + 4);
3999 xp->xp_pattern = (char *)ccline.cmdbuff + i;
4000 }
4001 assert(ccline.cmdpos <= ccline.cmdlen)((void) sizeof ((ccline.cmdpos <= ccline.cmdlen) ? 1 : 0),
__extension__ ({ if (ccline.cmdpos <= ccline.cmdlen) ; else
__assert_fail ("ccline.cmdpos <= ccline.cmdlen", "/home/runner/work/doc/doc/neovim/src/nvim/ex_getln.c"
, 4001, __extension__ __PRETTY_FUNCTION__); }));
4002 memmove(&ccline.cmdbuff[ccline.cmdpos + difflen],
4003 &ccline.cmdbuff[ccline.cmdpos],
4004 (size_t)ccline.cmdlen - (size_t)ccline.cmdpos + 1);
4005 memmove(&ccline.cmdbuff[i], p2, STRLEN(p2)strlen((char *)(p2)));
4006 ccline.cmdlen += difflen;
4007 ccline.cmdpos += difflen;
4008 }
4009 xfree(p2);
4010
4011 redrawcmd();
4012 cursorcmd();
4013
4014 /* When expanding a ":map" command and no matches are found, assume that
4015 * the key is supposed to be inserted literally */
4016 if (xp->xp_context == EXPAND_MAPPINGS && p2 == NULL((void*)0)) {
4017 return FAIL0;
4018 }
4019
4020 if (xp->xp_numfiles <= 0 && p2 == NULL((void*)0)) {
4021 beep_flush();
4022 } else if (xp->xp_numfiles == 1) {
4023 // free expanded pattern
4024 (void)ExpandOne(xp, NULL((void*)0), NULL((void*)0), 0, WILD_FREE1);
4025 }
4026
4027 return OK1;
4028}
4029
4030/// Do wildcard expansion on the string 'str'.
4031/// Chars that should not be expanded must be preceded with a backslash.
4032/// Return a pointer to allocated memory containing the new string.
4033/// Return NULL for failure.
4034///
4035/// "orig" is the originally expanded string, copied to allocated memory. It
4036/// should either be kept in orig_save or freed. When "mode" is WILD_NEXT or
4037/// WILD_PREV "orig" should be NULL.
4038///
4039/// Results are cached in xp->xp_files and xp->xp_numfiles, except when "mode"
4040/// is WILD_EXPAND_FREE or WILD_ALL.
4041///
4042/// mode = WILD_FREE: just free previously expanded matches
4043/// mode = WILD_EXPAND_FREE: normal expansion, do not keep matches
4044/// mode = WILD_EXPAND_KEEP: normal expansion, keep matches
4045/// mode = WILD_NEXT: use next match in multiple match, wrap to first
4046/// mode = WILD_PREV: use previous match in multiple match, wrap to first
4047/// mode = WILD_ALL: return all matches concatenated
4048/// mode = WILD_LONGEST: return longest matched part
4049/// mode = WILD_ALL_KEEP: get all matches, keep matches
4050///
4051/// options = WILD_LIST_NOTFOUND: list entries without a match
4052/// options = WILD_HOME_REPLACE: do home_replace() for buffer names
4053/// options = WILD_USE_NL: Use '\n' for WILD_ALL
4054/// options = WILD_NO_BEEP: Don't beep for multiple matches
4055/// options = WILD_ADD_SLASH: add a slash after directory names
4056/// options = WILD_KEEP_ALL: don't remove 'wildignore' entries
4057/// options = WILD_SILENT: don't print warning messages
4058/// options = WILD_ESCAPE: put backslash before special chars
4059/// options = WILD_ICASE: ignore case for files
4060///
4061/// The variables xp->xp_context and xp->xp_backslash must have been set!
4062///
4063/// @param orig allocated copy of original of expanded string
4064char_u *ExpandOne(expand_T *xp, char_u *str, char_u *orig, int options, int mode)
4065{
4066 char_u *ss = NULL((void*)0);
4067 static int findex;
4068 static char_u *orig_save = NULL((void*)0); // kept value of orig
4069 int orig_saved = FALSE0;
4070 int i;
4071 int non_suf_match; // number without matching suffix
4072
4073 /*
4074 * first handle the case of using an old match
4075 */
4076 if (mode == WILD_NEXT4 || mode == WILD_PREV5) {
4077 if (xp->xp_numfiles > 0) {
4078 if (mode == WILD_PREV5) {
4079 if (findex == -1) {
4080 findex = xp->xp_numfiles;
4081 }
4082 --findex;
4083 } else { // mode == WILD_NEXT
4084 ++findex;
4085 }
4086
4087 /*
4088 * When wrapping around, return the original string, set findex to
4089 * -1.
4090 */
4091 if (findex < 0) {
4092 if (orig_save == NULL((void*)0)) {
4093 findex = xp->xp_numfiles - 1;
4094 } else {
4095 findex = -1;
4096 }
4097 }
4098 if (findex >= xp->xp_numfiles) {
4099 if (orig_save == NULL((void*)0)) {
4100 findex = 0;
4101 } else {
4102 findex = -1;
4103 }
4104 }
4105 if (compl_match_array) {
4106 compl_selected = findex;
4107 cmdline_pum_display(false0);
4108 } else if (p_wmnu) {
4109 win_redr_status_matches(xp, xp->xp_numfiles, (char_u **)xp->xp_files,
4110 findex, cmd_showtail);
4111 }
4112 if (findex == -1) {
4113 return vim_strsave(orig_save);
4114 }
4115 return vim_strsave((char_u *)xp->xp_files[findex]);
4116 } else {
4117 return NULL((void*)0);
4118 }
4119 }
4120
4121 if (mode == WILD_CANCEL9) {
4122 ss = vim_strsave(orig_save ? orig_save : (char_u *)"");
4123 } else if (mode == WILD_APPLY10) {
4124 ss = vim_strsave(findex == -1 ? (orig_save ? orig_save : (char_u *)"") :
4125 (char_u *)xp->xp_files[findex]);
4126 }
4127
4128 // free old names
4129 if (xp->xp_numfiles != -1 && mode != WILD_ALL6 && mode != WILD_LONGEST7) {
4130 FreeWild(xp->xp_numfiles, (char_u **)xp->xp_files);
4131 xp->xp_numfiles = -1;
4132 XFREE_CLEAR(orig_save)do { void **ptr_ = (void **)&(orig_save); xfree(*ptr_); *
ptr_ = ((void*)0); (void)(*ptr_); } while (0);
4133 }
4134 findex = 0;
4135
4136 if (mode == WILD_FREE1) { // only release file name
4137 return NULL((void*)0);
4138 }
4139
4140 if (xp->xp_numfiles == -1 && mode != WILD_APPLY10 && mode != WILD_CANCEL9) {
4141 xfree(orig_save);
4142 orig_save = orig;
4143 orig_saved = TRUE1;
4144
4145 /*
4146 * Do the expansion.
4147 */
4148 if (ExpandFromContext(xp, str, &xp->xp_numfiles, (char_u ***)&xp->xp_files,
4149 options) == FAIL0) {
4150#ifdef FNAME_ILLEGAL
4151 /* Illegal file name has been silently skipped. But when there
4152 * are wildcards, the real problem is that there was no match,
4153 * causing the pattern to be added, which has illegal characters.
4154 */
4155 if (!(options & WILD_SILENT0x40) && (options & WILD_LIST_NOTFOUND0x01)) {
4156 semsg(_(e_nomatch2)gettext((char *)(e_nomatch2)), str);
4157 }
4158#endif
4159 } else if (xp->xp_numfiles == 0) {
4160 if (!(options & WILD_SILENT0x40)) {
4161 semsg(_(e_nomatch2)gettext((char *)(e_nomatch2)), str);
4162 }
4163 } else {
4164 // Escape the matches for use on the command line.
4165 ExpandEscape(xp, str, xp->xp_numfiles, (char_u **)xp->xp_files, options);
4166
4167 /*
4168 * Check for matching suffixes in file names.
4169 */
4170 if (mode != WILD_ALL6 && mode != WILD_ALL_KEEP8
4171 && mode != WILD_LONGEST7) {
4172 if (xp->xp_numfiles) {
4173 non_suf_match = xp->xp_numfiles;
4174 } else {
4175 non_suf_match = 1;
4176 }
4177 if ((xp->xp_context == EXPAND_FILES
4178 || xp->xp_context == EXPAND_DIRECTORIES)
4179 && xp->xp_numfiles > 1) {
4180 /*
4181 * More than one match; check suffix.
4182 * The files will have been sorted on matching suffix in
4183 * expand_wildcards, only need to check the first two.
4184 */
4185 non_suf_match = 0;
4186 for (i = 0; i < 2; i++) {
4187 if (match_suffix((char_u *)xp->xp_files[i])) {
4188 non_suf_match++;
4189 }
4190 }
4191 }
4192 if (non_suf_match != 1) {
4193 /* Can we ever get here unless it's while expanding
4194 * interactively? If not, we can get rid of this all
4195 * together. Don't really want to wait for this message
4196 * (and possibly have to hit return to continue!).
4197 */
4198 if (!(options & WILD_SILENT0x40)) {
4199 emsg(_(e_toomany)gettext((char *)(e_toomany)));
4200 } else if (!(options & WILD_NO_BEEP0x08)) {
4201 beep_flush();
4202 }
4203 }
4204 if (!(non_suf_match != 1 && mode == WILD_EXPAND_FREE2)) {
4205 ss = vim_strsave((char_u *)xp->xp_files[0]);
4206 }
4207 }
4208 }
4209 }
4210
4211 // Find longest common part
4212 if (mode == WILD_LONGEST7 && xp->xp_numfiles > 0) {
4213 size_t len = 0;
4214
4215 for (size_t mb_len; xp->xp_files[0][len]; len += mb_len) {
4216 mb_len = (size_t)utfc_ptr2len(&xp->xp_files[0][len]);
4217 int c0 = utf_ptr2char(&xp->xp_files[0][len]);
4218 for (i = 1; i < xp->xp_numfiles; i++) {
4219 int ci = utf_ptr2char(&xp->xp_files[i][len]);
4220
4221 if (p_fic && (xp->xp_context == EXPAND_DIRECTORIES
4222 || xp->xp_context == EXPAND_FILES
4223 || xp->xp_context == EXPAND_SHELLCMD
4224 || xp->xp_context == EXPAND_BUFFERS)) {
4225 if (mb_tolower(c0) != mb_tolower(ci)) {
4226 break;
4227 }
4228 } else if (c0 != ci) {
4229 break;
4230 }
4231 }
4232 if (i < xp->xp_numfiles) {
4233 if (!(options & WILD_NO_BEEP0x08)) {
4234 vim_beep(BO_WILD0x40000);
4235 }
4236 break;
4237 }
4238 }
4239
4240 ss = (char_u *)xstrndup(xp->xp_files[0], len);
4241 findex = -1; // next p_wc gets first one
4242 }
4243
4244 // Concatenate all matching names
4245 // TODO(philix): use xstpcpy instead of strcat in a loop (ExpandOne)
4246 if (mode == WILD_ALL6 && xp->xp_numfiles > 0) {
4247 size_t len = 0;
4248 for (i = 0; i < xp->xp_numfiles; ++i) {
4249 len += STRLEN(xp->xp_files[i])strlen((char *)(xp->xp_files[i])) + 1;
4250 }
4251 ss = xmalloc(len);
4252 *ss = NUL'\000';
4253 for (i = 0; i < xp->xp_numfiles; ++i) {
4254 STRCAT(ss, xp->xp_files[i])strcat((char *)(ss), (char *)(xp->xp_files[i]));
4255 if (i != xp->xp_numfiles - 1) {
4256 STRCAT(ss, (options & WILD_USE_NL) ? "\n" : " ")strcat((char *)(ss), (char *)((options & 0x04) ? "\n" : " "
));
4257 }
4258 }
4259 }
4260
4261 if (mode == WILD_EXPAND_FREE2 || mode == WILD_ALL6) {
4262 ExpandCleanup(xp);
4263 }
4264
4265 // Free "orig" if it wasn't stored in "orig_save".
4266 if (!orig_saved) {
4267 xfree(orig);
4268 }
4269
4270 return ss;
4271}
4272
4273/*
4274 * Prepare an expand structure for use.
4275 */
4276void ExpandInit(expand_T *xp)
4277 FUNC_ATTR_NONNULL_ALL
4278{
4279 CLEAR_POINTER(xp)memset((xp), 0, sizeof(*(xp)));
4280 xp->xp_backslash = XP_BS_NONE0;
4281 xp->xp_numfiles = -1;
4282}
4283
4284/*
4285 * Cleanup an expand structure after use.
4286 */
4287void ExpandCleanup(expand_T *xp)
4288{
4289 if (xp->xp_numfiles >= 0) {
4290 FreeWild(xp->xp_numfiles, (char_u **)xp->xp_files);
4291 xp->xp_numfiles = -1;
4292 }
4293}
4294
4295void ExpandEscape(expand_T *xp, char_u *str, int numfiles, char_u **files, int options)
4296{
4297 int i;
4298 char_u *p;
4299
4300 /*
4301 * May change home directory back to "~"
4302 */
4303 if (options & WILD_HOME_REPLACE0x02) {
4304 tilde_replace(str, numfiles, files);
4305 }
4306
4307 if (options & WILD_ESCAPE0x80) {
4308 if (xp->xp_context == EXPAND_FILES
4309 || xp->xp_context == EXPAND_FILES_IN_PATH
4310 || xp->xp_context == EXPAND_SHELLCMD
4311 || xp->xp_context == EXPAND_BUFFERS
4312 || xp->xp_context == EXPAND_DIRECTORIES) {
4313 /*
4314 * Insert a backslash into a file name before a space, \, %, #
4315 * and wildmatch characters, except '~'.
4316 */
4317 for (i = 0; i < numfiles; ++i) {
4318 // for ":set path=" we need to escape spaces twice
4319 if (xp->xp_backslash == XP_BS_THREE2) {
4320 p = vim_strsave_escaped(files[i], (char_u *)" ");
4321 xfree(files[i]);
4322 files[i] = p;
4323#if defined(BACKSLASH_IN_FILENAME)
4324 p = vim_strsave_escaped(files[i], (char_u *)" ");
4325 xfree(files[i]);
4326 files[i] = p;
4327#endif
4328 }
4329#ifdef BACKSLASH_IN_FILENAME
4330 p = (char_u *)vim_strsave_fnameescape((const char *)files[i], false0);
4331#else
4332 p = (char_u *)vim_strsave_fnameescape((const char *)files[i],
4333 xp->xp_shell);
4334#endif
4335 xfree(files[i]);
4336 files[i] = p;
4337
4338 /* If 'str' starts with "\~", replace "~" at start of
4339 * files[i] with "\~". */
4340 if (str[0] == '\\' && str[1] == '~' && files[i][0] == '~') {
4341 escape_fname(&files[i]);
4342 }
4343 }
4344 xp->xp_backslash = XP_BS_NONE0;
4345
4346 /* If the first file starts with a '+' escape it. Otherwise it
4347 * could be seen as "+cmd". */
4348 if (*files[0] == '+') {
4349 escape_fname(&files[0]);
4350 }
4351 } else if (xp->xp_context == EXPAND_TAGS) {
4352 /*
4353 * Insert a backslash before characters in a tag name that
4354 * would terminate the ":tag" command.
4355 */
4356 for (i = 0; i < numfiles; ++i) {
4357 p = vim_strsave_escaped(files[i], (char_u *)"\\|\"");
4358 xfree(files[i]);
4359 files[i] = p;
4360 }
4361 }
4362 }
4363}
4364
4365/// Escape special characters in a file name for use as a command argument
4366///
4367/// @param[in] fname File name to escape.
4368/// @param[in] shell What to escape for: if false, escapes for VimL command,
4369/// if true then it escapes for a shell command.
4370///
4371/// @return [allocated] escaped file name.
4372char *vim_strsave_fnameescape(const char *const fname, const bool_Bool shell FUNC_ATTR_UNUSED)
4373 FUNC_ATTR_NONNULL_RET FUNC_ATTR_MALLOC FUNC_ATTR_NONNULL_ALL
4374{
4375#ifdef BACKSLASH_IN_FILENAME
4376# define PATH_ESC_CHARS((char_u *)" \t\n*?[{`$\\%#'\"|!<") " \t\n*?[{`%#'\"|!<"
4377 char_u buf[sizeof(PATH_ESC_CHARS((char_u *)" \t\n*?[{`$\\%#'\"|!<"))];
4378 int j = 0;
4379
4380 // Don't escape '[', '{' and '!' if they are in 'isfname'.
4381 for (const char *s = PATH_ESC_CHARS((char_u *)" \t\n*?[{`$\\%#'\"|!<"); *s != NUL'\000'; s++) {
4382 if ((*s != '[' && *s != '{' && *s != '!') || !vim_isfilec(*s)) {
4383 buf[j++] = *s;
4384 }
4385 }
4386 buf[j] = NUL'\000';
4387 char *p = (char *)vim_strsave_escaped((const char_u *)fname,
4388 (const char_u *)buf);
4389#else
4390# define PATH_ESC_CHARS((char_u *)" \t\n*?[{`$\\%#'\"|!<") ((char_u *)" \t\n*?[{`$\\%#'\"|!<")
4391# define SHELL_ESC_CHARS((char_u *)" \t\n*?[{`$\\%#'\"|!<>();&") ((char_u *)" \t\n*?[{`$\\%#'\"|!<>();&")
4392 char *p =
4393 (char *)vim_strsave_escaped((const char_u *)fname, (shell ? SHELL_ESC_CHARS((char_u *)" \t\n*?[{`$\\%#'\"|!<>();&") : PATH_ESC_CHARS((char_u *)" \t\n*?[{`$\\%#'\"|!<")));
4394 if (shell && csh_like_shell()) {
4395 // For csh and similar shells need to put two backslashes before '!'.
4396 // One is taken by Vim, one by the shell.
4397 char *s = (char *)vim_strsave_escaped((const char_u *)p,
4398 (const char_u *)"!");
4399 xfree(p);
4400 p = s;
4401 }
4402#endif
4403
4404 // '>' and '+' are special at the start of some commands, e.g. ":edit" and
4405 // ":write". "cd -" has a special meaning.
4406 if (*p == '>' || *p == '+' || (*p == '-' && p[1] == NUL'\000')) {
4407 escape_fname((char_u **)&p);
4408 }
4409
4410 return p;
4411}
4412
4413/*
4414 * Put a backslash before the file name in "pp", which is in allocated memory.
4415 */
4416static void escape_fname(char_u **pp)
4417{
4418 char_u *p = xmalloc(STRLEN(*pp)strlen((char *)(*pp)) + 2);
4419 p[0] = '\\';
4420 STRCPY(p + 1, *pp)strcpy((char *)(p + 1), (char *)(*pp));
4421 xfree(*pp);
4422 *pp = p;
4423}
4424
4425/*
4426 * For each file name in files[num_files]:
4427 * If 'orig_pat' starts with "~/", replace the home directory with "~".
4428 */
4429void tilde_replace(char_u *orig_pat, int num_files, char_u **files)
4430{
4431 int i;
4432 char_u *p;
4433
