4434 if (orig_pat[0] == '~' && vim_ispathsep(orig_pat[1])) {
4435 for (i = 0; i < num_files; ++i) {
4436 p = home_replace_save(NULL((void*)0), files[i]);
4437 xfree(files[i]);
4438 files[i] = p;
4439 }
4440 }
4441}
4442
4443void cmdline_pum_display(bool_Bool changed_array)
4444{
4445 pum_display(compl_match_array, compl_match_arraysize, compl_selected,
4446 changed_array, compl_startcol);
4447}
4448
4449/*
4450 * Show all matches for completion on the command line.
4451 * Returns EXPAND_NOTHING when the character that triggered expansion should
4452 * be inserted like a normal character.
4453 */
4454static int showmatches(expand_T *xp, int wildmenu)
4455{
4456#define L_SHOWFILE(m)(showtail ? sm_gettail(files_found[m], 0) : files_found[m]) (showtail \
4457 ? sm_gettail(files_found[m], false0) : files_found[m])
4458 int num_files;
4459 char_u **files_found;
4460 int i, j, k;
4461 int maxlen;
4462 int lines;
4463 int columns;
4464 char_u *p;
4465 int lastlen;
4466 int attr;
4467 int showtail;
4468
4469 if (xp->xp_numfiles == -1) {
4470 set_expand_context(xp);
4471 i = expand_cmdline(xp, ccline.cmdbuff, ccline.cmdpos,
4472 &num_files, &files_found);
4473 showtail = expand_showtail(xp);
4474 if (i != EXPAND_OK) {
4475 return i;
4476 }
4477 } else {
4478 num_files = xp->xp_numfiles;
4479 files_found = (char_u **)xp->xp_files;
4480 showtail = cmd_showtail;
4481 }
4482
4483 bool_Bool compl_use_pum = (ui_has(kUICmdline)
4484 ? ui_has(kUIPopupmenu)
4485 : wildmenu && (wop_flags & WOP_PUM0x02))
4486 || ui_has(kUIWildmenu);
4487
4488 if (compl_use_pum) {
4489 assert(num_files >= 0)((void) sizeof ((num_files >= 0) ? 1 : 0), __extension__ (
{ if (num_files >= 0) ; else __assert_fail ("num_files >= 0"
, "/home/runner/work/doc/doc/neovim/src/nvim/ex_getln.c", 4489
, __extension__ __PRETTY_FUNCTION__); }));
4490 compl_match_arraysize = num_files;
4491 compl_match_array = xcalloc((size_t)compl_match_arraysize,
4492 sizeof(pumitem_T));
4493 for (i = 0; i < num_files; i++) {
4494 compl_match_array[i].pum_text = L_SHOWFILE(i)(showtail ? sm_gettail(files_found[i], 0) : files_found[i]);
4495 }
4496 char_u *endpos = (showtail
4497 ? sm_gettail((char_u *)xp->xp_pattern, true1) : (char_u *)xp->xp_pattern);
4498 if (ui_has(kUICmdline)) {
4499 compl_startcol = (int)(endpos - ccline.cmdbuff);
4500 } else {
4501 compl_startcol = cmd_screencol((int)(endpos - ccline.cmdbuff));
4502 }
4503 compl_selected = -1;
4504 cmdline_pum_display(true1);
4505 return EXPAND_OK;
4506 }
4507
4508 if (!wildmenu) {
4509 msg_didany = false0; // lines_left will be set
4510 msg_start(); // prepare for paging
4511 msg_putchar('\n');
4512 ui_flush();
4513 cmdline_row = msg_row;
4514 msg_didany = false0; // lines_left will be set again
4515 msg_start(); // prepare for paging
4516 }
4517
4518 if (got_int) {
4519 got_int = false0; // only int. the completion, not the cmd line
4520 } else if (wildmenu) {
4521 win_redr_status_matches(xp, num_files, files_found, -1, showtail);
4522 } else {
4523 // find the length of the longest file name
4524 maxlen = 0;
4525 for (i = 0; i < num_files; ++i) {
4526 if (!showtail && (xp->xp_context == EXPAND_FILES
4527 || xp->xp_context == EXPAND_SHELLCMD
4528 || xp->xp_context == EXPAND_BUFFERS)) {
4529 home_replace(NULL((void*)0), files_found[i], NameBuff, MAXPATHL4096, TRUE1);
4530 j = vim_strsize(NameBuff);
4531 } else {
4532 j = vim_strsize(L_SHOWFILE(i)(showtail ? sm_gettail(files_found[i], 0) : files_found[i]));
4533 }
4534 if (j > maxlen) {
4535 maxlen = j;
4536 }
4537 }
4538
4539 if (xp->xp_context == EXPAND_TAGS_LISTFILES) {
4540 lines = num_files;
4541 } else {
4542 // compute the number of columns and lines for the listing
4543 maxlen += 2; // two spaces between file names
4544 columns = (Columns + 2) / maxlen;
4545 if (columns < 1) {
4546 columns = 1;
4547 }
4548 lines = (num_files + columns - 1) / columns;
4549 }
4550
4551 attr = HL_ATTR(HLF_D)highlight_attr[(int)(HLF_D)]; // find out highlighting for directories
4552
4553 if (xp->xp_context == EXPAND_TAGS_LISTFILES) {
4554 msg_puts_attr(_("tagname")gettext((char *)("tagname")), HL_ATTR(HLF_T)highlight_attr[(int)(HLF_T)]);
4555 msg_clr_eos();
4556 msg_advance(maxlen - 3);
4557 msg_puts_attr(_(" kind file\n")gettext((char *)(" kind file\n")), HL_ATTR(HLF_T)highlight_attr[(int)(HLF_T)]);
4558 }
4559
4560 // list the files line by line
4561 for (i = 0; i < lines; ++i) {
4562 lastlen = 999;
4563 for (k = i; k < num_files; k += lines) {
4564 if (xp->xp_context == EXPAND_TAGS_LISTFILES) {
4565 msg_outtrans_attr(files_found[k], HL_ATTR(HLF_D)highlight_attr[(int)(HLF_D)]);
4566 p = files_found[k] + STRLEN(files_found[k])strlen((char *)(files_found[k])) + 1;
4567 msg_advance(maxlen + 1);
4568 msg_puts((const char *)p);
4569 msg_advance(maxlen + 3);
4570 msg_outtrans_long_attr(p + 2, HL_ATTR(HLF_D)highlight_attr[(int)(HLF_D)]);
4571 break;
4572 }
4573 for (j = maxlen - lastlen; --j >= 0;) {
4574 msg_putchar(' ');
4575 }
4576 if (xp->xp_context == EXPAND_FILES
4577 || xp->xp_context == EXPAND_SHELLCMD
4578 || xp->xp_context == EXPAND_BUFFERS) {
4579 // highlight directories
4580 if (xp->xp_numfiles != -1) {
4581 // Expansion was done before and special characters
4582 // were escaped, need to halve backslashes. Also
4583 // $HOME has been replaced with ~/.
4584 char_u *exp_path = expand_env_save_opt(files_found[k], true1);
4585 char_u *path = exp_path != NULL((void*)0) ? exp_path : files_found[k];
4586 char_u *halved_slash = backslash_halve_save(path);
4587 j = os_isdir(halved_slash);
4588 xfree(exp_path);
4589 if (halved_slash != path) {
4590 xfree(halved_slash);
4591 }
4592 } else {
4593 // Expansion was done here, file names are literal.
4594 j = os_isdir(files_found[k]);
4595 }
4596 if (showtail) {
4597 p = L_SHOWFILE(k)(showtail ? sm_gettail(files_found[k], 0) : files_found[k]);
4598 } else {
4599 home_replace(NULL((void*)0), files_found[k], NameBuff, MAXPATHL4096,
4600 TRUE1);
4601 p = NameBuff;
4602 }
4603 } else {
4604 j = FALSE0;
4605 p = L_SHOWFILE(k)(showtail ? sm_gettail(files_found[k], 0) : files_found[k]);
4606 }
4607 lastlen = msg_outtrans_attr(p, j ? attr : 0);
4608 }
4609 if (msg_col > 0) { // when not wrapped around
4610 msg_clr_eos();
4611 msg_putchar('\n');
4612 }
4613 ui_flush(); // show one line at a time
4614 if (got_int) {
4615 got_int = FALSE0;
4616 break;
4617 }
4618 }
4619
4620 /*
4621 * we redraw the command below the lines that we have just listed
4622 * This is a bit tricky, but it saves a lot of screen updating.
4623 */
4624 cmdline_row = msg_row; // will put it back later
4625 }
4626
4627 if (xp->xp_numfiles == -1) {
4628 FreeWild(num_files, files_found);
4629 }
4630
4631 return EXPAND_OK;
4632}
4633
4634/*
4635 * Private path_tail for showmatches() (and win_redr_status_matches()):
4636 * Find tail of file name path, but ignore trailing "/".
4637 */
4638char_u *sm_gettail(char_u *s, bool_Bool eager)
4639{
4640 char_u *p;
4641 char_u *t = s;
4642 int had_sep = FALSE0;
4643
4644 for (p = s; *p != NUL'\000';) {
4645 if (vim_ispathsep(*p)
4646#ifdef BACKSLASH_IN_FILENAME
4647 && !rem_backslash(p)
4648#endif
4649 ) {
4650 if (eager) {
4651 t = p + 1;
4652 } else {
4653 had_sep = true1;
4654 }
4655 } else if (had_sep) {
4656 t = p;
4657 had_sep = FALSE0;
4658 }
4659 MB_PTR_ADV(p)(p += utfc_ptr2len((char *)p));
4660 }
4661 return t;
4662}
4663
4664/*
4665 * Return TRUE if we only need to show the tail of completion matches.
4666 * When not completing file names or there is a wildcard in the path FALSE is
4667 * returned.
4668 */
4669static int expand_showtail(expand_T *xp)
4670{
4671 char_u *s;
4672 char_u *end;
4673
4674 // When not completing file names a "/" may mean something different.
4675 if (xp->xp_context != EXPAND_FILES
4676 && xp->xp_context != EXPAND_SHELLCMD
4677 && xp->xp_context != EXPAND_DIRECTORIES) {
4678 return FALSE0;
4679 }
4680
4681 end = (char_u *)path_tail(xp->xp_pattern);
4682 if (end == (char_u *)xp->xp_pattern) { // there is no path separator
4683 return false0;
4684 }
4685
4686 for (s = (char_u *)xp->xp_pattern; s < end; s++) {
4687 // Skip escaped wildcards. Only when the backslash is not a path
4688 // separator, on DOS the '*' "path\*\file" must not be skipped.
4689 if (rem_backslash(s)) {
4690 s++;
4691 } else if (vim_strchr("*?[", *s) != NULL((void*)0)) {
4692 return false0;
4693 }
4694 }
4695 return TRUE1;
4696}
4697
4698/// Prepare a string for expansion.
4699///
4700/// When expanding file names: The string will be used with expand_wildcards().
4701/// Copy "fname[len]" into allocated memory and add a '*' at the end.
4702/// When expanding other names: The string will be used with regcomp(). Copy
4703/// the name into allocated memory and prepend "^".
4704///
4705/// @param context EXPAND_FILES etc.
4706char_u *addstar(char_u *fname, size_t len, int context)
4707 FUNC_ATTR_NONNULL_RET
4708{
4709 char_u *retval;
4710 size_t i, j;
4711 size_t new_len;
4712 char_u *tail;
4713 int ends_in_star;
4714
4715 if (context != EXPAND_FILES
4716 && context != EXPAND_FILES_IN_PATH
4717 && context != EXPAND_SHELLCMD
4718 && context != EXPAND_DIRECTORIES) {
4719 /*
4720 * Matching will be done internally (on something other than files).
4721 * So we convert the file-matching-type wildcards into our kind for
4722 * use with vim_regcomp(). First work out how long it will be:
4723 */
4724
4725 // For help tags the translation is done in find_help_tags().
4726 // For a tag pattern starting with "/" no translation is needed.
4727 if (context == EXPAND_HELP
4728 || context == EXPAND_CHECKHEALTH
4729 || context == EXPAND_COLORS
4730 || context == EXPAND_COMPILER
4731 || context == EXPAND_OWNSYNTAX
4732 || context == EXPAND_FILETYPE
4733 || context == EXPAND_PACKADD
4734 || ((context == EXPAND_TAGS_LISTFILES || context == EXPAND_TAGS)
4735 && fname[0] == '/')) {
4736 retval = vim_strnsave(fname, len);
4737 } else {
4738 new_len = len + 2; // +2 for '^' at start, NUL at end
4739 for (i = 0; i < len; i++) {
4740 if (fname[i] == '*' || fname[i] == '~') {
4741 new_len++; /* '*' needs to be replaced by ".*"
4742 '~' needs to be replaced by "\~" */
4743 }
4744 // Buffer names are like file names. "." should be literal
4745 if (context == EXPAND_BUFFERS && fname[i] == '.') {
4746 new_len++; // "." becomes "\."
4747 }
4748 /* Custom expansion takes care of special things, match
4749 * backslashes literally (perhaps also for other types?) */
4750 if ((context == EXPAND_USER_DEFINED
4751 || context == EXPAND_USER_LIST) && fname[i] == '\\') {
4752 new_len++; // '\' becomes "\\"
4753 }
4754 }
4755 retval = xmalloc(new_len);
4756 {
4757 retval[0] = '^';
4758 j = 1;
4759 for (i = 0; i < len; i++, j++) {
4760 /* Skip backslash. But why? At least keep it for custom
4761 * expansion. */
4762 if (context != EXPAND_USER_DEFINED
4763 && context != EXPAND_USER_LIST
4764 && fname[i] == '\\'
4765 && ++i == len) {
4766 break;
4767 }
4768
4769 switch (fname[i]) {
4770 case '*':
4771 retval[j++] = '.';
4772 break;
4773 case '~':
4774 retval[j++] = '\\';
4775 break;
4776 case '?':
4777 retval[j] = '.';
4778 continue;
4779 case '.':
4780 if (context == EXPAND_BUFFERS) {
4781 retval[j++] = '\\';
4782 }
4783 break;
4784 case '\\':
4785 if (context == EXPAND_USER_DEFINED
4786 || context == EXPAND_USER_LIST) {
4787 retval[j++] = '\\';
4788 }
4789 break;
4790 }
4791 retval[j] = fname[i];
4792 }
4793 retval[j] = NUL'\000';
4794 }
4795 }
4796 } else {
4797 retval = xmalloc(len + 4);
4798 STRLCPY(retval, fname, len + 1)xstrlcpy((char *)(retval), (char *)(fname), (size_t)(len + 1)
);
4799
4800 /*
4801 * Don't add a star to *, ~, ~user, $var or `cmd`.
4802 * * would become **, which walks the whole tree.
4803 * ~ would be at the start of the file name, but not the tail.
4804 * $ could be anywhere in the tail.
4805 * ` could be anywhere in the file name.
4806 * When the name ends in '$' don't add a star, remove the '$'.
4807 */
4808 tail = (char_u *)path_tail((char *)retval);
4809 ends_in_star = (len > 0 && retval[len - 1] == '*');
4810#ifndef BACKSLASH_IN_FILENAME
4811 for (ssize_t k = (ssize_t)len - 2; k >= 0; k--) {
4812 if (retval[k] != '\\') {
4813 break;
4814 }
4815 ends_in_star = !ends_in_star;
4816 }
4817#endif
4818 if ((*retval != '~' || tail != retval)
4819 && !ends_in_star
4820 && vim_strchr((char *)tail, '$') == NULL((void*)0)
4821 && vim_strchr((char *)retval, '`') == NULL((void*)0)) {
4822 retval[len++] = '*';
4823 } else if (len > 0 && retval[len - 1] == '$') {
4824 --len;
4825 }
4826 retval[len] = NUL'\000';
4827 }
4828 return retval;
4829}
4830
4831/*
4832 * Must parse the command line so far to work out what context we are in.
4833 * Completion can then be done based on that context.
4834 * This routine sets the variables:
4835 * xp->xp_pattern The start of the pattern to be expanded within
4836 * the command line (ends at the cursor).
4837 * xp->xp_context The type of thing to expand. Will be one of:
4838 *
4839 * EXPAND_UNSUCCESSFUL Used sometimes when there is something illegal on
4840 * the command line, like an unknown command. Caller
4841 * should beep.
4842 * EXPAND_NOTHING Unrecognised context for completion, use char like
4843 * a normal char, rather than for completion. eg
4844 * :s/^I/
4845 * EXPAND_COMMANDS Cursor is still touching the command, so complete
4846 * it.
4847 * EXPAND_BUFFERS Complete file names for :buf and :sbuf commands.
4848 * EXPAND_FILES After command with EX_XFILE set, or after setting
4849 * with P_EXPAND set. eg :e ^I, :w>>^I
4850 * EXPAND_DIRECTORIES In some cases this is used instead of the latter
4851 * when we know only directories are of interest. eg
4852 * :set dir=^I
4853 * EXPAND_SHELLCMD After ":!cmd", ":r !cmd" or ":w !cmd".
4854 * EXPAND_SETTINGS Complete variable names. eg :set d^I
4855 * EXPAND_BOOL_SETTINGS Complete boolean variables only, eg :set no^I
4856 * EXPAND_TAGS Complete tags from the files in p_tags. eg :ta a^I
4857 * EXPAND_TAGS_LISTFILES As above, but list filenames on ^D, after :tselect
4858 * EXPAND_HELP Complete tags from the file 'helpfile'/tags
4859 * EXPAND_EVENTS Complete event names
4860 * EXPAND_SYNTAX Complete :syntax command arguments
4861 * EXPAND_HIGHLIGHT Complete highlight (syntax) group names
4862 * EXPAND_AUGROUP Complete autocommand group names
4863 * EXPAND_USER_VARS Complete user defined variable names, eg :unlet a^I
4864 * EXPAND_MAPPINGS Complete mapping and abbreviation names,
4865 * eg :unmap a^I , :cunab x^I
4866 * EXPAND_FUNCTIONS Complete internal or user defined function names,
4867 * eg :call sub^I
4868 * EXPAND_USER_FUNC Complete user defined function names, eg :delf F^I
4869 * EXPAND_EXPRESSION Complete internal or user defined function/variable
4870 * names in expressions, eg :while s^I
4871 * EXPAND_ENV_VARS Complete environment variable names
4872 * EXPAND_USER Complete user names
4873 */
4874void set_expand_context(expand_T *xp)
4875{
4876 // only expansion for ':', '>' and '=' command-lines
4877 if (ccline.cmdfirstc != ':'
4878 && ccline.cmdfirstc != '>' && ccline.cmdfirstc != '='
4879 && !ccline.input_fn) {
4880 xp->xp_context = EXPAND_NOTHING;
4881 return;
4882 }
4883 set_cmd_context(xp, ccline.cmdbuff, ccline.cmdlen, ccline.cmdpos, true1);
4884}
4885
4886/// @param str start of command line
4887/// @param len length of command line (excl. NUL)
4888/// @param col position of cursor
4889/// @param use_ccline use ccline for info
4890void set_cmd_context(expand_T *xp, char_u *str, int len, int col, int use_ccline)
4891{
4892 char_u old_char = NUL'\000';
4893
4894 /*
4895 * Avoid a UMR warning from Purify, only save the character if it has been
4896 * written before.
4897 */
4898 if (col < len) {
4899 old_char = str[col];
4900 }
4901 str[col] = NUL'\000';
4902 const char *nextcomm = (const char *)str;
4903
4904 if (use_ccline && ccline.cmdfirstc == '=') {
4905 // pass CMD_SIZE because there is no real command
4906 set_context_for_expression(xp, (char *)str, CMD_SIZE);
4907 } else if (use_ccline && ccline.input_fn) {
4908 xp->xp_context = ccline.xp_context;
4909 xp->xp_pattern = (char *)ccline.cmdbuff;
4910 xp->xp_arg = (char *)ccline.xp_arg;
4911 } else {
4912 while (nextcomm != NULL((void*)0)) {
4913 nextcomm = set_one_cmd_context(xp, nextcomm);
4914 }
4915 }
4916
4917 /* Store the string here so that call_user_expand_func() can get to them
4918 * easily. */
4919 xp->xp_line = (char *)str;
4920 xp->xp_col = col;
4921
4922 str[col] = old_char;
4923}
4924
4925/// Expand the command line "str" from context "xp".
4926/// "xp" must have been set by set_cmd_context().
4927/// xp->xp_pattern points into "str", to where the text that is to be expanded
4928/// starts.
4929/// Returns EXPAND_UNSUCCESSFUL when there is something illegal before the
4930/// cursor.
4931/// Returns EXPAND_NOTHING when there is nothing to expand, might insert the
4932/// key that triggered expansion literally.
4933/// Returns EXPAND_OK otherwise.
4934///
4935/// @param str start of command line
4936/// @param col position of cursor
4937/// @param matchcount return: nr of matches
4938/// @param matches return: array of pointers to matches
4939int expand_cmdline(expand_T *xp, char_u *str, int col, int *matchcount, char_u ***matches)
4940{
4941 char_u *file_str = NULL((void*)0);
4942 int options = WILD_ADD_SLASH0x10|WILD_SILENT0x40;
4943
4944 if (xp->xp_context == EXPAND_UNSUCCESSFUL) {
4945 beep_flush();
4946 return EXPAND_UNSUCCESSFUL; // Something illegal on command line
4947 }
4948 if (xp->xp_context == EXPAND_NOTHING) {
4949 // Caller can use the character as a normal char instead
4950 return EXPAND_NOTHING;
4951 }
4952
4953 // add star to file name, or convert to regexp if not exp. files.
4954 assert((str + col) - (char_u *)xp->xp_pattern >= 0)((void) sizeof (((str + col) - (char_u *)xp->xp_pattern >=
0) ? 1 : 0), __extension__ ({ if ((str + col) - (char_u *)xp
->xp_pattern >= 0) ; else __assert_fail ("(str + col) - (char_u *)xp->xp_pattern >= 0"
, "/home/runner/work/doc/doc/neovim/src/nvim/ex_getln.c", 4954
, __extension__ __PRETTY_FUNCTION__); }));
4955 xp->xp_pattern_len = (size_t)((str + col) - (char_u *)xp->xp_pattern);
4956 file_str = addstar((char_u *)xp->xp_pattern, xp->xp_pattern_len, xp->xp_context);
4957
4958 if (p_wic) {
4959 options += WILD_ICASE0x100;
4960 }
4961
4962 // find all files that match the description
4963 if (ExpandFromContext(xp, file_str, matchcount, matches, options) == FAIL0) {
4964 *matchcount = 0;
4965 *matches = NULL((void*)0);
4966 }
4967 xfree(file_str);
4968
4969 return EXPAND_OK;
4970}
4971
4972// Cleanup matches for help tags:
4973// Remove "@ab" if the top of 'helplang' is "ab" and the language of the first
4974// tag matches it. Otherwise remove "@en" if "en" is the only language.
4975static void cleanup_help_tags(int num_file, char_u **file)
4976{
4977 char_u buf[4];
4978 char_u *p = buf;
4979
4980 if (p_hlg[0] != NUL'\000' && (p_hlg[0] != 'e' || p_hlg[1] != 'n')) {
4981 *p++ = '@';
4982 *p++ = p_hlg[0];
4983 *p++ = p_hlg[1];
4984 }
4985 *p = NUL'\000';
4986
4987 for (int i = 0; i < num_file; i++) {
4988 int len = (int)STRLEN(file[i])strlen((char *)(file[i])) - 3;
4989 if (len <= 0) {
4990 continue;
4991 }
4992 if (STRCMP(file[i] + len, "@en")strcmp((char *)(file[i] + len), (char *)("@en")) == 0) {
4993 // Sorting on priority means the same item in another language may
4994 // be anywhere. Search all items for a match up to the "@en".
4995 int j;
4996 for (j = 0; j < num_file; j++) {
4997 if (j != i
4998 && (int)STRLEN(file[j])strlen((char *)(file[j])) == len + 3
4999 && STRNCMP(file[i], file[j], len + 1)strncmp((char *)(file[i]), (char *)(file[j]), (size_t)(len + 1
)) == 0) {
5000 break;
5001 }
5002 }
5003 if (j == num_file) {
5004 // item only exists with @en, remove it
5005 file[i][len] = NUL'\000';
5006 }
5007 }
5008 }
5009
5010 if (*buf != NUL'\000') {
5011 for (int i = 0; i < num_file; i++) {
5012 int len = (int)STRLEN(file[i])strlen((char *)(file[i])) - 3;
5013 if (len <= 0) {
5014 continue;
5015 }
5016 if (STRCMP(file[i] + len, buf)strcmp((char *)(file[i] + len), (char *)(buf)) == 0) {
5017 // remove the default language
5018 file[i][len] = NUL'\000';
5019 }
5020 }
5021 }
5022}
5023
5024typedef char *(*ExpandFunc)(expand_T *, int);
5025
5026/// Do the expansion based on xp->xp_context and "pat".
5027///
5028/// @param options WILD_ flags
5029static int ExpandFromContext(expand_T *xp, char_u *pat, int *num_file, char_u ***file, int options)
5030{
5031 regmatch_T regmatch;
5032 int ret;
5033 int flags;
5034
5035 flags = EW_DIR0x01; // include directories
5036 if (options & WILD_LIST_NOTFOUND0x01) {
5037 flags |= EW_NOTFOUND0x04;
5038 }
5039 if (options & WILD_ADD_SLASH0x10) {
5040 flags |= EW_ADDSLASH0x08;
5041 }
5042 if (options & WILD_KEEP_ALL0x20) {
5043 flags |= EW_KEEPALL0x10;
5044 }
5045 if (options & WILD_SILENT0x40) {
5046 flags |= EW_SILENT0x20;
5047 }
5048 if (options & WILD_NOERROR0x800) {
5049 flags |= EW_NOERROR0x200;
5050 }
5051 if (options & WILD_ALLLINKS0x200) {
5052 flags |= EW_ALLLINKS0x1000;
5053 }
5054
5055 if (xp->xp_context == EXPAND_FILES
5056 || xp->xp_context == EXPAND_DIRECTORIES
5057 || xp->xp_context == EXPAND_FILES_IN_PATH) {
5058 /*
5059 * Expand file or directory names.
5060 */
5061 int free_pat = FALSE0;
5062 int i;
5063
5064 // for ":set path=" and ":set tags=" halve backslashes for escaped space
5065 if (xp->xp_backslash != XP_BS_NONE0) {
5066 free_pat = TRUE1;
5067 pat = vim_strsave(pat);
5068 for (i = 0; pat[i]; ++i) {
5069 if (pat[i] == '\\') {
5070 if (xp->xp_backslash == XP_BS_THREE2
5071 && pat[i + 1] == '\\'
5072 && pat[i + 2] == '\\'
5073 && pat[i + 3] == ' ') {
5074 STRMOVE(pat + i, pat + i + 3)memmove((pat + i), (pat + i + 3), strlen((char *)(pat + i + 3
)) + 1);
5075 }
5076 if (xp->xp_backslash == XP_BS_ONE1
5077 && pat[i + 1] == ' ') {
5078 STRMOVE(pat + i, pat + i + 1)memmove((pat + i), (pat + i + 1), strlen((char *)(pat + i + 1
)) + 1);
5079 }
5080 }
5081 }
5082 }
5083
5084 if (xp->xp_context == EXPAND_FILES) {
5085 flags |= EW_FILE0x02;
5086 } else if (xp->xp_context == EXPAND_FILES_IN_PATH) {
5087 flags |= (EW_FILE0x02 | EW_PATH0x80);
5088 } else {
5089 flags = (flags | EW_DIR0x01) & ~EW_FILE0x02;
5090 }
5091 if (options & WILD_ICASE0x100) {
5092 flags |= EW_ICASE0x100;
5093 }
5094
5095 // Expand wildcards, supporting %:h and the like.
5096 ret = expand_wildcards_eval(&pat, num_file, file, flags);
5097 if (free_pat) {
5098 xfree(pat);
5099 }
5100#ifdef BACKSLASH_IN_FILENAME
5101 if (p_csl[0] != NUL'\000' && (options & WILD_IGNORE_COMPLETESLASH0x400) == 0) {
5102 for (int i = 0; i < *num_file; i++) {
5103 char_u *ptr = (*file)[i];
5104 while (*ptr != NUL'\000') {
5105 if (p_csl[0] == 's' && *ptr == '\\') {
5106 *ptr = '/';
5107 } else if (p_csl[0] == 'b' && *ptr == '/') {
5108 *ptr = '\\';
5109 }
5110 ptr += utfc_ptr2len(ptr);
5111 }
5112 }
5113 }
5114#endif
5115 return ret;
5116 }
5117
5118 *file = NULL((void*)0);
5119 *num_file = 0;
5120 if (xp->xp_context == EXPAND_HELP) {
5121 /* With an empty argument we would get all the help tags, which is
5122 * very slow. Get matches for "help" instead. */
5123 if (find_help_tags(*pat == NUL'\000' ? "help" : (char *)pat,
5124 num_file, (char ***)file, false0) == OK1) {
5125 cleanup_help_tags(*num_file, *file);
5126 return OK1;
5127 }
5128 return FAIL0;
5129 }
5130
5131 if (xp->xp_context == EXPAND_SHELLCMD) {
5132 *file = NULL((void*)0);
5133 expand_shellcmd(pat, num_file, file, flags);
5134 return OK1;
5135 }
5136 if (xp->xp_context == EXPAND_OLD_SETTING) {
5137 ExpandOldSetting(num_file, file);
5138 return OK1;
5139 }
5140 if (xp->xp_context == EXPAND_BUFFERS) {
5141 return ExpandBufnames(pat, num_file, file, options);
5142 }
5143 if (xp->xp_context == EXPAND_DIFF_BUFFERS) {
5144 return ExpandBufnames(pat, num_file, file, options | BUF_DIFF_FILTER0x2000);
5145 }
5146 if (xp->xp_context == EXPAND_TAGS
5147 || xp->xp_context == EXPAND_TAGS_LISTFILES) {
5148 return expand_tags(xp->xp_context == EXPAND_TAGS, pat, num_file, file);
5149 }
5150 if (xp->xp_context == EXPAND_COLORS) {
5151 char *directories[] = { "colors", NULL((void*)0) };
5152 return ExpandRTDir(pat, DIP_START0x08 + DIP_OPT0x10 + DIP_LUA0x100, num_file, file,
5153 directories);
5154 }
5155 if (xp->xp_context == EXPAND_COMPILER) {
5156 char *directories[] = { "compiler", NULL((void*)0) };
5157 return ExpandRTDir(pat, DIP_LUA0x100, num_file, file, directories);
5158 }
5159 if (xp->xp_context == EXPAND_OWNSYNTAX) {
5160 char *directories[] = { "syntax", NULL((void*)0) };
5161 return ExpandRTDir(pat, 0, num_file, file, directories);
5162 }
5163 if (xp->xp_context == EXPAND_FILETYPE) {
5164 char *directories[] = { "syntax", "indent", "ftplugin", NULL((void*)0) };
5165 return ExpandRTDir(pat, DIP_LUA0x100, num_file, file, directories);
5166 }
5167 if (xp->xp_context == EXPAND_USER_LIST) {
5168 return ExpandUserList(xp, num_file, file);
5169 }
5170 if (xp->xp_context == EXPAND_USER_LUA) {
5171 return ExpandUserLua(xp, num_file, file);
5172 }
5173 if (xp->xp_context == EXPAND_PACKADD) {
5174 return ExpandPackAddDir(pat, num_file, file);
5175 }
5176
5177 // When expanding a function name starting with s:, match the <SNR>nr_
5178 // prefix.
5179 char *tofree = NULL((void*)0);
5180 if (xp->xp_context == EXPAND_USER_FUNC && STRNCMP(pat, "^s:", 3)strncmp((char *)(pat), (char *)("^s:"), (size_t)(3)) == 0) {
5181 const size_t len = STRLEN(pat)strlen((char *)(pat)) + 20;
5182
5183 tofree = xmalloc(len);
5184 snprintf(tofree, len, "^<SNR>\\d\\+_%s", pat + 3);
5185 pat = (char_u *)tofree;
5186 }
5187
5188 if (xp->xp_context == EXPAND_LUA) {
5189 ILOG("PAT %s", pat)logmsg(2, ((void*)0), __func__, 5189, 1, "PAT %s", pat);
5190 return nlua_expand_pat(xp, pat, num_file, file);
5191 }
5192
5193 regmatch.regprog = vim_regcomp((char *)pat, p_magic ? RE_MAGIC1 : 0);
5194 if (regmatch.regprog == NULL((void*)0)) {
5195 return FAIL0;
5196 }
5197
5198 // set ignore-case according to p_ic, p_scs and pat
5199 regmatch.rm_ic = ignorecase(pat);
5200
5201 if (xp->xp_context == EXPAND_SETTINGS
5202 || xp->xp_context == EXPAND_BOOL_SETTINGS) {
5203 ret = ExpandSettings(xp, &regmatch, num_file, file);
5204 } else if (xp->xp_context == EXPAND_MAPPINGS) {
5205 ret = ExpandMappings(&regmatch, num_file, file);
5206 } else if (xp->xp_context == EXPAND_USER_DEFINED) {
5207 ret = ExpandUserDefined(xp, &regmatch, num_file, file);
5208 } else {
5209 static struct expgen {
5210 int context;
5211 ExpandFunc func;
5212 int ic;
5213 int escaped;
5214 } tab[] = {
5215 { EXPAND_COMMANDS, get_command_name, false0, true1 },
5216 { EXPAND_BEHAVE, get_behave_arg, true1, true1 },
5217 { EXPAND_MAPCLEAR, get_mapclear_arg, true1, true1 },
5218 { EXPAND_MESSAGES, get_messages_arg, true1, true1 },
5219 { EXPAND_HISTORY, get_history_arg, true1, true1 },
5220 { EXPAND_USER_COMMANDS, get_user_commands, false0, true1 },
5221 { EXPAND_USER_ADDR_TYPE, get_user_cmd_addr_type, false0, true1 },
5222 { EXPAND_USER_CMD_FLAGS, get_user_cmd_flags, false0, true1 },
5223 { EXPAND_USER_NARGS, get_user_cmd_nargs, false0, true1 },
5224 { EXPAND_USER_COMPLETE, get_user_cmd_complete, false0, true1 },
5225 { EXPAND_USER_VARS, get_user_var_name, false0, true1 },
5226 { EXPAND_FUNCTIONS, get_function_name, false0, true1 },
5227 { EXPAND_USER_FUNC, get_user_func_name, false0, true1 },
5228 { EXPAND_EXPRESSION, get_expr_name, false0, true1 },
5229 { EXPAND_MENUS, get_menu_name, false0, true1 },
5230 { EXPAND_MENUNAMES, get_menu_names, false0, true1 },
5231 { EXPAND_SYNTAX, get_syntax_name, true1, true1 },
5232 { EXPAND_SYNTIME, get_syntime_arg, true1, true1 },
5233 { EXPAND_HIGHLIGHT, (ExpandFunc)get_highlight_name, true1, true1 },
5234 { EXPAND_EVENTS, expand_get_event_name, true1, true1 },
5235 { EXPAND_AUGROUP, expand_get_augroup_name, true1, true1 },
5236 { EXPAND_CSCOPE, get_cscope_name, true1, true1 },
5237 { EXPAND_SIGN, get_sign_name, true1, true1 },
5238 { EXPAND_PROFILE, get_profile_name, true1, true1 },
5239#ifdef HAVE_WORKING_LIBINTL
5240 { EXPAND_LANGUAGE, get_lang_arg, true1, false0 },
5241 { EXPAND_LOCALES, get_locales, true1, false0 },
5242#endif
5243 { EXPAND_ENV_VARS, get_env_name, true1, true1 },
5244 { EXPAND_USER, get_users, true1, false0 },
5245 { EXPAND_ARGLIST, get_arglist_name, true1, false0 },
5246 { EXPAND_CHECKHEALTH, get_healthcheck_names, true1, false0 },
5247 };
5248 int i;
5249
5250 /*
5251 * Find a context in the table and call the ExpandGeneric() with the
5252 * right function to do the expansion.
5253 */
5254 ret = FAIL0;
5255 for (i = 0; i < (int)ARRAY_SIZE(tab)((sizeof(tab)/sizeof((tab)[0])) / ((size_t)(!(sizeof(tab) % sizeof
((tab)[0]))))); ++i) {
5256 if (xp->xp_context == tab[i].context) {
5257 if (tab[i].ic) {
5258 regmatch.rm_ic = TRUE1;
5259 }
5260 ExpandGeneric(xp, &regmatch, num_file, file, tab[i].func,
5261 tab[i].escaped);
5262 ret = OK1;
5263 break;
5264 }
5265 }
5266 }
5267
5268 vim_regfree(regmatch.regprog);
5269 xfree(tofree);
5270
5271 return ret;
5272}
5273
5274/// Expand a list of names.
5275///
5276/// Generic function for command line completion. It calls a function to
5277/// obtain strings, one by one. The strings are matched against a regexp
5278/// program. Matching strings are copied into an array, which is returned.
5279///
5280/// @param func returns a string from the list
5281static void ExpandGeneric(expand_T *xp, regmatch_T *regmatch, int *num_file, char_u ***file,
5282 CompleteListItemGetter func, int escaped)
5283{
5284 int i;
5285 size_t count = 0;
5286 char_u *str;
5287
5288 // count the number of matching names
5289 for (i = 0;; i++) {
5290 str = (char_u *)(*func)(xp, i);
5291 if (str == NULL((void*)0)) { // end of list
5292 break;
5293 }
5294 if (*str == NUL'\000') { // skip empty strings
5295 continue;
5296 }
5297 if (vim_regexec(regmatch, str, (colnr_T)0)) {
5298 ++count;
5299 }
5300 }
5301 if (count == 0) {
5302 return;
5303 }
5304 assert(count < INT_MAX)((void) sizeof ((count < 2147483647) ? 1 : 0), __extension__
({ if (count < 2147483647) ; else __assert_fail ("count < INT_MAX"
, "/home/runner/work/doc/doc/neovim/src/nvim/ex_getln.c", 5304
, __extension__ __PRETTY_FUNCTION__); }));
5305 *num_file = (int)count;
5306 *file = (char_u **)xmalloc(count * sizeof(char_u *));
5307
5308 // copy the matching names into allocated memory
5309 count = 0;
5310 for (i = 0;; i++) {
5311 str = (char_u *)(*func)(xp, i);
5312 if (str == NULL((void*)0)) { // End of list.
5313 break;
5314 }
5315 if (*str == NUL'\000') { // Skip empty strings.
5316 continue;
5317 }
5318 if (vim_regexec(regmatch, str, (colnr_T)0)) {
5319 if (escaped) {
5320 str = vim_strsave_escaped(str, (char_u *)" \t\\.");
5321 } else {
5322 str = vim_strsave(str);
5323 }
5324 (*file)[count++] = str;
5325 if (func == get_menu_names) {
5326 // Test for separator added by get_menu_names().
5327 str += STRLEN(str)strlen((char *)(str)) - 1;
5328 if (*str == '\001') {
5329 *str = '.';
5330 }
5331 }
5332 }
5333 }
5334
5335 // Sort the results. Keep menu's in the specified order.
5336 if (xp->xp_context != EXPAND_MENUNAMES && xp->xp_context != EXPAND_MENUS) {
5337 if (xp->xp_context == EXPAND_EXPRESSION
5338 || xp->xp_context == EXPAND_FUNCTIONS
5339 || xp->xp_context == EXPAND_USER_FUNC) {
5340 // <SNR> functions should be sorted to the end.
5341 qsort((void *)*file, (size_t)*num_file, sizeof(char_u *),
5342 sort_func_compare);
5343 } else {
5344 sort_strings(*file, *num_file);
5345 }
5346 }
5347
5348 /* Reset the variables used for special highlight names expansion, so that
5349 * they don't show up when getting normal highlight names by ID. */
5350 reset_expand_highlight();
5351}
5352
5353/// Complete a shell command.
5354///
5355/// @param filepat is a pattern to match with command names.
5356/// @param[out] num_file is pointer to number of matches.
5357/// @param[out] file is pointer to array of pointers to matches.
5358/// *file will either be set to NULL or point to
5359/// allocated memory.
5360/// @param flagsarg is a combination of EW_* flags.
5361static void expand_shellcmd(char_u *filepat, int *num_file, char_u ***file, int flagsarg)
5362 FUNC_ATTR_NONNULL_ALL
5363{
5364 char_u *pat;
5365 int i;
5366 char_u *path = NULL((void*)0);
5367 garray_T ga;
5368 char_u *buf = xmalloc(MAXPATHL4096);
5369 size_t l;
5370 char_u *s, *e;
5371 int flags = flagsarg;
5372 int ret;
5373 bool_Bool did_curdir = false0;
5374
5375 // for ":set path=" and ":set tags=" halve backslashes for escaped space
5376 pat = vim_strsave(filepat);
5377 for (i = 0; pat[i]; ++i) {
5378 if (pat[i] == '\\' && pat[i + 1] == ' ') {
5379 STRMOVE(pat + i, pat + i + 1)memmove((pat + i), (pat + i + 1), strlen((char *)(pat + i + 1
)) + 1);
5380 }
5381 }
5382
5383 flags |= EW_FILE0x02 | EW_EXEC0x40 | EW_SHELLCMD0x2000;
5384
5385 bool_Bool mustfree = false0; // Track memory allocation for *path.
5386 if (pat[0] == '.' && (vim_ispathsep(pat[1])
5387 || (pat[1] == '.' && vim_ispathsep(pat[2])))) {
5388 path = (char_u *)".";
5389 } else {
5390 // For an absolute name we don't use $PATH.
5391 if (!path_is_absolute(pat)) {
5392 path = (char_u *)vim_getenv("PATH");
5393 }
5394 if (path == NULL((void*)0)) {
5395 path = (char_u *)"";
5396 } else {
5397 mustfree = true1;
5398 }
5399 }
5400
5401 /*
5402 * Go over all directories in $PATH. Expand matches in that directory and
5403 * collect them in "ga". When "." is not in $PATH also expaned for the
5404 * current directory, to find "subdir/cmd".
5405 */
5406 ga_init(&ga, (int)sizeof(char *), 10);
5407 hashtab_T found_ht;
5408 hash_init(&found_ht);
5409 for (s = path;; s = e) {
5410 e = (char_u *)vim_strchr((char *)s, ENV_SEPCHAR':');
5411 if (e == NULL((void*)0)) {
5412 e = s + STRLEN(s)strlen((char *)(s));
5413 }
5414
5415 if (*s == NUL'\000') {
5416 if (did_curdir) {
5417 break;
5418 }
5419 // Find directories in the current directory, path is empty.
5420 did_curdir = true1;
5421 flags |= EW_DIR0x01;
5422 } else if (STRNCMP(s, ".", e - s)strncmp((char *)(s), (char *)("."), (size_t)(e - s)) == 0) {
5423 did_curdir = true1;
5424 flags |= EW_DIR0x01;
5425 } else {
5426 // Do not match directories inside a $PATH item.
5427 flags &= ~EW_DIR0x01;
5428 }
5429
5430 l = (size_t)(e - s);
5431 if (l > MAXPATHL4096 - 5) {
5432 break;
5433 }
5434 STRLCPY(buf, s, l + 1)xstrlcpy((char *)(buf), (char *)(s), (size_t)(l + 1));
5435 add_pathsep((char *)buf);
5436 l = STRLEN(buf)strlen((char *)(buf));
5437 STRLCPY(buf + l, pat, MAXPATHL - l)xstrlcpy((char *)(buf + l), (char *)(pat), (size_t)(4096 - l)
);
5438
5439 // Expand matches in one directory of $PATH.
5440 ret = expand_wildcards(1, &buf, num_file, file, flags);
5441 if (ret == OK1) {
5442 ga_grow(&ga, *num_file);
5443 {
5444 for (i = 0; i < *num_file; i++) {
5445 char_u *name = (*file)[i];
5446
5447 if (STRLEN(name)strlen((char *)(name)) > l) {
5448 // Check if this name was already found.
5449 hash_T hash = hash_hash(name + l);
5450 hashitem_T *hi =
5451 hash_lookup(&found_ht, (const char *)(name + l),
5452 STRLEN(name + l)strlen((char *)(name + l)), hash);
5453 if (HASHITEM_EMPTY(hi)((hi)->hi_key == ((void*)0) || (hi)->hi_key == (char_u *
)&hash_removed)) {
5454 // Remove the path that was prepended.
5455 STRMOVE(name, name + l)memmove((name), (name + l), strlen((char *)(name + l)) + 1);
5456 ((char_u **)ga.ga_data)[ga.ga_len++] = name;
5457 hash_add_item(&found_ht, hi, name, hash);
5458 name = NULL((void*)0);
5459 }
5460 }
5461 xfree(name);
5462 }
5463 xfree(*file);
5464 }
5465 }
5466 if (*e != NUL'\000') {
5467 ++e;
5468 }
5469 }
5470 *file = ga.ga_data;
5471 *num_file = ga.ga_len;
5472
5473 xfree(buf);
5474 xfree(pat);
5475 if (mustfree) {
5476 xfree(path);
5477 }
5478 hash_clear(&found_ht);
5479}
5480
5481/// Call "user_expand_func()" to invoke a user defined Vim script function and
5482/// return the result (either a string, a List or NULL).
5483static void *call_user_expand_func(user_expand_func_T user_expand_func, expand_T *xp, int *num_file,
5484 char_u ***file)
5485 FUNC_ATTR_NONNULL_ALL
5486{
5487 char_u keep = 0;
5488 typval_T args[4];
5489 char_u *pat = NULL((void*)0);
5490 const sctx_T save_current_sctx = current_sctx;
5491
5492 if (xp->xp_arg == NULL((void*)0) || xp->xp_arg[0] == '\0' || xp->xp_line == NULL((void*)0)) {
5493 return NULL((void*)0);
5494 }
5495 *num_file = 0;
5496 *file = NULL((void*)0);
5497
5498 if (ccline.cmdbuff != NULL((void*)0)) {
5499 keep = ccline.cmdbuff[ccline.cmdlen];
5500 ccline.cmdbuff[ccline.cmdlen] = 0;
5501 }
5502
5503 pat = vim_strnsave((char_u *)xp->xp_pattern, xp->xp_pattern_len);
5504 args[0].v_type = VAR_STRING;
5505 args[1].v_type = VAR_STRING;
5506 args[2].v_type = VAR_NUMBER;
5507 args[3].v_type = VAR_UNKNOWN;
5508 args[0].vval.v_string = (char *)pat;
5509 args[1].vval.v_string = xp->xp_line;
5510 args[2].vval.v_number = xp->xp_col;
5511
5512 current_sctx = xp->xp_script_ctx;
5513
5514 void *const ret = user_expand_func((char_u *)xp->xp_arg, 3, args);
5515
5516 current_sctx = save_current_sctx;
5517 if (ccline.cmdbuff != NULL((void*)0)) {
5518 ccline.cmdbuff[ccline.cmdlen] = keep;
5519 }
5520
5521 xfree(pat);
5522 return ret;
5523}
5524
5525/*
5526 * Expand names with a function defined by the user.
5527 */
5528static int ExpandUserDefined(expand_T *xp, regmatch_T *regmatch, int *num_file, char_u ***file)
5529{
5530 char_u *e;
5531 garray_T ga;
5532
5533 char_u *const retstr = call_user_expand_func((user_expand_func_T)call_func_retstr, xp, num_file,
5534 file);
5535
5536 if (retstr == NULL((void*)0)) {
5537 return FAIL0;
5538 }
5539
5540 ga_init(&ga, (int)sizeof(char *), 3);
5541 for (char_u *s = retstr; *s != NUL'\000'; s = e) {
5542 e = (char_u *)vim_strchr((char *)s, '\n');
5543 if (e == NULL((void*)0)) {
5544 e = s + STRLEN(s)strlen((char *)(s));
5545 }
5546 const char_u keep = *e;
5547 *e = NUL'\000';
5548
5549 const bool_Bool skip = xp->xp_pattern[0]
5550 && vim_regexec(regmatch, s, (colnr_T)0) == 0;
5551 *e = keep;
5552 if (!skip) {
5553 GA_APPEND(char_u *, &ga, vim_strnsave(s, (size_t)(e - s)))do { ga_grow(&ga, 1); ((char_u * *)(&ga)->ga_data)
[(&ga)->ga_len++] = (vim_strnsave(s, (size_t)(e - s)))
; } while (0);
5554 }
5555
5556 if (*e != NUL'\000') {
5557 e++;
5558 }
5559 }
5560 xfree(retstr);
5561 *file = ga.ga_data;
5562 *num_file = ga.ga_len;
5563 return OK1;
5564}
5565
5566/*
5567 * Expand names with a list returned by a function defined by the user.
5568 */
5569static int ExpandUserList(expand_T *xp, int *num_file, char_u ***file)
5570{
5571 list_T *const retlist = call_user_expand_func((user_expand_func_T)call_func_retlist, xp, num_file,
5572 file);
5573 if (retlist == NULL((void*)0)) {
5574 return FAIL0;
5575 }
5576
5577 garray_T ga;
5578 ga_init(&ga, (int)sizeof(char *), 3);
5579 // Loop over the items in the list.
5580 TV_LIST_ITER_CONST(retlist, li, {do { const list_T *const l_ = (retlist); ; if (l_ != ((void*)
0)) { for (const listitem_T *li = l_->lv_first; li != ((void
*)0); li = li->li_next) { { if ((&(li)->li_tv)->
v_type != VAR_STRING || (&(li)->li_tv)->vval.v_string
== ((void*)0)) { continue; } do { ga_grow(&ga, 1); ((char
* *)(&ga)->ga_data)[(&ga)->ga_len++] = (xstrdup
((const char *)(&(li)->li_tv)->vval.v_string)); } while
(0); } } } } while (0)
5581 if (TV_LIST_ITEM_TV(li)->v_type != VAR_STRINGdo { const list_T *const l_ = (retlist); ; if (l_ != ((void*)
0)) { for (const listitem_T *li = l_->lv_first; li != ((void
*)0); li = li->li_next) { { if ((&(li)->li_tv)->
v_type != VAR_STRING || (&(li)->li_tv)->vval.v_string
== ((void*)0)) { continue; } do { ga_grow(&ga, 1); ((char
* *)(&ga)->ga_data)[(&ga)->ga_len++] = (xstrdup
((const char *)(&(li)->li_tv)->vval.v_string)); } while
(0); } } } } while (0)
5582 || TV_LIST_ITEM_TV(li)->vval.v_string == NULL) {do { const list_T *const l_ = (retlist); ; if (l_ != ((void*)
0)) { for (const listitem_T *li = l_->lv_first; li != ((void
*)0); li = li->li_next) { { if ((&(li)->li_tv)->
v_type != VAR_STRING || (&(li)->li_tv)->vval.v_string
== ((void*)0)) { continue; } do { ga_grow(&ga, 1); ((char
* *)(&ga)->ga_data)[(&ga)->ga_len++] = (xstrdup
((const char *)(&(li)->li_tv)->vval.v_string)); } while
(0); } } } } while (0)
5583 continue; // Skip non-string items and empty strings.do { const list_T *const l_ = (retlist); ; if (l_ != ((void*)
0)) { for (const listitem_T *li = l_->lv_first; li != ((void
*)0); li = li->li_next) { { if ((&(li)->li_tv)->
v_type != VAR_STRING || (&(li)->li_tv)->vval.v_string
== ((void*)0)) { continue; } do { ga_grow(&ga, 1); ((char
* *)(&ga)->ga_data)[(&ga)->ga_len++] = (xstrdup
((const char *)(&(li)->li_tv)->vval.v_string)); } while
(0); } } } } while (0)
5584 }do { const list_T *const l_ = (retlist); ; if (l_ != ((void*)
0)) { for (const listitem_T *li = l_->lv_first; li != ((void
*)0); li = li->li_next) { { if ((&(li)->li_tv)->
v_type != VAR_STRING || (&(li)->li_tv)->vval.v_string
== ((void*)0)) { continue; } do { ga_grow(&ga, 1); ((char
* *)(&ga)->ga_data)[(&ga)->ga_len++] = (xstrdup
((const char *)(&(li)->li_tv)->vval.v_string)); } while
(0); } } } } while (0)
5585
5586 GA_APPEND(char *, &ga, xstrdup((const char *)TV_LIST_ITEM_TV(li)->vval.v_string));do { const list_T *const l_ = (retlist); ; if (l_ != ((void*)
0)) { for (const listitem_T *li = l_->lv_first; li != ((void
*)0); li = li->li_next) { { if ((&(li)->li_tv)->
v_type != VAR_STRING || (&(li)->li_tv)->vval.v_string
== ((void*)0)) { continue; } do { ga_grow(&ga, 1); ((char
* *)(&ga)->ga_data)[(&ga)->ga_len++] = (xstrdup
((const char *)(&(li)->li_tv)->vval.v_string)); } while
(0); } } } } while (0)
5587 })do { const list_T *const l_ = (retlist); ; if (l_ != ((void*)
0)) { for (const listitem_T *li = l_->lv_first; li != ((void
*)0); li = li->li_next) { { if ((&(li)->li_tv)->
v_type != VAR_STRING || (&(li)->li_tv)->vval.v_string
== ((void*)0)) { continue; } do { ga_grow(&ga, 1); ((char
* *)(&ga)->ga_data)[(&ga)->ga_len++] = (xstrdup
((const char *)(&(li)->li_tv)->vval.v_string)); } while
(0); } } } } while (0);
5588 tv_list_unref(retlist);
5589
5590 *file = ga.ga_data;
5591 *num_file = ga.ga_len;
5592 return OK1;
5593}
5594
5595static int ExpandUserLua(expand_T *xp, int *num_file, char_u ***file)
5596{
5597 typval_T rettv;
5598 nlua_call_user_expand_func(xp, &rettv);
5599 if (rettv.v_type != VAR_LIST) {
5600 tv_clear(&rettv);
5601 return FAIL0;
5602 }
5603
5604 list_T *const retlist = rettv.vval.v_list;
5605
5606 garray_T ga;
5607 ga_init(&ga, (int)sizeof(char *), 3);
5608 // Loop over the items in the list.
5609 TV_LIST_ITER_CONST(retlist, li, {do { const list_T *const l_ = (retlist); ; if (l_ != ((void*)
0)) { for (const listitem_T *li = l_->lv_first; li != ((void
*)0); li = li->li_next) { { if ((&(li)->li_tv)->
v_type != VAR_STRING || (&(li)->li_tv)->vval.v_string
== ((void*)0)) { continue; } do { ga_grow(&ga, 1); ((char
* *)(&ga)->ga_data)[(&ga)->ga_len++] = (xstrdup
((const char *)(&(li)->li_tv)->vval.v_string)); } while
(0); } } } } while (0)
5610 if (TV_LIST_ITEM_TV(li)->v_type != VAR_STRINGdo { const list_T *const l_ = (retlist); ; if (l_ != ((void*)
0)) { for (const listitem_T *li = l_->lv_first; li != ((void
*)0); li = li->li_next) { { if ((&(li)->li_tv)->
v_type != VAR_STRING || (&(li)->li_tv)->vval.v_string
== ((void*)0)) { continue; } do { ga_grow(&ga, 1); ((char
* *)(&ga)->ga_data)[(&ga)->ga_len++] = (xstrdup
((const char *)(&(li)->li_tv)->vval.v_string)); } while
(0); } } } } while (0)
5611 || TV_LIST_ITEM_TV(li)->vval.v_string == NULL) {do { const list_T *const l_ = (retlist); ; if (l_ != ((void*)
0)) { for (const listitem_T *li = l_->lv_first; li != ((void
*)0); li = li->li_next) { { if ((&(li)->li_tv)->
v_type != VAR_STRING || (&(li)->li_tv)->vval.v_string
== ((void*)0)) { continue; } do { ga_grow(&ga, 1); ((char
* *)(&ga)->ga_data)[(&ga)->ga_len++] = (xstrdup
((const char *)(&(li)->li_tv)->vval.v_string)); } while
(0); } } } } while (0)
5612 continue; // Skip non-string items and empty strings.do { const list_T *const l_ = (retlist); ; if (l_ != ((void*)
0)) { for (const listitem_T *li = l_->lv_first; li != ((void
*)0); li = li->li_next) { { if ((&(li)->li_tv)->
v_type != VAR_STRING || (&(li)->li_tv)->vval.v_string
== ((void*)0)) { continue; } do { ga_grow(&ga, 1); ((char
* *)(&ga)->ga_data)[(&ga)->ga_len++] = (xstrdup
((const char *)(&(li)->li_tv)->vval.v_string)); } while
(0); } } } } while (0)
5613 }do { const list_T *const l_ = (retlist); ; if (l_ != ((void*)
0)) { for (const listitem_T *li = l_->lv_first; li != ((void
*)0); li = li->li_next) { { if ((&(li)->li_tv)->
v_type != VAR_STRING || (&(li)->li_tv)->vval.v_string
== ((void*)0)) { continue; } do { ga_grow(&ga, 1); ((char
* *)(&ga)->ga_data)[(&ga)->ga_len++] = (xstrdup
((const char *)(&(li)->li_tv)->vval.v_string)); } while
(0); } } } } while (0)
5614
5615 GA_APPEND(char *, &ga, xstrdup((const char *)TV_LIST_ITEM_TV(li)->vval.v_string));do { const list_T *const l_ = (retlist); ; if (l_ != ((void*)
0)) { for (const listitem_T *li = l_->lv_first; li != ((void
*)0); li = li->li_next) { { if ((&(li)->li_tv)->
v_type != VAR_STRING || (&(li)->li_tv)->vval.v_string
== ((void*)0)) { continue; } do { ga_grow(&ga, 1); ((char
* *)(&ga)->ga_data)[(&ga)->ga_len++] = (xstrdup
((const char *)(&(li)->li_tv)->vval.v_string)); } while
(0); } } } } while (0)
5616 })do { const list_T *const l_ = (retlist); ; if (l_ != ((void*)
0)) { for (const listitem_T *li = l_->lv_first; li != ((void
*)0); li = li->li_next) { { if ((&(li)->li_tv)->
v_type != VAR_STRING || (&(li)->li_tv)->vval.v_string
== ((void*)0)) { continue; } do { ga_grow(&ga, 1); ((char
* *)(&ga)->ga_data)[(&ga)->ga_len++] = (xstrdup
((const char *)(&(li)->li_tv)->vval.v_string)); } while
(0); } } } } while (0);
5617 tv_list_unref(retlist);
5618
5619 *file = ga.ga_data;
5620 *num_file = ga.ga_len;
5621 return OK1;
5622}
5623
5624/// Expand color scheme, compiler or filetype names.
5625/// Search from 'runtimepath':
5626/// 'runtimepath'/{dirnames}/{pat}.vim
5627/// When "flags" has DIP_START: search also from 'start' of 'packpath':
5628/// 'packpath'/pack/ * /start/ * /{dirnames}/{pat}.vim
5629/// When "flags" has DIP_OPT: search also from 'opt' of 'packpath':
5630/// 'packpath'/pack/ * /opt/ * /{dirnames}/{pat}.vim
5631/// When "flags" has DIP_LUA: search also performed for .lua files
5632/// "dirnames" is an array with one or more directory names.
5633static int ExpandRTDir(char_u *pat, int flags, int *num_file, char_u ***file, char *dirnames[])
5634{
5635 *num_file = 0;
5636 *file = NULL((void*)0);
5637 size_t pat_len = STRLEN(pat)strlen((char *)(pat));
5638
5639 garray_T ga;
5640 ga_init(&ga, (int)sizeof(char *), 10);
5641
5642 // TODO(bfredl): this is bullshit, exandpath should not reinvent path logic.
5643 for (int i = 0; dirnames[i] != NULL((void*)0); i++) {
5644 size_t size = STRLEN(dirnames[i])strlen((char *)(dirnames[i])) + pat_len + 7;
5645 char_u *s = xmalloc(size);
5646 snprintf((char *)s, size, "%s/%s*.vim", dirnames[i], pat);
5647 globpath(p_rtp, s, &ga, 0);
5648 if (flags & DIP_LUA0x100) {
5649 snprintf((char *)s, size, "%s/%s*.lua", dirnames[i], pat);
5650 globpath(p_rtp, s, &ga, 0);
5651 }
5652 xfree(s);
5653 }
5654
5655 if (flags & DIP_START0x08) {
5656 for (int i = 0; dirnames[i] != NULL((void*)0); i++) {
5657 size_t size = STRLEN(dirnames[i])strlen((char *)(dirnames[i])) + pat_len + 22;
5658 char_u *s = xmalloc(size);
5659 snprintf((char *)s, size, "pack/*/start/*/%s/%s*.vim", dirnames[i], pat); // NOLINT
5660 globpath(p_pp, s, &ga, 0);
5661 if (flags & DIP_LUA0x100) {
5662 snprintf((char *)s, size, "pack/*/start/*/%s/%s*.lua", dirnames[i], pat); // NOLINT
5663 globpath(p_pp, s, &ga, 0);
5664 }
5665 xfree(s);
5666 }
5667
5668 for (int i = 0; dirnames[i] != NULL((void*)0); i++) {
5669 size_t size = STRLEN(dirnames[i])strlen((char *)(dirnames[i])) + pat_len + 22;
5670 char_u *s = xmalloc(size);
5671 snprintf((char *)s, size, "start/*/%s/%s*.vim", dirnames[i], pat); // NOLINT
5672 globpath(p_pp, s, &ga, 0);
5673 if (flags & DIP_LUA0x100) {
5674 snprintf((char *)s, size, "start/*/%s/%s*.lua", dirnames[i], pat); // NOLINT
5675 globpath(p_pp, s, &ga, 0);
5676 }
5677 xfree(s);
5678 }
5679 }
5680
5681 if (flags & DIP_OPT0x10) {
5682 for (int i = 0; dirnames[i] != NULL((void*)0); i++) {
5683 size_t size = STRLEN(dirnames[i])strlen((char *)(dirnames[i])) + pat_len + 20;
5684 char_u *s = xmalloc(size);
5685 snprintf((char *)s, size, "pack/*/opt/*/%s/%s*.vim", dirnames[i], pat); // NOLINT
5686 globpath(p_pp, s, &ga, 0);
5687 if (flags & DIP_LUA0x100) {
5688 snprintf((char *)s, size, "pack/*/opt/*/%s/%s*.lua", dirnames[i], pat); // NOLINT
5689 globpath(p_pp, s, &ga, 0);
5690 }
5691 xfree(s);
5692 }
5693
5694 for (int i = 0; dirnames[i] != NULL((void*)0); i++) {
5695 size_t size = STRLEN(dirnames[i])strlen((char *)(dirnames[i])) + pat_len + 20;
5696 char_u *s = xmalloc(size);
5697 snprintf((char *)s, size, "opt/*/%s/%s*.vim", dirnames[i], pat); // NOLINT
5698 globpath(p_pp, s, &ga, 0);
5699 if (flags & DIP_LUA0x100) {
5700 snprintf((char *)s, size, "opt/*/%s/%s*.lua", dirnames[i], pat); // NOLINT
5701 globpath(p_pp, s, &ga, 0);
5702 }
5703 xfree(s);
5704 }
5705 }
5706
5707 for (int i = 0; i < ga.ga_len; i++) {
5708 char_u *match = ((char_u **)ga.ga_data)[i];
5709 char_u *s = match;
5710 char_u *e = s + STRLEN(s)strlen((char *)(s));
5711 if (e - s > 4 && (STRNICMP(e - 4, ".vim", 4)strncasecmp((char *)(e - 4), (char *)(".vim"), (size_t)(4)) == 0
5712 || ((flags & DIP_LUA0x100)
5713 && STRNICMP(e - 4, ".lua", 4)strncasecmp((char *)(e - 4), (char *)(".lua"), (size_t)(4)) == 0))) {
5714 e -= 4;
5715 for (s = e; s > match; MB_PTR_BACK(match, s)(s -= utf_head_off((char_u *)(match), (char_u *)(s) - 1) + 1)) {
5716 if (vim_ispathsep(*s)) {
5717 break;
5718 }
5719 }
5720 s++;
5721 *e = NUL'\000';
5722 assert((e - s) + 1 >= 0)((void) sizeof (((e - s) + 1 >= 0) ? 1 : 0), __extension__
({ if ((e - s) + 1 >= 0) ; else __assert_fail ("(e - s) + 1 >= 0"
, "/home/runner/work/doc/doc/neovim/src/nvim/ex_getln.c", 5722
, __extension__ __PRETTY_FUNCTION__); }));
5723 memmove(match, s, (size_t)(e - s) + 1);
5724 }
5725 }
5726
5727 if (GA_EMPTY(&ga)((&ga)->ga_len <= 0)) {
5728 return FAIL0;
5729 }
5730
5731 /* Sort and remove duplicates which can happen when specifying multiple
5732 * directories in dirnames. */
5733 ga_remove_duplicate_strings(&ga);
5734
5735 *file = ga.ga_data;
5736 *num_file = ga.ga_len;
5737 return OK1;
5738}
5739
5740/// Expand loadplugin names:
5741/// 'packpath'/pack/ * /opt/{pat}
5742static int ExpandPackAddDir(char_u *pat, int *num_file, char_u ***file)
5743{
5744 garray_T ga;
5745
5746 *num_file = 0;
5747 *file = NULL((void*)0);
5748 size_t pat_len = STRLEN(pat)strlen((char *)(pat));
5749 ga_init(&ga, (int)sizeof(char *), 10);
5750
5751 size_t buflen = pat_len + 26;
5752 char_u *s = xmalloc(buflen);
5753 snprintf((char *)s, buflen, "pack/*/opt/%s*", pat); // NOLINT
5754 globpath(p_pp, s, &ga, 0);
5755 snprintf((char *)s, buflen, "opt/%s*", pat); // NOLINT
5756 globpath(p_pp, s, &ga, 0);
5757 xfree(s);
5758
5759 for (int i = 0; i < ga.ga_len; i++) {
5760 char_u *match = ((char_u **)ga.ga_data)[i];
5761 s = (char_u *)path_tail((char *)match);
5762 memmove(match, s, STRLEN(s)strlen((char *)(s)) + 1);
5763 }
5764
5765 if (GA_EMPTY(&ga)((&ga)->ga_len <= 0)) {
5766 return FAIL0;
5767 }
5768
5769 // Sort and remove duplicates which can happen when specifying multiple
5770 // directories in dirnames.
5771 ga_remove_duplicate_strings(&ga);
5772
5773 *file = ga.ga_data;
5774 *num_file = ga.ga_len;
5775 return OK1;
5776}
5777
5778/// Expand `file` for all comma-separated directories in `path`.
5779/// Adds matches to `ga`.
5780void globpath(char_u *path, char_u *file, garray_T *ga, int expand_options)
5781{
5782 expand_T xpc;
5783 ExpandInit(&xpc);
5784 xpc.xp_context = EXPAND_FILES;
5785
5786 char_u *buf = xmalloc(MAXPATHL4096);
5787
5788 // Loop over all entries in {path}.
5789 while (*path != NUL'\000') {
5790 // Copy one item of the path to buf[] and concatenate the file name.
5791 copy_option_part(&path, buf, MAXPATHL4096, ",");
5792 if (STRLEN(buf)strlen((char *)(buf)) + STRLEN(file)strlen((char *)(file)) + 2 < MAXPATHL4096) {
5793 add_pathsep((char *)buf);
5794 STRCAT(buf, file)strcat((char *)(buf), (char *)(file)); // NOLINT
5795
5796 char_u **p;
5797 int num_p = 0;
5798 (void)ExpandFromContext(&xpc, buf, &num_p, &p,
5799 WILD_SILENT0x40 | expand_options);
5800 if (num_p > 0) {
5801 ExpandEscape(&xpc, buf, num_p, p, WILD_SILENT0x40 | expand_options);
5802
5803 // Concatenate new results to previous ones.
5804 ga_grow(ga, num_p);
5805 // take over the pointers and put them in "ga"
5806 for (int i = 0; i < num_p; i++) {
5807 ((char_u **)ga->ga_data)[ga->ga_len] = p[i];
5808 ga->ga_len++;
5809 }
5810 xfree(p);
5811 }
5812 }
5813 }
5814
5815 xfree(buf);
5816}
5817
5818/*********************************
5819* Command line history stuff *
5820*********************************/
5821
5822/// Translate a history character to the associated type number
5823static HistoryType hist_char2type(const int c)
5824 FUNC_ATTR_CONST FUNC_ATTR_WARN_UNUSED_RESULT
5825{
5826 switch (c) {
5827 case ':':
5828 return HIST_CMD;
5829 case '=':
5830 return HIST_EXPR;
5831 case '@':
5832 return HIST_INPUT;
5833 case '>':
5834 return HIST_DEBUG;
5835 case NUL'\000':
5836 case '/':
5837 case '?':
5838 return HIST_SEARCH;
5839 default:
5840 return HIST_INVALID;
5841 }
5842 // Silence -Wreturn-type
5843 return 0;
5844}
5845
5846/*
5847 * Table of history names.
5848 * These names are used in :history and various hist...() functions.
5849 * It is sufficient to give the significant prefix of a history name.
5850 */
5851
5852static char *(history_names[]) =
5853{
5854 "cmd",
5855 "search",
5856 "expr",
5857 "input",
5858 "debug",
5859 NULL((void*)0)
5860};
5861
5862/*
5863 * Function given to ExpandGeneric() to obtain the possible first
5864 * arguments of the ":history command.
5865 */
5866static char *get_history_arg(expand_T *xp, int idx)
5867{
5868 static char_u compl[2] = { NUL'\000', NUL'\000' };
5869 char *short_names = ":=@>?/";
5870 int short_names_count = (int)STRLEN(short_names)strlen((char *)(short_names));
5871 int history_name_count = ARRAY_SIZE(history_names)((sizeof(history_names)/sizeof((history_names)[0])) / ((size_t
)(!(sizeof(history_names) % sizeof((history_names)[0]))))) - 1;
5872
5873 if (idx < short_names_count) {
5874 compl[0] = (char_u)short_names[idx];
5875 return (char *)compl;
5876 }
5877 if (idx < short_names_count + history_name_count) {
5878 return history_names[idx - short_names_count];
5879 }
5880 if (idx == short_names_count + history_name_count) {
5881 return "all";
5882 }
5883 return NULL((void*)0);
5884}
5885
5886/// Initialize command line history.
5887/// Also used to re-allocate history tables when size changes.
5888void init_history(void)
5889{
5890 assert(p_hi >= 0 && p_hi <= INT_MAX)((void) sizeof ((p_hi >= 0 && p_hi <= 2147483647
) ? 1 : 0), __extension__ ({ if (p_hi >= 0 && p_hi
<= 2147483647) ; else __assert_fail ("p_hi >= 0 && p_hi <= INT_MAX"
, "/home/runner/work/doc/doc/neovim/src/nvim/ex_getln.c", 5890
, __extension__ __PRETTY_FUNCTION__); }));
5891 int newlen = (int)p_hi;
5892 int oldlen = hislen;
5893
5894 // If history tables size changed, reallocate them.
5895 // Tables are circular arrays (current position marked by hisidx[type]).
5896 // On copying them to the new arrays, we take the chance to reorder them.
5897 if (newlen != oldlen) {
5898 for (int type = 0; type < HIST_COUNT(HIST_DEBUG + 1); type++) {
5899 histentry_T *temp = (newlen
5900 ? xmalloc((size_t)newlen * sizeof(*temp))
5901 : NULL((void*)0));
5902
5903 int j = hisidx[type];
5904 if (j >= 0) {
5905 // old array gets partitioned this way:
5906 // [0 , i1 ) --> newest entries to be deleted
5907 // [i1 , i1 + l1) --> newest entries to be copied
5908 // [i1 + l1 , i2 ) --> oldest entries to be deleted
5909 // [i2 , i2 + l2) --> oldest entries to be copied
5910 int l1 = MIN(j + 1, newlen)(((j + 1)<(newlen))?(j + 1):(newlen)); // how many newest to copy
5911 int l2 = MIN(newlen, oldlen)(((newlen)<(oldlen))?(newlen):(oldlen)) - l1; // how many oldest to copy
5912 int i1 = j + 1 - l1; // copy newest from here
5913 int i2 = MAX(l1, oldlen - newlen + l1)(((l1)>(oldlen - newlen + l1))?(l1):(oldlen - newlen + l1)
); // copy oldest from here
5914
5915 // copy as much entries as they fit to new table, reordering them
5916 if (newlen) {
5917 // copy oldest entries
5918 memcpy(&temp[0], &history[type][i2], (size_t)l2 * sizeof(*temp));
5919 // copy newest entries
5920 memcpy(&temp[l2], &history[type][i1], (size_t)l1 * sizeof(*temp));
5921 }
5922
5923 // delete entries that don't fit in newlen, if any
5924 for (int i = 0; i < i1; i++) {
5925 hist_free_entry(history[type] + i);
5926 }
5927 for (int i = i1 + l1; i < i2; i++) {
5928 hist_free_entry(history[type] + i);
5929 }
5930 }
5931
5932 // clear remaining space, if any
5933 int l3 = j < 0 ? 0 : MIN(newlen, oldlen)(((newlen)<(oldlen))?(newlen):(oldlen)); // number of copied entries
5934 if (newlen) {
5935 memset(temp + l3, 0, (size_t)(newlen - l3) * sizeof(*temp));
5936 }
5937
5938 hisidx[type] = l3 - 1;
5939 xfree(history[type]);
5940 history[type] = temp;
5941 }
5942 hislen = newlen;
5943 }
5944}
5945
5946static inline void hist_free_entry(histentry_T *hisptr)
5947 FUNC_ATTR_NONNULL_ALL
5948{
5949 xfree(hisptr->hisstr);
5950 tv_list_unref(hisptr->additional_elements);
5951 clear_hist_entry(hisptr);
5952}
5953
5954static inline void clear_hist_entry(histentry_T *hisptr)
5955 FUNC_ATTR_NONNULL_ALL
5956{
5957 memset(hisptr, 0, sizeof(*hisptr));
5958}
5959
5960/// Check if command line 'str' is already in history.
5961/// If 'move_to_front' is TRUE, matching entry is moved to end of history.
5962///
5963/// @param move_to_front Move the entry to the front if it exists
5964static int in_history(int type, char_u *str, int move_to_front, int sep)
5965{
5966 int i;
5967 int last_i = -1;
5968 char_u *p;
5969
5970 if (hisidx[type] < 0) {
5971 return FALSE0;
5972 }
5973 i = hisidx[type];
5974 do {
5975 if (history[type][i].hisstr == NULL((void*)0)) {
5976 return FALSE0;
5977 }
5978
5979 /* For search history, check that the separator character matches as
5980 * well. */
5981 p = history[type][i].hisstr;
5982 if (STRCMP(str, p)strcmp((char *)(str), (char *)(p)) == 0
5983 && (type != HIST_SEARCH || sep == p[STRLEN(p)strlen((char *)(p)) + 1])) {
5984 if (!move_to_front) {
5985 return TRUE1;
5986 }
5987 last_i = i;
5988 break;
5989 }
5990 if (--i < 0) {
5991 i = hislen - 1;
5992 }
5993 } while (i != hisidx[type]);
5994
5995 if (last_i >= 0) {
5996 list_T *const list = history[type][i].additional_elements;
5997 str = history[type][i].hisstr;
5998 while (i != hisidx[type]) {
5999 if (++i >= hislen) {
6000 i = 0;
6001 }
6002 history[type][last_i] = history[type][i];
6003 last_i = i;
6004 }
6005 tv_list_unref(list);
6006 history[type][i].hisnum = ++hisnum[type];
6007 history[type][i].hisstr = str;
6008 history[type][i].timestamp = os_time();
6009 history[type][i].additional_elements = NULL((void*)0);
6010 return true1;
6011 }
6012 return false0;
6013}
6014
6015/// Convert history name to its HIST_ equivalent
6016///
6017/// Names are taken from the table above. When `name` is empty returns currently
6018/// active history or HIST_DEFAULT, depending on `return_default` argument.
6019///
6020/// @param[in] name Converted name.
6021/// @param[in] len Name length.
6022/// @param[in] return_default Determines whether HIST_DEFAULT should be
6023/// returned or value based on `ccline.cmdfirstc`.
6024///
6025/// @return Any value from HistoryType enum, including HIST_INVALID. May not
6026/// return HIST_DEFAULT unless return_default is true.
6027HistoryType get_histtype(const char *const name, const size_t len, const bool_Bool return_default)
6028 FUNC_ATTR_PURE FUNC_ATTR_WARN_UNUSED_RESULT
6029{
6030 // No argument: use current history.
6031 if (len == 0) {
6032 return return_default ? HIST_DEFAULT : hist_char2type(ccline.cmdfirstc);
6033 }
6034
6035 for (HistoryType i = 0; history_names[i] != NULL((void*)0); i++) {
6036 if (STRNICMP(name, history_names[i], len)strncasecmp((char *)(name), (char *)(history_names[i]), (size_t
)(len)) == 0) {
6037 return i;
6038 }
6039 }
6040
6041 if (vim_strchr(":=@>?/", name[0]) != NULL((void*)0) && len == 1) {
6042 return hist_char2type(name[0]);
6043 }
6044
6045 return HIST_INVALID;
6046}
6047
6048static int last_maptick = -1; // last seen maptick
6049
6050/// Add the given string to the given history. If the string is already in the
6051/// history then it is moved to the front. "histype" may be one of the HIST_
6052/// values.
6053///
6054/// @parma in_map consider maptick when inside a mapping
6055/// @param sep separator character used (search hist)
6056void add_to_history(int histype, char_u *new_entry, int in_map, int sep)
6057{
6058 histentry_T *hisptr;
6059
6060 if (hislen == 0 || histype == HIST_INVALID) { // no history
6061 return;
6062 }
6063 assert(histype != HIST_DEFAULT)((void) sizeof ((histype != HIST_DEFAULT) ? 1 : 0), __extension__
({ if (histype != HIST_DEFAULT) ; else __assert_fail ("histype != HIST_DEFAULT"
, "/home/runner/work/doc/doc/neovim/src/nvim/ex_getln.c", 6063
, __extension__ __PRETTY_FUNCTION__); }));
6064
6065 if (cmdmod.keeppatterns && histype == HIST_SEARCH) {
6066 return;
6067 }
6068
6069 /*
6070 * Searches inside the same mapping overwrite each other, so that only
6071 * the last line is kept. Be careful not to remove a line that was moved
6072 * down, only lines that were added.
6073 */
6074 if (histype == HIST_SEARCH && in_map) {
6075 if (maptick == last_maptick && hisidx[HIST_SEARCH] >= 0) {
6076 // Current line is from the same mapping, remove it
6077 hisptr = &history[HIST_SEARCH][hisidx[HIST_SEARCH]];
6078 hist_free_entry(hisptr);
6079 --hisnum[histype];
6080 if (--hisidx[HIST_SEARCH] < 0) {
6081 hisidx[HIST_SEARCH] = hislen - 1;
6082 }
6083 }
6084 last_maptick = -1;
6085 }
6086 if (!in_history(histype, new_entry, true1, sep)) {
6087 if (++hisidx[histype] == hislen) {
6088 hisidx[histype] = 0;
6089 }
6090 hisptr = &history[histype][hisidx[histype]];
6091 hist_free_entry(hisptr);
6092
6093 // Store the separator after the NUL of the string.
6094 size_t len = STRLEN(new_entry)strlen((char *)(new_entry));
6095 hisptr->hisstr = vim_strnsave(new_entry, len + 2);
6096 hisptr->timestamp = os_time();
6097 hisptr->additional_elements = NULL((void*)0);
6098 hisptr->hisstr[len + 1] = (char_u)sep;
6099
6100 hisptr->hisnum = ++hisnum[histype];
6101 if (histype == HIST_SEARCH && in_map) {
6102 last_maptick = maptick;
6103 }
6104 }
6105}
6106
6107/*
6108 * Get identifier of newest history entry.
6109 * "histype" may be one of the HIST_ values.
6110 */
6111int get_history_idx(int histype)
6112{
6113 if (hislen == 0 || histype < 0 || histype >= HIST_COUNT(HIST_DEBUG + 1)
6114 || hisidx[histype] < 0) {
6115 return -1;
6116 }
6117
6118 return history[histype][hisidx[histype]].hisnum;
6119}
6120
6121/// Get pointer to the command line info to use. save_cmdline() may clear
6122/// ccline and put the previous value in ccline.prev_ccline.
6123static struct cmdline_info *get_ccline_ptr(void)
6124{
6125 if ((State & MODE_CMDLINE0x08) == 0) {
6126 return NULL((void*)0);
6127 } else if (ccline.cmdbuff != NULL((void*)0)) {
6128 return &ccline;
6129 } else if (ccline.prev_ccline && ccline.prev_ccline->cmdbuff != NULL((void*)0)) {
6130 return ccline.prev_ccline;
6131 } else {
6132 return NULL((void*)0);
6133 }
6134}
6135
6136/// Get the current command-line completion type.
6137char_u *get_cmdline_completion(void)
6138{
6139 if (cmdline_star > 0) {
6140 return NULL((void*)0);
6141 }
6142 struct cmdline_info *p = get_ccline_ptr();
6143
6144 if (p != NULL((void*)0) && p->xpc != NULL((void*)0)) {
6145 set_expand_context(p->xpc);
6146 char *cmd_compl = get_user_cmd_complete(p->xpc, p->xpc->xp_context);
6147 if (cmd_compl != NULL((void*)0)) {
6148 return vim_strsave((char_u *)cmd_compl);
6149 }
6150 }
6151
6152 return NULL((void*)0);
6153}
6154
6155/*
6156 * Get the current command line in allocated memory.
6157 * Only works when the command line is being edited.
6158 * Returns NULL when something is wrong.
6159 */
6160char_u *get_cmdline_str(void)
6161{
6162 if (cmdline_star > 0) {
6163 return NULL((void*)0);
6164 }
6165 struct cmdline_info *p = get_ccline_ptr();
6166
6167 if (p == NULL((void*)0)) {
6168 return NULL((void*)0);
6169 }
6170 return vim_strnsave(p->cmdbuff, (size_t)p->cmdlen);
6171}
6172
6173/*
6174 * Get the current command line position, counted in bytes.
6175 * Zero is the first position.
6176 * Only works when the command line is being edited.
6177 * Returns -1 when something is wrong.
6178 */
6179int get_cmdline_pos(void)
6180{
6181 struct cmdline_info *p = get_ccline_ptr();
6182
6183 if (p == NULL((void*)0)) {
6184 return -1;
6185 }
6186 return p->cmdpos;
6187}
6188
6189/// Get the command line cursor screen position.
6190int get_cmdline_screen_pos(void)
6191{
6192 struct cmdline_info *p = get_ccline_ptr();
6193
6194 if (p == NULL((void*)0)) {
6195 return -1;
6196 }
6197 return p->cmdspos;
6198}
6199
6200/*
6201 * Set the command line byte position to "pos". Zero is the first position.
6202 * Only works when the command line is being edited.
6203 * Returns 1 when failed, 0 when OK.
6204 */
6205int set_cmdline_pos(int pos)
6206{
6207 struct cmdline_info *p = get_ccline_ptr();
6208
6209 if (p == NULL((void*)0)) {
6210 return 1;
6211 }
6212
6213 // The position is not set directly but after CTRL-\ e or CTRL-R = has
6214 // changed the command line.
6215 if (pos < 0) {
6216 new_cmdpos = 0;
6217 } else {
6218 new_cmdpos = pos;
6219 }
6220 return 0;
6221}
6222
6223/*
6224 * Get the current command-line type.
6225 * Returns ':' or '/' or '?' or '@' or '>' or '-'
6226 * Only works when the command line is being edited.
6227 * Returns NUL when something is wrong.
6228 */
6229int get_cmdline_type(void)
6230{
6231 struct cmdline_info *p = get_ccline_ptr();
6232
6233 if (p == NULL((void*)0)) {
6234 return NUL'\000';
6235 }
6236 if (p->cmdfirstc == NUL'\000') {
6237 return (p->input_fn) ? '@' : '-';
6238 }
6239 return p->cmdfirstc;
6240}
6241
6242/*
6243 * Calculate history index from a number:
6244 * num > 0: seen as identifying number of a history entry
6245 * num < 0: relative position in history wrt newest entry
6246 * "histype" may be one of the HIST_ values.
6247 */
6248static int calc_hist_idx(int histype, int num)
6249{
6250 int i;
6251 histentry_T *hist;
6252 int wrapped = FALSE0;
6253
6254 if (hislen == 0 || histype < 0 || histype >= HIST_COUNT(HIST_DEBUG + 1)
6255 || (i = hisidx[histype]) < 0 || num == 0) {
6256 return -1;
6257 }
6258
6259 hist = history[histype];
6260 if (num > 0) {
6261 while (hist[i].hisnum > num) {
6262 if (--i < 0) {
6263 if (wrapped) {
6264 break;
6265 }
6266 i += hislen;
6267 wrapped = TRUE1;
6268 }
6269 }
6270 if (hist[i].hisnum == num && hist[i].hisstr != NULL((void*)0)) {
6271 return i;
6272 }
6273 } else if (-num <= hislen) {
6274 i += num + 1;
6275 if (i < 0) {
6276 i += hislen;
6277 }
6278 if (hist[i].hisstr != NULL((void*)0)) {
6279 return i;
6280 }
6281 }
6282 return -1;
6283}
6284
6285/*
6286 * Get a history entry by its index.
6287 * "histype" may be one of the HIST_ values.
6288 */
6289char_u *get_history_entry(int histype, int idx)
6290{
6291 idx = calc_hist_idx(histype, idx);
6292 if (idx >= 0) {
6293 return history[histype][idx].hisstr;
6294 } else {
6295 return (char_u *)"";
6296 }
6297}
6298
6299/// Clear all entries in a history
6300///
6301/// @param[in] histype One of the HIST_ values.
6302///
6303/// @return OK if there was something to clean and histype was one of HIST_
6304/// values, FAIL otherwise.
6305int clr_history(const int histype)
6306{
6307 if (hislen != 0 && histype >= 0 && histype < HIST_COUNT(HIST_DEBUG + 1)) {
6308 histentry_T *hisptr = history[histype];
6309 for (int i = hislen; i--; hisptr++) {
6310 hist_free_entry(hisptr);
6311 }
6312 hisidx[histype] = -1; // mark history as cleared
6313 hisnum[histype] = 0; // reset identifier counter
6314 return OK1;
6315 }
6316 return FAIL0;
6317}
6318
6319/*
6320 * Remove all entries matching {str} from a history.
6321 * "histype" may be one of the HIST_ values.
6322 */
6323int del_history_entry(int histype, char_u *str)
6324{
6325 regmatch_T regmatch;
6326 histentry_T *hisptr;
6327 int idx;
6328 int i;
6329 int last;
6330 bool_Bool found = false0;
6331
6332 regmatch.regprog = NULL((void*)0);
6333 regmatch.rm_ic = FALSE0; // always match case
6334 if (hislen != 0
6335 && histype >= 0
6336 && histype < HIST_COUNT(HIST_DEBUG + 1)
6337 && *str != NUL'\000'
6338 && (idx = hisidx[histype]) >= 0
6339 && (regmatch.regprog = vim_regcomp((char *)str, RE_MAGIC1 + RE_STRING2))
6340 != NULL((void*)0)) {
6341 i = last = idx;
6342 do {
6343 hisptr = &history[histype][i];
6344 if (hisptr->hisstr == NULL((void*)0)) {
6345 break;
6346 }
6347 if (vim_regexec(&regmatch, hisptr->hisstr, (colnr_T)0)) {
6348 found = true1;
6349 hist_free_entry(hisptr);
6350 } else {
6351 if (i != last) {
6352 history[histype][last] = *hisptr;
6353 clear_hist_entry(hisptr);
6354 }
6355 if (--last < 0) {
6356 last += hislen;
6357 }
6358 }
6359 if (--i < 0) {
6360 i += hislen;
6361 }
6362 } while (i != idx);
6363 if (history[histype][idx].hisstr == NULL((void*)0)) {
6364 hisidx[histype] = -1;
6365 }
6366 }
6367 vim_regfree(regmatch.regprog);
6368 return found;
6369}
6370
6371/*
6372 * Remove an indexed entry from a history.
6373 * "histype" may be one of the HIST_ values.
6374 */
6375int del_history_idx(int histype, int idx)
6376{
6377 int i, j;
6378
6379 i = calc_hist_idx(histype, idx);
6380 if (i < 0) {
6381 return FALSE0;
6382 }
6383 idx = hisidx[histype];
6384 hist_free_entry(&history[histype][i]);
6385
6386 /* When deleting the last added search string in a mapping, reset
6387 * last_maptick, so that the last added search string isn't deleted again.
6388 */
6389 if (histype == HIST_SEARCH && maptick == last_maptick && i == idx) {
6390 last_maptick = -1;
6391 }
6392
6393 while (i != idx) {
6394 j = (i + 1) % hislen;
6395 history[histype][i] = history[histype][j];
6396 i = j;
6397 }
6398 clear_hist_entry(&history[histype][idx]);
6399 if (--i < 0) {
6400 i += hislen;
6401 }
6402 hisidx[histype] = i;
6403 return TRUE1;
6404}
6405
6406/// Get indices that specify a range within a list (not a range of text lines
6407/// in a buffer!) from a string. Used for ":history" and ":clist".
6408///
6409/// @param str string to parse range from
6410/// @param num1 from
6411/// @param num2 to
6412///
6413/// @return OK if parsed successfully, otherwise FAIL.
6414int get_list_range(char_u **str, int *num1, int *num2)
6415{
6416 int len;
6417 int first = false0;
6418 varnumber_T num;
6419
6420 *str = (char_u *)skipwhite((char *)(*str));
6421 if (**str == '-' || ascii_isdigit(**str)) { // parse "from" part of range
6422 vim_str2nr(*str, NULL((void*)0), &len, 0, &num, NULL((void*)0), 0, false0);
6423 *str += len;
6424 *num1 = (int)num;
6425 first = true1;
6426 }
6427 *str = (char_u *)skipwhite((char *)(*str));
6428 if (**str == ',') { // parse "to" part of range
6429 *str = (char_u *)skipwhite((char *)(*str) + 1);
6430 vim_str2nr(*str, NULL((void*)0), &len, 0, &num, NULL((void*)0), 0, false0);
6431 if (len > 0) {
6432 *num2 = (int)num;
6433 *str = (char_u *)skipwhite((char *)(*str) + len);
6434 } else if (!first) { // no number given at all
6435 return FAIL0;
6436 }
6437 } else if (first) { // only one number given
6438 *num2 = *num1;
6439 }
6440 return OK1;
6441}
6442
6443/*
6444 * :history command - print a history
6445 */
6446void ex_history(exarg_T *eap)
6447{
6448 histentry_T *hist;
6449 int histype1 = HIST_CMD;
6450 int histype2 = HIST_CMD;
6451 int hisidx1 = 1;
6452 int hisidx2 = -1;
6453 int idx;
6454 int i, j, k;
6455 char_u *end;
6456 char_u *arg = (char_u *)eap->arg;
6457
6458 if (hislen == 0) {
6459 msg(_("'history' option is zero")gettext((char *)("'history' option is zero")));
6460 return;
6461 }
6462
6463 if (!(ascii_isdigit(*arg) || *arg == '-' || *arg == ',')) {
6464 end = arg;
6465 while (ASCII_ISALPHA(*end)(((unsigned)(*end) >= 'A' && (unsigned)(*end) <=
'Z') || ((unsigned)(*end) >= 'a' && (unsigned)(*end
) <= 'z'))
6466 || vim_strchr(":=@>/?", *end) != NULL((void*)0)) {
6467 end++;
6468 }
6469 histype1 = get_histtype((const char *)arg, (size_t)(end - arg), false0);
6470 if (histype1 == HIST_INVALID) {
6471 if (STRNICMP(arg, "all", end - arg)strncasecmp((char *)(arg), (char *)("all"), (size_t)(end - arg
)) == 0) {
6472 histype1 = 0;
6473 histype2 = HIST_COUNT(HIST_DEBUG + 1) - 1;
6474 } else {
6475 emsg(_(e_trailing)gettext((char *)(e_trailing)));
6476 return;
6477 }
6478 } else {
6479 histype2 = histype1;
6480 }
6481 } else {
6482 end = arg;
6483 }
6484 if (!get_list_range(&end, &hisidx1, &hisidx2) || *end != NUL'\000') {
6485 emsg(_(e_trailing)gettext((char *)(e_trailing)));
6486 return;
6487 }
6488
6489 for (; !got_int && histype1 <= histype2; ++histype1) {
6490 STRCPY(IObuff, "\n # ")strcpy((char *)(IObuff), (char *)("\n # "));
6491 assert(history_names[histype1] != NULL)((void) sizeof ((history_names[histype1] != ((void*)0)) ? 1 :
0), __extension__ ({ if (history_names[histype1] != ((void*)
0)) ; else __assert_fail ("history_names[histype1] != NULL", "/home/runner/work/doc/doc/neovim/src/nvim/ex_getln.c"
, 6491, __extension__ __PRETTY_FUNCTION__); }));
6492 STRCAT(STRCAT(IObuff, history_names[histype1]), " history")strcat((char *)(strcat((char *)(IObuff), (char *)(history_names
[histype1]))), (char *)(" history"));
6493 msg_puts_title((char *)IObuff);
6494 idx = hisidx[histype1];
6495 hist = history[histype1];
6496 j = hisidx1;
6497 k = hisidx2;
6498 if (j < 0) {
6499 j = (-j > hislen) ? 0 : hist[(hislen + j + idx + 1) % hislen].hisnum;
6500 }
6501 if (k < 0) {
6502 k = (-k > hislen) ? 0 : hist[(hislen + k + idx + 1) % hislen].hisnum;
6503 }
6504 if (idx >= 0 && j <= k) {
6505 for (i = idx + 1; !got_int; ++i) {
6506 if (i == hislen) {
6507 i = 0;
6508 }
6509 if (hist[i].hisstr != NULL((void*)0)
6510 && hist[i].hisnum >= j && hist[i].hisnum <= k) {
6511 msg_putchar('\n');
6512 snprintf((char *)IObuff, IOSIZE(1024 + 1), "%c%6d ", i == idx ? '>' : ' ',
6513 hist[i].hisnum);
6514 if (vim_strsize(hist[i].hisstr) > Columns - 10) {
6515 trunc_string(hist[i].hisstr, IObuff + STRLEN(IObuff)strlen((char *)(IObuff)),
6516 Columns - 10, IOSIZE(1024 + 1) - (int)STRLEN(IObuff)strlen((char *)(IObuff)));
6517 } else {
6518 STRCAT(IObuff, hist[i].hisstr)strcat((char *)(IObuff), (char *)(hist[i].hisstr));
6519 }
6520 msg_outtrans(IObuff);
6521 ui_flush();
6522 }
6523 if (i == idx) {
6524 break;
6525 }
6526 }
6527 }
6528 }
6529}
6530
6531/// Translate a history type number to the associated character
6532int hist_type2char(int type)
6533 FUNC_ATTR_CONST
6534{
6535 switch (type) {
6536 case HIST_CMD:
6537 return ':';
6538 case HIST_SEARCH:
6539 return '/';
6540 case HIST_EXPR:
6541 return '=';
6542 case HIST_INPUT:
6543 return '@';
6544 case HIST_DEBUG:
6545 return '>';
6546 default:
6547 abort();
6548 }
6549 return NUL'\000';
6550}
6551
6552void cmdline_init(void)
6553{
6554 memset(&ccline, 0, sizeof(struct cmdline_info));
6555}
6556
6557/// Open a window on the current command line and history. Allow editing in
6558/// the window. Returns when the window is closed.
6559/// Returns:
6560/// CR if the command is to be executed
6561/// Ctrl_C if it is to be abandoned
6562/// K_IGNORE if editing continues
6563static int open_cmdwin(void)
6564{
6565 bufref_T old_curbuf;
6566 bufref_T bufref;
6567 win_T *old_curwin = curwin;
6568 win_T *wp;
6569 int i;
6570 linenr_T lnum;
6571 garray_T winsizes;
6572 char typestr[2];
6573 int save_restart_edit = restart_edit;
6574 int save_State = State;
6575 bool_Bool save_exmode = exmode_active;
6576 int save_cmdmsg_rl = cmdmsg_rl;
6577
6578 // Can't do this recursively. Can't do it when typing a password.
6579 if (cmdwin_type != 0
6580 || cmdline_star > 0) {
6581 beep_flush();
6582 return K_IGNORE(-((253) + ((int)(KE_IGNORE) << 8)));
6583 }
6584
6585 set_bufref(&old_curbuf, curbuf);
6586
6587 // Save current window sizes.
6588 win_size_save(&winsizes);
6589
6590 // When using completion in Insert mode with <C-R>=<C-F> one can open the
6591 // command line window, but we don't want the popup menu then.
6592 pum_undisplay(true1);
6593
6594 // don't use a new tab page
6595 cmdmod.tab = 0;
6596 cmdmod.noswapfile = 1;
6597
6598 // Create a window for the command-line buffer.
6599 if (win_split((int)p_cwh, WSP_BOT8) == FAIL0) {
6600 beep_flush();
6601 ga_clear(&winsizes);
6602 return K_IGNORE(-((253) + ((int)(KE_IGNORE) << 8)));
6603 }
6604 cmdwin_type = get_cmdline_type();
6605 cmdwin_level = ccline.level;
6606
6607 // Create empty command-line buffer.
6608 buf_open_scratch(0, _("[Command Line]")gettext((char *)("[Command Line]")));
6609 // Command-line buffer has bufhidden=wipe, unlike a true "scratch" buffer.
6610 set_option_value("bh", 0L, "wipe", OPT_LOCAL);
6611 curwin->w_p_rlw_onebuf_opt.wo_rl = cmdmsg_rl;
6612 cmdmsg_rl = false0;
6613 curbuf->b_p_ma = true1;
6614 curwin->w_p_fenw_onebuf_opt.wo_fen = false0;
6615
6616 // Don't allow switching to another buffer.
6617 curbuf->b_ro_locked++;
6618
6619 // Showing the prompt may have set need_wait_return, reset it.
6620 need_wait_return = false0;
6621
6622 const int histtype = hist_char2type(cmdwin_type);
6623 if (histtype == HIST_CMD || histtype == HIST_DEBUG) {
6624 if (p_wc == TAB'\011') {
6625 add_map((char_u *)"<buffer> <Tab> <C-X><C-V>", MODE_INSERT0x10, false0);
6626 add_map((char_u *)"<buffer> <Tab> a<C-X><C-V>", MODE_NORMAL0x01, false0);
6627 }
6628 set_option_value("ft", 0L, "vim", OPT_LOCAL);
6629 }
6630 curbuf->b_ro_locked--;
6631
6632 // Reset 'textwidth' after setting 'filetype' (the Vim filetype plugin
6633 // sets 'textwidth' to 78).
6634 curbuf->b_p_tw = 0;
6635
6636 // Fill the buffer with the history.
6637 init_history();
6638 if (hislen > 0 && histtype != HIST_INVALID) {
6639 i = hisidx[histtype];
6640 if (i >= 0) {
6641 lnum = 0;
6642 do {
6643 if (++i == hislen) {
6644 i = 0;
6645 }
6646 if (history[histtype][i].hisstr != NULL((void*)0)) {
6647 ml_append(lnum++, (char *)history[histtype][i].hisstr, (colnr_T)0, false0);
6648 }
6649 } while (i != hisidx[histtype]);
6650 }
6651 }
6652
6653 // Replace the empty last line with the current command-line and put the
6654 // cursor there.
6655 ml_replace(curbuf->b_ml.ml_line_count, (char *)ccline.cmdbuff, true1);
6656 curwin->w_cursor.lnum = curbuf->b_ml.ml_line_count;
6657 curwin->w_cursor.col = ccline.cmdpos;
6658 changed_line_abv_curs();
6659 invalidate_botline();
6660 if (ui_has(kUICmdline)) {
6661 ccline.redraw_state = kCmdRedrawNone;
6662 ui_call_cmdline_hide(ccline.level);
6663 }
6664 redraw_later(curwin, SOME_VALID35);
6665
6666 // No Ex mode here!
6667 exmode_active = false0;
6668
6669 State = MODE_NORMAL0x01;
6670 setmouse();
6671
6672 // Reset here so it can be set by a CmdWinEnter autocommand.
6673 cmdwin_result = 0;
6674
6675 // Trigger CmdwinEnter autocommands.
6676 typestr[0] = (char)cmdwin_type;
6677 typestr[1] = NUL'\000';
6678 apply_autocmds(EVENT_CMDWINENTER, typestr, typestr, false0, curbuf);
6679 if (restart_edit != 0) { // autocmd with ":startinsert"
6680 stuffcharReadbuff(K_NOP(-((253) + ((int)(KE_NOP) << 8))));
6681 }
6682
6683 i = RedrawingDisabled;
6684 RedrawingDisabled = 0;
6685 int save_count = save_batch_count();
6686
6687 /*
6688 * Call the main loop until <CR> or CTRL-C is typed.
6689 */
6690 normal_enter(true1, false0);
6691
6692 RedrawingDisabled = i;
6693 restore_batch_count(save_count);
6694
6695 const bool_Bool save_KeyTyped = KeyTyped;
6696
6697 // Trigger CmdwinLeave autocommands.
6698 apply_autocmds(EVENT_CMDWINLEAVE, typestr, typestr, false0, curbuf);
6699
6700 // Restore KeyTyped in case it is modified by autocommands
6701 KeyTyped = save_KeyTyped;
6702
6703 cmdwin_type = 0;
6704 cmdwin_level = 0;
6705
6706 exmode_active = save_exmode;
6707
6708 // Safety check: The old window or buffer was deleted: It's a bug when
6709 // this happens!
6710 if (!win_valid(old_curwin) || !bufref_valid(&old_curbuf)) {
6711 cmdwin_result = Ctrl_C3;
