6712 emsg(_("E199: Active window or buffer deleted")gettext((char *)("E199: Active window or buffer deleted")));
6713 } else {
6714 // autocmds may abort script processing
6715 if (aborting() && cmdwin_result != K_IGNORE(-((253) + ((int)(KE_IGNORE) << 8)))) {
6716 cmdwin_result = Ctrl_C3;
6717 }
6718 // Set the new command line from the cmdline buffer.
6719 xfree(ccline.cmdbuff);
6720 if (cmdwin_result == K_XF1(-((253) + ((int)(KE_XF1) << 8))) || cmdwin_result == K_XF2(-((253) + ((int)(KE_XF2) << 8)))) { // :qa[!] typed
6721 const char *p = (cmdwin_result == K_XF2(-((253) + ((int)(KE_XF2) << 8)))) ? "qa" : "qa!";
6722
6723 if (histtype == HIST_CMD) {
6724 // Execute the command directly.
6725 ccline.cmdbuff = (char_u *)xstrdup(p);
6726 cmdwin_result = CAR'\015';
6727 } else {
6728 // First need to cancel what we were doing.
6729 ccline.cmdbuff = NULL((void*)0);
6730 stuffcharReadbuff(':');
6731 stuffReadbuff(p);
6732 stuffcharReadbuff(CAR'\015');
6733 }
6734 } else if (cmdwin_result == Ctrl_C3) {
6735 // :q or :close, don't execute any command
6736 // and don't modify the cmd window.
6737 ccline.cmdbuff = NULL((void*)0);
6738 } else {
6739 ccline.cmdbuff = vim_strsave(get_cursor_line_ptr());
6740 }
6741 if (ccline.cmdbuff == NULL((void*)0)) {
6742 ccline.cmdbuff = vim_strsave((char_u *)"");
6743 ccline.cmdlen = 0;
6744 ccline.cmdbufflen = 1;
6745 ccline.cmdpos = 0;
6746 cmdwin_result = Ctrl_C3;
6747 } else {
6748 ccline.cmdlen = (int)STRLEN(ccline.cmdbuff)strlen((char *)(ccline.cmdbuff));
6749 ccline.cmdbufflen = ccline.cmdlen + 1;
6750 ccline.cmdpos = curwin->w_cursor.col;
6751 if (ccline.cmdpos > ccline.cmdlen) {
6752 ccline.cmdpos = ccline.cmdlen;
6753 }
6754 if (cmdwin_result == K_IGNORE(-((253) + ((int)(KE_IGNORE) << 8)))) {
6755 ccline.cmdspos = cmd_screencol(ccline.cmdpos);
6756 redrawcmd();
6757 }
6758 }
6759
6760 // Avoid command-line window first character being concealed.
6761 curwin->w_p_colew_onebuf_opt.wo_cole = 0;
6762 wp = curwin;
6763 set_bufref(&bufref, curbuf);
6764 win_goto(old_curwin);
6765 if (win_valid(wp) && wp != curwin) {
6766 win_close(wp, true1, false0);
6767 }
6768
6769 // win_close() may have already wiped the buffer when 'bh' is
6770 // set to 'wipe', autocommands may have closed other windows
6771 if (bufref_valid(&bufref) && bufref.br_buf != curbuf) {
6772 close_buffer(NULL((void*)0), bufref.br_buf, DOBUF_WIPE, false0, false0);
6773 }
6774
6775 // Restore window sizes.
6776 win_size_restore(&winsizes);
6777 }
6778
6779 ga_clear(&winsizes);
6780 restart_edit = save_restart_edit;
6781 cmdmsg_rl = save_cmdmsg_rl;
6782
6783 State = save_State;
6784 may_trigger_modechanged();
6785 setmouse();
6786
6787 return cmdwin_result;
6788}
6789
6790/// @return true if in the cmdwin, not editing the command line.
6791bool_Bool is_in_cmdwin(void)
6792 FUNC_ATTR_PURE FUNC_ATTR_WARN_UNUSED_RESULT
6793{
6794 return cmdwin_type != 0 && get_cmdline_type() == NUL'\000';
6795}
6796
6797/// Get script string
6798///
6799/// Used for commands which accept either `:command script` or
6800///
6801/// :command << endmarker
6802/// script
6803/// endmarker
6804///
6805/// @param eap Command being run.
6806/// @param[out] lenp Location where length of resulting string is saved. Will
6807/// be set to zero when skipping.
6808///
6809/// @return [allocated] NULL or script. Does not show any error messages.
6810/// NULL is returned when skipping and on error.
6811char *script_get(exarg_T *const eap, size_t *const lenp)
6812 FUNC_ATTR_NONNULL_ALL FUNC_ATTR_WARN_UNUSED_RESULT FUNC_ATTR_MALLOC
6813{
6814 const char *const cmd = (const char *)eap->arg;
6815
6816 if (cmd[0] != '<' || cmd[1] != '<' || eap->getline == NULL((void*)0)) {
6817 *lenp = STRLEN(eap->arg)strlen((char *)(eap->arg));
6818 return eap->skip ? NULL((void*)0) : xmemdupz(eap->arg, *lenp);
6819 }
6820
6821 garray_T ga = { .ga_data = NULL((void*)0), .ga_len = 0 };
6822 if (!eap->skip) {
6823 ga_init(&ga, 1, 0x400);
6824 }
6825
6826 const char *const end_pattern = (cmd[2] != NUL'\000' ? (const char *)skipwhite(cmd + 2) : ".");
6827 for (;;) {
6828 char *const theline = eap->getline(eap->cstack->cs_looplevel > 0 ? -1 : NUL'\000', eap->cookie, 0,
6829 true1);
6830
6831 if (theline == NULL((void*)0) || strcmp(end_pattern, theline) == 0) {
6832 xfree(theline);
6833 break;
6834 }
6835
6836 if (!eap->skip) {
6837 ga_concat(&ga, theline);
6838 ga_append(&ga, '\n');
6839 }
6840 xfree(theline);
6841 }
6842 *lenp = (size_t)ga.ga_len; // Set length without trailing NUL.
6843 if (!eap->skip) {
6844 ga_append(&ga, NUL'\000');
6845 }
6846
6847 return (char *)ga.ga_data;
6848}
6849
6850/// Iterate over history items
6851///
6852/// @warning No history-editing functions must be run while iteration is in
6853/// progress.
6854///
6855/// @param[in] iter Pointer to the last history entry.
6856/// @param[in] history_type Type of the history (HIST_*). Ignored if iter
6857/// parameter is not NULL.
6858/// @param[in] zero If true then zero (but not free) returned items.
6859///
6860/// @warning When using this parameter user is
6861/// responsible for calling clr_history()
6862/// itself after iteration is over. If
6863/// clr_history() is not called behaviour is
6864/// undefined. No functions that work with
6865/// history must be called during iteration
6866/// in this case.
6867/// @param[out] hist Next history entry.
6868///
6869/// @return Pointer used in next iteration or NULL to indicate that iteration
6870/// was finished.
6871const void *hist_iter(const void *const iter, const uint8_t history_type, const bool_Bool zero,
6872 histentry_T *const hist)
6873 FUNC_ATTR_WARN_UNUSED_RESULT FUNC_ATTR_NONNULL_ARG(4)
6874{
6875 *hist = (histentry_T) {
6876 .hisstr = NULL((void*)0)
6877 };
6878 if (hisidx[history_type] == -1) {
6879 return NULL((void*)0);
6880 }
6881 histentry_T *const hstart = &(history[history_type][0]);
6882 histentry_T *const hlast = (
6883 &(history[history_type][hisidx[history_type]]));
6884 const histentry_T *const hend = &(history[history_type][hislen - 1]);
6885 histentry_T *hiter;
6886 if (iter == NULL((void*)0)) {
6887 histentry_T *hfirst = hlast;
6888 do {
6889 hfirst++;
6890 if (hfirst > hend) {
6891 hfirst = hstart;
6892 }
6893 if (hfirst->hisstr != NULL((void*)0)) {
6894 break;
6895 }
6896 } while (hfirst != hlast);
6897 hiter = hfirst;
6898 } else {
6899 hiter = (histentry_T *)iter;
6900 }
6901 if (hiter == NULL((void*)0)) {
6902 return NULL((void*)0);
6903 }
6904 *hist = *hiter;
6905 if (zero) {
6906 memset(hiter, 0, sizeof(*hiter));
6907 }
6908 if (hiter == hlast) {
6909 return NULL((void*)0);
6910 }
6911 hiter++;
6912 return (const void *)((hiter > hend) ? hstart : hiter);
6913}
6914
6915/// Get array of history items
6916///
6917/// @param[in] history_type Type of the history to get array for.
6918/// @param[out] new_hisidx Location where last index in the new array should
6919/// be saved.
6920/// @param[out] new_hisnum Location where last history number in the new
6921/// history should be saved.
6922///
6923/// @return Pointer to the array or NULL.
6924histentry_T *hist_get_array(const uint8_t history_type, int **const new_hisidx,
6925 int **const new_hisnum)
6926 FUNC_ATTR_WARN_UNUSED_RESULT FUNC_ATTR_NONNULL_ALL
6927{
6928 init_history();
6929 *new_hisidx = &(hisidx[history_type]);
6930 *new_hisnum = &(hisnum[history_type]);
6931 return history[history_type];
6932}
6933
6934static void set_search_match(pos_T *t)
6935{
6936 // First move cursor to end of match, then to the start. This
6937 // moves the whole match onto the screen when 'nowrap' is set.
6938 t->lnum += search_match_lines;
6939 t->col = search_match_endcol;
6940 if (t->lnum > curbuf->b_ml.ml_line_count) {
6941 t->lnum = curbuf->b_ml.ml_line_count;
6942 coladvance(MAXCOL);
6943 }
6944}
